1.content:
"Oh man, I thought this day would never end!" moaning, you muttered.

You plopped onto a couch in the sitting room of your home, happy that it was finally the weekend. This new school you and your friends had transferred into was a real pain. It combined the middle and high school into one joined building, making it almost a literal mad house in the halls between classes. You had thought it would be easier, being able to mingle in with the higher class men but no such luck. Still, you had your friends Jack and Tonya.

You thought of your brothers. You knew that Tex was with Jack, out fishing by the lake and that Mat was up in his room, playing with his action figures. Then you thought of your eldest brother James, having just vanished a year ago without a word or any signs of where he might have gone. He was popular enough at school and he had no enemies. You and Tonya had asked around but no one knew anything, it was as if he simply fell off the planet.

Tonya tried to comfort you a few times by trying to get you to try out for the cheer squad but you were not sure about the cheer captain, Christina Wells. She seemed to have something against those younger than her and often treated them poorly. Tonya only made it on the team because she has great skills and the coach asked her to sign up, some thing that infuriated Christina greatly.

You sighed, remembering your dad saying that James was finally coming home that night, and leaned back in the couch only to feel something hard against your back. You reached behind you and pulled out a large faded book.

"Chaotic Science?" reading the title, you asked. "As in mad science? You can't be serious."

You had believed in science but not mad science, it was just a made up phrase for movies and books. Jack and Tonya did not believe in mad science either and were weary towards the concept of magic. You wondered who had brought it in the house and if it was a joke at your expense. Normally, you would have just put it down and walk away but something was drawing you to open the book. Just as you touched the cover to do so, you heard someone call your name...

James looked at me and smiled. "Looking good, sis." bemused, he said. "Or should I call you bro now."

11211222312132.content:
"Why are you doing this to me?!" Annoyed, you demanded. "You nearly scared me half to death!"

"Come now, child; you should know me better than that by now." Lightly scolding, dad countered. "I would never do anything to deliberately harm you or any of my other children." He smiled. "You should have seen the way I introduced mad science to James before sending him to Eligere Sententia."

James shuddered slightly. "Your example was mild by comparison." Ruefully, he said. "The power we mad scientists wield demands great responsibility."

"Hence the safe guards, including the armored glass for dangerous serums." Smiling, dad added. He then turned serious. "As James can tell you, mad scientists are brutally tested before they acquire their laboratory; witches are tested in a similar manner."

"What kind of tests?" Nervous, you asked.

"Everyone's test is different." Calmly, James replied. "No one knows what test they will face or when but they all usually occur within the span of a few months in one given year."

"These tests are a necessary part of both a mad scientist's and witch's life." Serious, dad said. "This was a precursor to your own test and the only hint you will get."

"I was given a hint as well while in training only I was not told it was a hint." Darkly, James said. "Consider yourself lucky on that point."

You sighed. "May I go now?"

Dad nodded and waved his hand. You felt a sudden rush before finding yourself back in the sitting room where you began. Disoriented for a moment, you looked around then moaned upon seeing that you were still a boy. "Dad, can you change me back to normal now?!"

No answer came and you huffed in frustration. "I hope this event, as they call it, wears off soon."
11211222312132.title: A warning of future tests.

choices: Skip to your date with Jackie.
112112223121321.content:
You jumped, hearing the doorbell. Without thinking, you walked to the front door and opened it to find a teenage girl with shoulder length raven hair and green eyes looking at you desperately. Your eyes went wide when you saw that she was wearing the boy's school uniform. "Tex, can we talk?" In a hushed voice, she asked. "It's really important!"

"Jack?!" Stunned, you asked. "Is that you?!"

Jack blushed, not knowing how cute it made her look. "I don't know how this happened!" Tearfully, she wailed. "I got home, looked in the mirror and saw a teen girl where I was supposed to be!"

You sighed then quickly pulled Jack inside and closed the door. "It looks like dad or one of my brothers decided to have some fun with you." Bemused, you said. "They already had their fun with me."

"Your dad did this?!" Wide eyed, Jack demanded. "Can he change me back?"

"Your panic, although predicable, is unwarranted." Entering the room, dad said. "Yes, I and my sons are mad scientists and Jessica, Jessie for now, is a witch." He smiled. "Like my transformed daughter, you will change back in a fortnight... Jackie"

Jack, or rather, Jackie turned red with impatience. "Why did you do this to me?! I demand some answers, Mr Moray!"

"I will be happy to answer your questions, my emotional neighbor." Smiling, dad said. "I did this to you so you two would not feel as awkward being together during the weekend." His smile grew as he added, "You are still going out on a casual outing tonight, is that correct?"

Both you and Jack blushed brightly, causing dad to chuckle. "By doing this, your weekend plans are not disrupted, just made more interesting." Amused, he said. "I'm certain this will prevent you two from having too many new experiences."

You understood what dad was getting at and winced. "Dad! Ew!"

Dad laughed slightly. "This and many other strange things will be common place in a family of witches and mad scientists... young lady." Smiling, he told Jackie. "You might as well join in the fun if you intend to date my daughter."

With that said, dad quietly left the room to his study where James was waiting. "How did it go?" Smiling, James asked.

"Better than expected." Grinning, dad replied. "This is the perfect first test for Jessica. If her love for Jack is as strong as Jack's love for her, gender will not stop them from falling deeper in love."

"Who will be observing the two love birds on their first date?" Raising an eyebrow, James asked.

Dad smiled and raised a single fist. "Rock, paper, scissors?"

James sighed before chuckling.
112112223121321.title: Jack comes to visit but he is different.

"Yeah, not the way I pictured our casual outing to start." Wincing, Jackie replied.

"That won't help you, I'm afraid." Worried, Jackie said.

She followed you to your room where you both peered in to see that your room had been left as it was which brought a sigh of relief from you. "At least you can change into something more comfortable." you said.

"Do you seriously think I'd feel comfortable in a skirt or dress?" Unnerved, Jackie demanded.

"I had thought of wearing a flattering dress on our first d... err, outing." Blushing, you admitted. "Still, if we want to go out tonight, you have to pick something."

"So do you, at my house." Sighing, Jackie said.

You winced at that then motioned to the room. "Just pick something you think you can tolerate wearing for one night." You gulped. "Unless you rather just call it off and wait for us to return to normal."

Jackie gulped at that as well. It took him weeks just to get your dad to agree to him taking you out on an outing alone. She half thought dad planned this from the start to prevent the date, or rather, outing. She looked at you as you wondered what she was going to decide.

Finally, Jackie decided to...
1121122231213211.title: You and Jackie talk.

11211222312132111.content:
"Are you okay in there?" Curious, you asked to your closed bedroom door. "You've been changing clothes for at least twenty minutes now."

"Sorry, I'm new at wearing girls clothing." Sarcastically, Jackie called back. "I'm almost done."

"Do you need some help?" Offering, you asked. "It's not like you have anything I haven't seen in the mirror before dad changed me."

"I'm just having trouble with the zipper." Sighing, Jackie replied. "Why is it always in the back on these dresses instead of the front or the side?"

You giggled slightly. "You decided to wear a dress?" Bemused, you asked. "I'm coming in."

You opened the door before Jackie could protest and gasped seeing her in the flattering dress you had bought for the outing. It was a beautiful ivory dress with white silk lace and a moderate V collar that showed off a little cleavage. There was a slit on the left side of the dress that stopped just below the thigh. The sash was white with ivory trim which Jackie managed to tie into a cute bow in the back. You giggled seeing her struggle to reach the zipper then zipped it up for her. The dress fit her very well as it accented her curves beautifully.

"You look incredible in that dress, Jackie." Smiling, you complimented. "I hope you remembered to wear a slip and the proper undergarments."

Jackie blushed. "I think your father helped in that department." Ruefully, she replied. "It was as if i had put everything on a hundred times; I just couldn't get the zipper."

"Most girls need help with that." Smiling, you said.

Jackie sighed. "Well, I have a nice suit at home you can change into."

"I have a lovely suit Jessie can wear." Calling from the hall, dad offered. "There is no need to be running about so just to get ready for a casual outing."

You rolled your eyes, knowing dad was trying to have as much 'fun' with of your situation as he can. You looked out into the hall and saw dad holding up...
11211222312132111.title: wear the flattering dress you had bought.

Dad grinned. "This suit is made of vicuna wool, a very rare camelid from South America." Calmly, he explained. "The inner layer is one hundred percent Charmeuse silk. The cuff links are pure gold and the buttons are made of black spider web turquoise."

Both your Jackie's jaw dropped. "Dad are you insane!" Pale, you blurted out. "I'm anxious just being near that suit let alone wearing it!"

"Nothing but the best for my transformed daughter on his first date, or rather, outing." Grinning madly, dad replied. "You will look daringly devastating in it."

Before you could respond, you found yourself wearing the suit. A scream escaped your lips as dad took a picture of you and Jackie standing side by side. "Daddy..." Pouting, you protested.

Dad chuckled, maintaining his mad grin. "You two make such a compatible couple." Gushing, he said. "The dress, however needs a little something extra to really make you both stand out in a crowd."

"I don't like the sound of that." Nervous, Jackie muttered.

You opened your mouth to protest only dad had already cast his event. Jackie's dress was now...
112112223121321111.title: an expensive tuxedo

1121122231213211111.content:
... a wedding dress, and it wasn't just something that could be passed off as an ordinary white dress. It was a monstrous parody of something from a little girl's fantasy, with the worst of the 1980's. White gloves covered Jackie's arms until they met a massive puffed sleave. The skirt part was bell shaped and massively oversized, to the point where moving indoors would become problematic. All three puffs were connected by a embossed bodice that gave almost no indication of Jackie's shape. The only good thing about it is that it completely covered Jackie's feminine body, but for the moment you was horrified.

"What have you done, daddy?" you pouted. "That was my favorite dress! It's ruined...."

Jackie was even more upset. "What have you done to me!?! Get this thing off me at ONCE! I'm not going anywhere dressed like this!"

"Why not? You two look the perfect couple" dad teased.

"Are you insane? Why am I even asking? Of course you are" Jackie snapped.

'You know what. Forget this. I don't feel like going out" you said, clearly showing your annoyance. "Turn her back at once. Clothes too."

Dad sighed. "You're no fun."

"Fun? You call this fun!" Jackie snapped. She tried to pull apart her dress, but it was too puffy for her to remove. "Jess."

You took a step forward, wanting to help, but you quickly reconsidered, considering what dad had done to both of you. Instead, you decided to talk, rather than try to pull it off. "Daddy. How can either of us enjoy ourselves looking like this? Even if I was the bride..."

"Don't say that" Jackie said, looking even more uncomfortable.

You ignored her. "... you're going to ruin everything."
1121122231213211111.title: the wedding dress from hell

11211222312132111111.content:
Dad grinned madly. "Nonsense, my dear impatient child." Clearly amused, he said. "You are merely arrogant to the ways of the mad scientist."

You turned red, angry with dad. "Father..."

"When the daughter of a mad scientist confesses her true love to a young suitor, a grand ball is arranged to celebrate the occasion." Smiling dad explained. "This is such an event." He then turned serious. "I will not allow either of your impatience or arrogance to disrupt such a time tested and honored tradition. Have I made myself clear?"

The dark tone of dad's voice forced you and Jackie to gulp. "Why the gender swap, though?" Pouting, you demanded. "Is that really necessary, daddy?"

Dad's smile returned. "I can see how that aspect of the tradition would leave you feeling stressed." More calmly, he said. "However, it is necessary but you will understand perfectly before this is over."

You sighed, not liking this at all. Only dad seemed determined to have you and Jackie attend this ball in honor of yours and Jackie's 'love'. Still, you were not sure if it was really love, not completely anyway. "How do you know this is real love, daddy?" Taking a chance, you asked. You then turned to Jackie and winced. "No offense..."

Dad chuckled. "I know because of Jackie's clothing choice." Bemused, he replied. "Had it been a mere crush, she would have worn something far more modest." He smiled at Jackie. "Also, this is not a 'wedding' as you fear but something close to it."

You blushed knowing dad was right about Jackie's clothing choice, causing her to blush in return but you were confused by dad's second comment about it not being a wedding. "I would hope this is not a wedding, daddy." Worried, you said. "Only you scare me when you say its something close to it."

Dad smiled. "This is very important, dear child." Patiently, he said. "Will you trust me?"

You winced, not knowing what to say. Dad was not making any sense at all and his actions were making less sense. You had no doubt dad felt what he was doing was very important but you knew he was keeping you in the dark for the most part.

Before you could respond....

112112223121321111111.content:
Before you could respond, a deep rumble was heard that shook the floor beneath you. Dad turned towards the front door, a rare look of fear on his face. "It has started earlier than I had calculated." Darkly, he muttered. "This is bad..."

"What has started?" Confused, you asked.

The front door suddenly flew open and a literal avalanche of letters flew into the house, flying everywhere! Both you and Jackie screamed in fright but paused as not a single letter reached you. They were all hitting an invisible barrier, burning to ashes the second they did. You sighed, knowing dad had set up that shield.

"What's going on?!" Startled, Jackie demanded.

"They are love letters for you, Jessica." Serious, dad explained. "The time of choosing has come only I held out a bit too long. I was foolish in that regard. I apologize."

"The time of choosing?" Worried, you asked. "What are you talking about?"

"In a moment, dear." waving his hands, dad said. "I must first deal with this first wave of would be suitors."

The letters stopped moving and flew backwards, back out the front door with a new door appearing into place before locking with a heavy deadbolt. One the flurry of letters were gone, dad sighed. "The Moray family has ruled over all mad scientists in this world for centuries." Calmly, he explained. "We are considered royalty." He smiled at you. "That makes you a princess, my dear."

You were taken back by this news as you were a fan of fantasy novels and movies. "So this day of choosing is when I am expected to choose a prince?" Disturbed, you asked. "I thought the choice was always mine when it came to picking a boyfriend."

"It is." Softly, dad replied. "However, that does not stop those wanting to enter the royal family name to court for your affections." He turned to Jackie. "You were the first to court her, before even knowing of her legacy; which is why I was so careful to test you first."

"Why the gender change?" Her anger ebbing, Jackie demanded.

"To throw off the would be suitors." Smiling slightly, dad said. "As a male, it changes her aura. That makes it harder for the suitors to track her down." He chuckled. "It also introduces you to mad science in a fun way... if you call it fun, that is."

"So what do we do now?" Nervous, you asked. "If so many boys are out to try to sweep me off my feet..."

"We have the grand ball as planned." Serious, dad replied. "The sooner it is announced that you had made your first choice, the sooner you will be back in your proper gender and the other suitors will be forced to back down, for a while."

"You mean they'll keep trying?" Startled, you asked.

Dad nodded, his face serious. "The other suitors can try to persuade you to leave Jack over them or persuade Jack to leave you for another girl." Calmly, he said. "I was hoping to avoid this issue but my timing was off and it is now my responsibility to ensure nothing happens to the two of you before the first choice is announced."

"Where is this ball being held?" Nervous, Jackie asked.

Dad smiled. "We go to the ball immediately!"

In a flash, you and Jackie found yourselves...

You stumbled, feeling dizzy and nauseous. Your vision was blurred slightly, making it hard to determine where you were. Dad placed a firm hand onto your shoulder, allowing you to keep your balance. You saw Jackie and knew she was having the same troubles.

"Teleportation can be an unnerving experience the first time." Calmly, Dad said. "I promise you, though it is harmless and you will get used to it after a while."

"Where are we?" Blinking, you demanded.

"We are in the mansion home of your grandfather, Devlin Moray." Smiling, dad said. "More specifically, the grand ball room. As the head mad scientist, your grandfather hosts these events."

You vision slowly returned and you saw Jackie still wearing the wedding dress from hell while you were in the insanely expensive tuxedo. Dad was wearing a similar suit to your own only with silver cuff links and black pearl buttons. He smiled kindly at you and motioned to the hall where you saw your grandfather, a tall dark elderly man standing in the middle of the room. He was sporting an eighteenth century gentleman's suit with unusually long coat tails that moved about as if they had a mind of their own. He wore knee high riding boots, a top hat covering his raven black hair, and carried a silver tipped cane with a large diamond. His eyes hid behind round shining glasses while he held a toothy, almost sinister grin.

"Welcome to my humble home, dear grandchild." Grinning, Devlin said. "Rest assured that your new manliness is only a temporary situation." He then turned to Jackie. "Greetings, young suitor. I have heard much about you from my son and grandchildren." He flashed her a sinister grin. "I am eager to see if what I had heard is completely accurate."

Jackie gulped but decided to remain silent to which dad stated, "You have nothing to fear, child."

"Indeed." Smiling, Devlin said. "All that I have heard leads me to believe that you truly have affections for my granddaughter and she for you. This ball is to celebrate her choosing you over so many other interesting candidates."

"When will the others arrive, my mentor?" Politely, dad inquired.

"Mentor?" Curious, you asked.

"Everyone must refer to me by my first name or title, including family." Calmly, Devlin explained. "It helps remove most chances of lesser mad scientists claiming favoritism."

"I call him my mentor as that is who he is to me." Smiling, dad said.

"So, what must I call you?" Worried, you asked.

Devlin smiled. "You may call me Devlin." Simply, he said. "Those outside of the family call me sir."

You nodded then turned to see someone entering the ball room. It was...
1121122231213211111112.title: inside a huge ball room.

11211222312132111111121.content:
Your aunt Viva Vogue entered the room wearing a dress similar to the one Jackie was wearing only it was ivory in color and shimmering with real diamond dust. Viva was your mother's older sister and a near mirror image of her; tall and slender with long black hair and hazel eyes. Every time you saw her, it reminded you of mom who had passed away shortly after Matt was born. To her left was her seven year old daughter, Zoe while to her right was her eight year old son, Ty.

Zoe was about Matt's height with long black hair and emerald blue eyes. She was a fantasy and fairy tale fanatic and looked excited to wear a puffy ballroom gown. Ty was a few inches taller than Zoe with red hair and hazel eyes. He was surprisingly strong and fast for an eight year old and seemed to have it in his head that it was his duty as the 'man of the house' to protect his mom and sister. It was a self given role he took very seriously and tended to be overly protective to an annoying degree. He looked rather dashing in a black tuxedo with diamond cuff links and gold buttons. He scanned the room before nodding to which Viva giggled slightly.

"You need not be my night in shinning armor, Ty." Smiling, she said. "This is your grandfather's mansion; I assure you that security is very tight here."

"No security is flawless, mom." Serious, Ty said. "It doesn't hurt to be alert."

Viva sighed then turned to you. "Congratulations on making your first choice, dear!" Gushing, she said. "I'm pleased you chose before the love letters came in droves."

"It's a bit much to deal with." Wincing, you said.

"Your bother's will go through similar trials in their own time." Kindly, Viva said. "This is but the first of many choice that will face you in the year to come."

"What do you mean?" Worried, you demanded.

Dad cleared his throat. "I was hoping to save that for after the dance, dear sister in law." Scolding lightly, he said. He then turned to you. "Your aunt is referring to her family's legacy."

Viva smiled motioning to the entry where a tall and slender elderly woman had just entered. She had long, flowing black hair with silver highlights and fiery hazel eyes. "Jessie, please allow me to introduce you to my mother, Ella Mist, the head witch."

Your eyes widened like saucers. First you learned that mad science was real and that you were in some mad scientist royal family. Now you are told that you are also a part of some magical royal family as well. It became all too much for you...

"Be at peace, child." Kindly, calmly, Ella said. "Take everything in a little at a time."

"Why are Jack and I the only ones gender bent?" Wincing, you asked.

"Security protocol." Smiling, Ella replied. "Your brothers will be wearing dresses when their time of choosing comes to hand." She giggled seeing you stifle a laugh. "This event is to introduce your first choice as a boyfriend to the rest of the family and to introduce (giggle) her to our little secret."

Jackie blushed at that to which you blushed as well. Devlin motioned to a table across the hall. "We have a wide variety of snacks and refreshments ready for everyone to enjoy." Smiling, he said. "I assure you that... most of them are perfectly normal."

Ella laughed. "Devlin, you are such a tease!" Lightly scolding, she said. "You are going to frighten poor Jackie away before the real fun begins."

Jackie gulped. "Real fun?" Fearful, she squeaked. "What are you talking about?"

"They are talking about the dance, child." Lightly, dad explained. "You are in the presence of two powerful families; one with magic and the other with mad science." He smiled kindly at you and Jackie. "For example, we could end up dancing on the ceiling."

"I promise you that, if you keep an open mind, you will have fun tonight." Kindly, Devlin said. "This is just the beginning of the journey for both of you."

"I was kind of hoping my first date would be a little more private." Sighing, you whispered.

"I thought you only wanted a casual outing." Amused, dad said. He then turned serious. "You will have your first date with Jack and it will be private. For now, please enjoy the ball and introduce... Jackie to the rest of the family."

"Let us get some refreshments." Motioning you to follow, Ella suggested. "I wish to speak with you alone for a moment, if I may."

You nodded then followed Ella to the table while Devlin and dad held a conversation with Jackie. "What did you want to talk to me about, grandma?" Curious, you asked.

"First, like Devlin, you must call me by my first name or madam head witch when in public." Serious, Ella said. "As for what I wish to talk about regards my role as the head witch." She sighed. "My daughter, your aunt Viva is next in line for the throne of head witch. Only she must choose a lover before she can take the throne. Viva swore never to love another when her husband passed away..."

"What does that have to do with me?" Confused, you asked. Then it hit you and a gasp escaped your throat as Ella slowly nodded. "I have chosen a potential lover so..."

"That makes you the next in line to take the throne when I step down." Serious, Ella said. "Understand that this development has left more than a few witches feeling nervous."

You gulped glancing at aunt Viva. "I take it I'm not the only one being bombarded with love letters." Wincing, you said. "I guess a young girl becoming 'queen' would make anyone nervous."

"It's not just that, child." Calmly, Ella said. "It is the fact that you are the granddaughter of the head mad scientist; many witches fear Devlin would use his influence over you to control the witching world."

"Grandpa, I mean Devlin would never do that!" Taken back, you protested. "He's the kindest person I had ever met in my life! We would not take advantage..."

"On the same coin, there are many mad scientists who fear that, being his granddaughter, you could sway Devlin to make decisions that would favor the witching world." Bemused, Ella interrupted. "You are essentially a key piece in the chess game witches and mad scientists play."

"That's insane..." Fearful, you whispered.

Ella gave you a rueful smile. "Please do not allow this to give up your love for Jack." Kindly, she pleaded. "I have many years yet before I must step down; plenty of time for witches and mad scientists alike to get over their fears."

"We hope." Smiling slightly, you said.
112112223121321111111211.title: you meet your grandmother.

1121122231213211111112111.content:
Moments later, James entered with Tex and Matt in tow. Each of them wore similar outrageously expensive suits with Jackie's mother, Rena wearing an exquisite gown. She was tall and slender with shoulder length black hair and green eyes. There was no sign of Jackie's father, Rio but that did not surprise you. Last you heard, he worked for some strange sort of police force that investigates unusual crimes in the area.

James was well over two inches taller than you with a near perfect physique, sporting short brown hair and fire hazel eyes that seemed to sparkle like real fire. Your twin brother, Tex, right behind him, had a similar build to yourself with the same jet black hair but fire hazel eyes like his brother. Matt was short and slender for his age with longish brown hair, green eyes, and wolf like ears. You had long believed it was a strange birth defect or something along those lines. Only now, you had a feeling there was more to it.

"You look good in a suit, Jessie." Smiling, James teased. "We'll make a man out of you yet."

"You will have your turn to sport a dress." Frowning, you countered.

James chuckled. "Patience, my dear transformed sister." Maintaining his smile, he said. "This is a time of celebration and happiness." He grinned. "I would not dream of taking you out of the spotlight."

"What's the big deal?" Confused, Matt asked. "Why all the hoopla over Jessica going out with Jack?"

Ella giggled. "It's a little above you, Matt." Bemused, she said. "Just think of it as the two families getting to know each other better in a fun way." She motioned to the tables. "There are plenty of snacks to sample, if you wish to have a nibble before the banquet."

Matt smiled then eagerly ran for the tables while you and Ella laughed. "Matt certainly loves to eat." Bemused, you said. "I just can't figure out where he puts it all."

"Matt is a rare boy." Cryptically, Ella said. "He will have a rough transition once he comes of age."

"What do you mean, Ella?" Curious, you asked.

"It's his ears." Smiling, Tex said. "It makes him almost irresistible.

Ella nodded, somewhat sadly. "Yes... his ears."

This worried you slightly and you were about to press for more answers only...
1121122231213211111112111.title: your bothers arrive with Jackie's family.

11211222312132111111121111.content:
"I do hope I am not too fashionably late for the festivities." Entering the ballroom, a male voice said.

You turned and immediately winced seeing a tall and muscular man with short black hair and ivory green eyes standing in the doorway; it was your uncle, Damien Cain. He was Viva's and Maria's step brother; the product of Ella's late first husband, Raz Cain and the black sheep of the family. She remarried to Axel Mist only Damien refused to change his last name in honor of his biological father. That alone did not make him the black sheep of the family; it was his habit of toying with witches and non-magical girls who had the misfortune to cross his path. He would change them into boys of various ages and sometimes cause them to fall in love with a nice girl before allowing 'nature to take its course'. It was his psychotic mischief that lead him to be branded a quasi psycho or a troubled mad scientist.

"I do not recall sending you an invitation." In a forced calm, Devlin said.

"Keep out and off limits are not in a mad scientist vocabulary, my patient and fearless leader." Bowing, Damien said. "If I am here without an invite then your security requires some... adjustments."

Devlin flashed a toothy grin only you swore you could hear his teeth grinding. "A well played comeback, my dear son in law." Calmly, he said. "I believe my grandson, Ty had said it best; no security is flawless."

"There are no flaws in your security, Devlin." Calmly, Ella said. "I invited Damien to avoid any claims of favoritism." She then added in a whisper, "Which, I am sure you are aware he will take full advantage of."

Devlin sighed before motioning Damien to enter. "Please enjoy the festivities." Smiling, he said. His smile then turned sinister before adding, "Do behave yourself while you are here. I would not enjoy having to remove you from my home."

Damien gulped but returned the smile. "I shall be the perfect gentleman, as always." He then turned to you, grinning madly. "I see you are experiencing your masculine side, my ever cautious niece. Have you yet explored your potential for chaotic science?"

"Actually, I just discovered all of this just today." Nervous, you replied. "I'll grant you that this might make an interesting experiment later but right now... it's a lot to take in."

Damien chuckled, as if in sheer delight. "Your first day of discovery and already you are speaking of future experiments!" Gushing, he said. "You make your uncle and dear departed grandfather proud!"

"That's not what I..." Taken back you began. Only you saw the madness in Damien's eyes and finished saying, "We need to take things one step at a time, uncle; an untrained scientist is a poor scientist."

Damien's face lit up, his mad smile turning to that of something close to genuine. "You are wise as well as cautious." Happily, he said. "Please consider taking the path of mad science." He laughed, motioning top Jackie. "Gender will not stand in the way of your true love and life itself will become the greatest of experiments for you both!"

"Um... we have plenty of time to take that into consideration." Finding her voice, Jackie said. "For now, I suggest we merely enjoy the festivities Devlin Moray has so generously and graciously arranged for us."

"Quite right!" Enthusiastic, Damien said. "I shall leave you two to discuss the endless possibilities while I engage the buffet!"

After he had left to fill a plate of food, Viva walked up to you with a bemused look on her face. "Well played, you two." Smiling, she said. "Damien is not usually so easily persuaded to end a conversation." She giggled. "I believe you two now hold the record of the fastest time to be rid of him."

Devlin chuckled madly. "Like father like daughter..." Amused, he said.

You and Jackie smiled at that.
11211222312132111111121111.title: someone crashes the party.

112112223121321111111211111.content:
The party began in earnest with several guests pouring in shortly after Damien's arrival. They were all relatives and their closest friends, most of whom you really did not know. Introductions were made which you and Jackie politely greeted. Fortunately, small talk was not the way of a mad scientist unless it was about comparing notes of who had the most accomplishments in their respective fields of study. Any talk that came directly your way was of the greatness you could achieve at one of the many mad science schools in the world. Your witch relatives were more talkative but, again, their focus of topic was of the witch schools and the wonders they offered to young witches learning their inherited powers. Dances seemed to be popular in these events only, as dad had told you, some of them were literally on the ceiling or on the walls or even in the air. Surprisingly, you found it fun and were soon smiling as you and Jackie danced together around the hanging chandeliers.

Once the first song had ended and everyone returned to standing on the floor, James motioned you to a figure standing next to him. "Dear brother, I would like to introduce you to my professor from Eligere Sententia." Smiling, he said. "Professor Nero Osis, I give you my transformed sister, Jessie."

Professor Nero Osis was a muscular man of average height with messy, longish black hair. He wore a boomer hat, and a black suit covered by a long white lab coat. He bowed slightly, revealing bright hazel eyes under thick glasses with goggles hung onto his hat. He gave a toothy grin, saluting you with a wolf's head cane. "It is an honor to meet you, my dear." Politely, he said. "Are you coping well with your temporary new form?"

"I'm trying not to think about it." Blushing, you said. "It's very awkward and rather uncomfortable."

Nero chuckled, though kindly. "Any major change will take time to adjust to." Kindly, he said. "I have heard mad scientists and witches alike tell you of the many wonders each school can offer you. Have you given any of them some consideration?"

"Not without any material on the schools to look over later." Politely, you answered. "No offense but leaping before looking can and will lead to nasty surprises."

Nero laughed. "I like how you twist words of wisdom to explain your actions or lack of them." Smiling, he said. "They show that you are quick on your feet." He smiled kindly. "I have no doubt that there will be plenty of material for you to look over before the party ends." He then turned to Jackie. "You will be receiving material as well... young lady."

"Why me?" curious, Jackie asked.

Nero smiled. "Ask your mother." Cryptically, he replied. "It is not my place to tell you directly."

Jackie threw you a concerned look before Nero turned back to you. "Please enjoy the party. The bonding ceremony will begin in due time."

With that, he walked off to talk to other mad scientists. You frowned seeing them produce paperwork before noticing your witch relatives doing the same. A giggle reached your ears and you turned to see aunt Viva standing next to you. "As I explained, you are a valuable chess piece at this moment." Kindly, she said. "It is to be expected that mad scientists and witches alike will try to compel you to visit their schools but do not lose heart." She smiled. "I have been receiving love letters as well, all trying to get me to claim my place in the royal line to the throne. Your father is having the same experience."

"It's just so much to take in..." Sighing, you said.

Viva nodded, maintaining her smile. "Welcome to our world, my dear."
112112223121321111111211111.title: The party begins.

1121122231213211111112111111.content:
After a number of dances, Devlin called for everyone's attention. "Family, friends, and honored guests, the bonding ceremony is about to begin." Courtly, he said. "This time tested and honored tradition gives a couple the freedom to explore their feelings for one another without direct interference from those who would wish to steal their love away."

The crowd applauded before Devlin continued. "Before the ceremony, it is custom for those who wish to compete give one last effort to win the heart or hearts of the couple though a carefully thought out speech." Smiling, he said. "Those who have not attempted to win these hearts before this ceremony are, of course not permitted this privilege." Moans were heard from mad scientists and witches alike, bringing a sinister smile to Devlin's face. "This law has been in place for hundreds of years; it should come as no surprise."

You looked around and noticed that a number of young mad scientists had indeed had a speech written out with the intent to win your heart, which unnerved you. What was more unnerving was that there were a number of witches who also had a speech prepared. You made a note to ask dad or Devlin about it later. Once the room settled down again, Devlin motioned everyone into the next room where you and Jackie found a church like setting. Dad escorted you to the alter while everyone took their seats while Jackie's father, Paul Stone stood by Jackie's side at the entrance.

"What's with the wedding scene?" Carefully, you asked dad.

"It's all a part of the ceremony." Whispering, dad replied. "Have patience, it will not take long."

Devlin stood before you at the alter while dad took his seat in the front row. That was when 'here comes the bride' began to play on an organ and Paul slowly walked Jackie to the alter then took a seat next to dad just as the music finished playing. You gulped and turned to Jackie who seemed just as nervous.

"Dearly Bemused, we are gathered here to witness the solemn bonding between Jessie Moray and Jackie Stone as boyfriend and girlfriend." Smiling, Devlin said. "This marks Princess Jessica's first choice of a love interest, a sacred moment in any witch or mad scientist household."

You heard a number of young mad scientists crying softly in the audience and quickly realized the love letters that had stormed your house earlier were from a number of them, a last ditch effort to win your heart over Jack. This unnerved you as you knew dad must have been preventing these letters from reaching you the moment Jack showed interest in you romantically.

"Do you, Jessie Moray, take Jackie Stone to be your girlfriend? To honor and defend, to love and to hold to cherish for as long as you do not break up?" Suddenly serious, Devlin asked.

You blushed, smiling then replied, "I do."

Devlin cleverly hid a grin then turned to Jackie with the same serious expression. ""Do you, Jackie Stone, take Jessie Moray to be your boyfriend? To honor and defend, to love and to hold to cherish for as long as you do not break up?"

Jackie also blushed then smiled as she responded, "I do."

"Then, by the power vested in me by the mad science collective, I pronounce you boyfriend and girlfriend." smiling, Devlin said. "You may now kiss."

Although you and Jackie were blushing brightly, you both leaned in and passionately kissed as the witnesses to the event cheered. Devlin gave out a maniacal laugh before changing you and Jackie back to your original forms with the appropriate clothing and yelled out, "I give you Princess Jessica and Prince Jack Stone!"

Jack turned to Devlin, startled. "Prince...?"

Devlin nodded. "Did you not know?" Amused, he asked. "It should make for a riveting conversation after the reception." He motioned to the hall. "Please make your way back to the ball room so we may celebrate your bond with each other."

You and Jack walked down the aisle together with the witnesses following to the reception.
1121122231213211111112111111.title: The bonding ceremony begins.

11211222312132111111121111112.content:
The reception was surprisingly fun with dancing and speeches abound. The young mad scientists who you heard weep during the bonding ceremony appeared to be upbeat. However, given the news of your position in the 'royal family', you knew that they were planning and plotting ways to lure you away from Jack or lure him away from you. Still, it was an enjoyable evening and you were smiling upon returning home. Dad had waved his hand, replacing the insanely expensive dress with casual clothing for you, doing the same for Jack's suit before motioning you both to follow him to his study.

"I know Devlin told you that you were a prince, Jack." Calmly, he said. "Take a seat, both of you, and I will explain the situation in full."

You and Jack took a seat, not knowing what to expect but what dad had to say blew both of your minds. "Witches and real magic has only existed on this world for roughly two hundred years. Through an epic disaster of a grand experiment, a rift into a parallel world was opened. Hundreds of witches and witch boys were thrown into our world while hundreds of mad scientists and their female relatives were cast into their world, flooding both with an 'alien' power."

"That is insane!" Gasping, you said.

Dad nodded. "The mad scientists here were attempting to open a portal to alien worlds within our own universe." Serious, he said. "On the other side, according to reports, a rogue witch government was attempting to open a gateway to a mythological realm of pure magic and reap its endless power."

"Let me guess." Frowning, Jack said. "As the witching world is parallel to our own, it is in the same universe while the power of mad science is the mythological realm of endless power."

Dad again nodded. "Correct." He then smiled. "This is where it gets interesting."

"What do you mean?" Curious, you asked.

"In this world, girls of mad science families have limited elemental power as mad science is based on the five elements." Calmly, dad explained. "Normally, girls only have power only two alike elements and are considered weak compared to their mad science brothers. However, a growing number have the power over all five, earth, fire, wind, water, and metal. This makes them very powerful indeed. We call these talented girls Amazons."

"What of the other world?" Curious, you asked.

"The boys of witch families are blessed with physical power through enhanced attributes and senses." Serious, dad said. "There were a few whose dormant magical power had awakened and taken root but were not strong enough to break the barrier, keeping them male. It instead increased their already enhanced attributes to impressive levels. The witches called them Ironclads."

"What does that have to do with me?" Nervous, Jack demanded.

Dad chuckled. "Like Jessica, your ancestors came from that alien world." Smiling, dad said. "Your father was the son of a witch while your mother was the daughter of a mad scientist. You, Jack Stone, are the heir to the throne as king of the Ironclads in this world."

This shocked both you and Jack as you tried to take it all in.
11211222312132111111121111112.title: After the reception.

112112223121321111111211111121.content:
"Are you telling me that there are four powers in this world?" Stunned, you asked.

"There are two main powers in this world, mad science and magic." Calmly, dad said. "The power of the Amazon is from dormant chaotic power taking root that is not strong enough to break the gender barrier as is the power of the Ironclads only their power is magic based."

"So the Amazons and Ironclads are sub kingdoms." Guessing, Jack said. "Bound by the laws of their respective powers but able to sort of govern themselves."

Dad nodded. "That is correct." Maintaining his calm, he said. "The Amazons fall under the same laws as the mad scientists but have the freedom to make laws to govern themselves so they have an Amazon queen. The Ironclads fall under the same laws as witches but enjoy the same freedom so they have a king."

"I might be the strongest boy in my school but I don't think I have the power you are describing, Mr M." Politely, Jack pointed out. "That and I never saw dad use such powers before."

Dad grinned. "You never saw me use my powers before Jessica discovered the truth." Bemused, he countered. "Just because you do not see it does not necessarily mean it does not exist."

"Good point." Sighing, Jack said.

Dad chuckled. "Your power will surface on your thirteenth birthday, as will Jessica's magical power." Smiling, he said. "Your bonding had bridged the gap between the two worlds." His grin widened. "Another reason for unfounded fears among those who wish to maintain the status quo."

"What of the Amazons?" Curious, you asked. "Who is their queen?"

Dad laughed, his grin giving you an idea. Seeing your expression, dad nodded and replied...
112112223121321111111211111121.title: You demand more answers.

choices: A flame ignites in your left hand.
1121122231213211111112111111211.content:
"You got to be kidding!" Stunned, you said. "Tonya is the queen of these Amazons?!"

"Well, heir to the throne." Smiling, dad said. "Her mother, Christina Holmes, is the official queen."

"Doesn't she need to have a love interest to be queen?" Confused, Jack asked.

"Christina Holmes is still married to Maximus Holmes." Grinning, dad said. "He is merely constantly on the move as he serves as a liaison for the two 'sub kingdoms', being immune to both magic and chaotic energy. He has sometimes even been asked to negotiate deals between witches and mad scientists."

"Talk about having all your eggs in one basket." Nervous, you muttered.

Dad chuckled. "I can assure you that we are all well protected." Bemused, he said. "I can also assure you that Tex will soon have his turn for the bonding ceremony once he gets enough courage to officially ask Tonya out on their first date."

"Do you think Tonya will be flooded with love letters just as I was?" Worried, you demanded.

"She already is." Turning serious, dad said. "Upon Mrs. Holmes request, I have been screening the letters, only allowing those through with sincere interest to trickle through and excluding those laced with magic or chaotic energy to enhance their effectiveness."

You shook your head. "So that was how a few love letters found their way to me."

Dad nodded. "Make no mistake, I reviewed Jack's letters to you as well, young lady." Serious, he said. "Jack's letters were true and from the heart." He turned to Jack. "Do not take this personally, young man. It goes far deeper than the act of a protective father."

You half expected Jack to explode, knowing his private mail was reviewed prior to you getting it. You were tempted to explode right along with him. However, to your surprise, Jack nodded. "Given your position, I would have done the same thing." Calmly, he said.

Dad gave a genuine smile. "I appreciate your restraint." Kindly, he said. "You will find that, when it is your turn to select an heir, you too will be screening your son's correspondence."

Jack later left on good terms to speak to his family about what he had learned from dad and you walked to your room, trying to take everything in. You were a witch princess while Jack was an Ironclad prince. Your best friend, Tonya was an Amazon princess and Tex was a prince in a mad science royal family.

"It all seems surreal." Entering your room, you said. "I wonder what tomorrow will bring."

The following morning...
1121122231213211111112111111211.title: Your friend Tonya Holmes.

choices: I want an in house teacher.
It's too early in the morning!
11211222312132111111121111112111.content:
The flame ignited just as you were about to open your door to start the day. Yo jumped away from the door, screaming and began to wave your hand in an attempt to put the flame out. Dad came running into your room with James following. Both were very concerned at first, having heard your screams. Only upon seeing the flame in your left hand, they both chuckled.

"Jessica, my dear, calm down." Bemused, dad called out. "That is merely your magic taking root."

"It's only natural for her to react this way, father." Calmly, James retorted. "You did not warn her of how her magic would surface."

"No, I didn't." Smiling, dad said. "I wanted to see the look on her face." He chuckled. "It's priceless!"

"Ha. Ha." unimpressed, you said. "Can you please help me put this out?"

"Just make a light fist, Jessica." Sighing, James instructed. "The flame will go out."

Yo did so and were relieved to see the fire go out. You then turned to dad and James, your eyes demanding an explanation.

"All young witches freak out when their magical flame first appears." Smiling, dad said. "Just as all young mad scientists freak when their first spark ignites." He motioned to James, amused. "Your eldest brother ran throughout the house in a blind panic when his first ignited."

"Father..." Blushing, James protested.

You held back the urge to giggle imagining the seemingly always calm James running around the house, screaming in fear. "It had to be quite an experience." Bemused, you said.

"It is for all witches and mad scientists." Regaining his composure, James said. "The point is your flame gives a hint of how powerful your magic is."

"Your flame revealed that you have very powerful magic, just like your mother did." Turning serious, dad said. "You will require training but I can either arrange for a teacher to come here to train you or send you to one of the two magic schools in the area."

"You could, of course learn mad science." Grinning, James suggested. "However, it is not my place to sway you either way. Though you would achieve greatness through science."

"You're bias." Smiling, you teased.

"I am merely stating an opinion." Unfazed, James said.

"I must get you started on your training, Jessica." Serious, dad said. "What is your choice?"

After a moment, you replied...
11211222312132111111121111112111.title: A flame ignites in your left hand.

112112223121321111111211111121113.content:
"It's too early in the morning!" Pouting, you protested. "Can I at least have breakfast first?"

Dad grinned before waving his hand. Instantly, a table appeared with a literal banquet of breakfast foods appeared in front of you with a chair to sit in. "Bon-Appetit." Smiling, he said. "After you eat, I wish to show you something your mother had prepared for this day."

"Mom made me something?" Tearing up, you asked.

Dad nodded. "It is something normally handed down from mother to daughter." Somewhat sadly, he said. "Only it is now my duty to walk you through the first steps into the witching world."

With that, dad left you to get dressed and eat with James silently following him. You teared up more, thinking of mom. She passed away a few short years after your youngest brother, Matt was born. You had not seen much of him or your twin brother, Tex since the other day when you first discovered the chaotic science book. You wondered what they had been up to.

Once you had gotten dressed and finished breakfast, dad returned to your room and pointed to your closet. "This will seem strange but I need you to trust me." Serious, he said. "Walk with me into your closet and close the door."

"Okay..." Taken back, you said.

It was certainly a very strange request but you had seen stranger things in the past several hours so you walked into your closet with dad following and closed the door. Upon doing so, dad pointed to a door that had suddenly appeared in the back of the closet. "This door will only appear when the closet door is closed and there is a magical presence within it." Serious, dad said. "I can not enter through these means and neither can your brothers." He then smiled, adding, "Unless they are willing to become females for a time."

You giggled slightly at that then opened the door to reveal a spiral staircase. Curious, you walked up the stairs with dad following to a spacious attic you did not know existed before. You looked about in both curiosity and awe. The room took up the entire width and length of the house with a vaulted ceiling painted to look like the night sky. All of the far walls were covered with books from floor to ceiling with the exception of a small door on the far side near the rear of the house where your bedroom lied on the second floor.

On the far side of the room was a small workshop with a number of broomsticks with tools you guessed were used to repair them. Next to it was a sizable chemistry station which you also guessed was to make magical potions to defend yourself against other witches. Aunt Viva had told you that you were a key piece in the political games that witches and mad scientists play and guessed that not all witches or mad scientists were united.

In the center of the room was a huge cauldron surrounded by a maze of hanging gardens with tables throughout, no doubt to assemble ingredients for potions. There were sectioned off areas of the room, hidden by office divider walls that you saw served as a form of infirmary and or nap area for over night projects. There was also a crow, standing on the edge of the large cauldron staring at you. The crow itself did not unsettle you; it was the magical power you sensed coming from it. You remembered mom telling you stories about animals such as crows or cats that can accumulate magical power, though they can not use it. She told you that they can grant that power to augment the magical power of a witch they chose to bond with. These creatures were called familiars. You knew that mom had a pet crow but you thought it died shortly after she did.

Dad spoke, pulling you out of your train of thought. "Jessica, this was your mother's sanctuary." He spoke with a hint of pride and sadness. "Normally, it is the mother's duty to introduce a young witch to her first lair to study magic. However, with her gone, the responsibility and honor falls onto me."

"All of this is mine?" Awestruck, you asked.

Dad nodded then motioned to the crow. "This is Neva." Calmly, he said. "She is a familiar and the guardian of your lair. Viva acquired her for you immediately after the bonding ceremony last night." He smiled, adding, "Neva will be loyal only to you until the day you pass on to the next realm."

"Um... hi, Neva." Nervous, you said.

Neva gave a quick nod before squawking, "Much to learn you have."

You giggled. "Where do I start?"

Neva pecked at the cauldron then squawked, "Make a call!"

Dad chuckled. "I have decided that it would be best if you learn at home under the guidance of your aunt Viva who will be teaching you through a magical technique."

"What sort of technique?" Curious, you asked.

Suddenly, a poof of green smoke erupted from the cauldron startling you. Within the smoke, an image of aunt Viva appeared. "Greetings, child." Kindly, she said. "I will be teaching you the art of magic through a form of video conference with me entering your lair for lessons that require a more hands on approach."

"Welcome to your first lair, Jessica." Hugging you, dad said. "I only wish your mother could be here to witness this event."

"Thanks, dad." Hugging dad back, you said. "You did a great job, mom would be proud."

"Perhaps you would like to join us as I give her a tour." Smiling, Viva offered.

Dad smiled then sighed as Tex could be heard screaming in the house. "I fear my duty as a single father calls; it would seem that Tex has discovered his first spark."

"I'll be fine, dad." Smiling, you said. "Go help Tex."

Dad smiled then bowed before leaving your lair.
112112223121321111111211111121113.title: A father, daughter moment.

choices: try to ride the broom in the lair.
1121122231213211111112111111211133.content:
As dad left what was now your attic lair, Viva became solid as she stepped down from the cauldron and stood before you. "Your magic lessons will be done at night while my children are sleeping." Kindly, she said. "They are too young to know about magic or mad science."

"It looks like I will have to get used to a new sleep schedule." Sighing, you said.

Viva smiled. "The lessons are only four hours long and there is a bed here to sleep in if you are too tired to climb down the staircase." Calmly, she said. "Come, we will begin with a quick tour while Zoe is still at ballet and Ty is still at pee wee football practice."

You smiled, thinking of your cousins. Zoe was much like yourself at the age of seven, hyper and always looking for adventure. She was tall for her age with long black hair and emerald blue eyes. Ty was about two inches taller with red hair and hazel eyes. He was surprisingly strong and fast for an eight year old and seemed to have it in his head that it was his duty as the 'man of the house' to protect his mom and sister. Normally, you would find that cute but Ty is protective to an annoying degree and had gotten into a number of fights with other boys at school.

"We will start with the cauldron." Smiling, Viva said. "This seemingly normal, although rather large, pot is for using potions and spells from a distance as well as for travel, quick escapes, and communications with other witches."

"Quick escapes?" Worried, you asked.

"For when you need to make a potion fast, you teleport into your lab through the cauldron." Simply, Viva said. "The maze of gardens around the cauldron are for making potions as well as medicines for many purposes."

"What of the entire wall of books on either side of the door coming in here?" Curious, you asked.

"Those are books you will need to read." To your shock, Viva replied. She giggled at your reaction. "Don't worry, I'll teach you a spell that will help you read and memorize them in a fraction of the time you are fearing."

You sighed at that as Viva then led you to a closed in area with a bed. "This is where you will go in case you get injured during any of your lessons." Serious, Viva said. "Either your father or I will very quickly come to patch you up from any injury." She giggled. "What type of riot act you get later will depend upon who responds first."

You hoped you will not get injured at all during your lessons. You knew that Viva could be very strict when it came to serious lessons in life and that dad was even more so. You decided it best to change the subject. "What of the workshops on the other side of the room?"

Viva smiled. "That is the broom stick workshop where you will build your very first broom." With a bemused grin, she said. "I find it a bit cliche but many young witches view riding a broom as a rite of passage into the witching world."

The thought of riding a broom, although 'impossible' was a fantasy of yours when you were a child and the notion of getting your own broom seemed to rekindle that childhood fascination. "When will I make my first broom?" Curious, you asked.

Viva giggled. "You are a long way from making your first broom, let alone riding one." Amused, she said. "Your mother's broomstick is in the closet there near the workshop." She pointed to a large closet in the far corner of the room then raised a finger of warning. "I only told you because I know you will look for it eventually. Do not try to ride it; you are not ready."

With that, she concluded the tour and walked into the green smoke of the cauldron and vanished from the room. You looked at the cauldron and then to the broom closet. Neva flew up from her perch among the bookshelves and landed onto one of the tables of the work station.

"Don't do it!" Loudly, she squawked.

"I just want to look at it." Opening the closet, you said. "There is no harm in that."

Neva immediately squawked back, "You'll be sorry!"

Mom's broom was elegant. The handle was of solid, polished oak and the bristles were made of strong grapevines; woven together with a thick wire like thread. There was a leather strip that you assumed was the saddle and two metal pieces attacked to the oak handle near the bristles where you guessed you were supposed to put your feet.

"It's beautiful..." In awe, you whispered.

"Put it back!" Hopping on the table, Neva squawked.

Part of you wanted to put it back, knowing that Viva would not agree with you riding it when you had not even had your first magic lesson. Yet, another part of you was screaming to give it a try, even if it was just inside the lair. Finally, you decided to....
1121122231213211111112111111211133.title: A tour of your lair.

11211222312132111111121111112111331.content:
With a heavy sigh, you carefully put the broom back into the closet and closed the door. "I so wanted to try it." Disappointed, you muttered. "Even for just a few minutes."

Neva gave out a show caw before flying up onto your shoulder. "Read a book." Quietly, she squawked. "Knowledge is power."

You walked to the long wall of books on either side of the door leading to the staircase. "There are so many books." Taking them in, you whispered. "Where to start?"

Neva hopped off your shoulder and flew to one shelf close by and pecked at a large green book, giving an occasional caw to get your attention. Curious, you pulled the green book from the shelf and looked at it. "I know this book." Your eyes widening, you said. "Mom used to read this to me when I was a little girl."

You smiled slightly, remembering mom. She was tall and slender with long jet black hair and emerald blue eyes. She would read the book to you every night before you fell asleep each night. Closing your eyes, you began to recite the book word for word.

"Paragraphs fill the pages to weave many a tale. Stories of the seasons from summer's sun to winter's gale..."

Unknown to you, as you recited the words of the book, the other books were flying off of the shelves on their own and were circling you. You could almost see every page of every book but you were too focused on your memories of mom and the green book to notice.

"Flying through the books into many worlds, you will follow a trail. Exploring fantasies and truths that can make you wonder or leave you pale..."

The contents of the book, though you were not yet aware, were flooding your mind, entering your permanent memory like an instant education of the magic the books taught. The contents of the green book mom had read to you before bed was the spell to gain the knowledge of the books she had saved for you.

"Through your growing knowledge, you will prevail. Another power will lift you up should you fall so keep heart, you shall never fail..."

You teared up as you finished reciting the first page of the green book as the other books silently flew back to their positions on the shelves. "Mommy..."

After a few moments, you decided to...
11211222312132111111121111112111331.title: put the broom back.

112112223121321111111211111121113312.content:
Not knowing that you had cast a powerful spell, you were surprised to suddenly feel so very tired. You shrugged it off, thinking it was from all the excitement of the day and began to walk towards the spiral staircase back to your bedroom. Only you spotted the bed in your lair and wondered if you could sleep there for the night as it was still the weekend.

"I wonder how many nights mom spent sleeping up here." Sleepily, you muttered.

Deciding to play it safe, you text dad to ask if you could spend the night in the lair. Dad responded, texting back...
112112223121321111111211111121113312.title: go to bed, suddenly tired.

1121122231213211111112111111211133123.content:
You smiled upon seeing dad's text. "He can be so cool sometimes." Whispering, you said.

A frown touched your lips as dad texted back, Thanks for calling me 'cool'. "Do you have cameras up here, dad?" Annoyed, you demanded.

"I have eyes on you at all times." Inside your head, dad replied. "Remember your position in this world; it is either I watching over you or a twenty four hour body guard service."

You sighed. "Have you been doing this all my life?" Worried, you asked.

"Fear not, I am not watching over you with any elaborate video or audio surveillance." Amused, dad replied. "I merely know where you and your siblings are at all times and what you are doing. It better enables me to protect you without having to physically be in your presence."

Dad's voice then silenced and you walked to the bed in the corner of your lair. There were clean sheets and a blanket waiting for you. The sheet and blanket covered you on their own and the lights dimmed. Neva flew onto a perch over the bed and watched over you as you slept into the night. The green book where you had read the spell, not knowing it was a spell was still in your grasp.

You woke up in the middle of the night, hearing a strange sound. At first, you thought it was your imagination, sleeping in a new place for the first time. Only you saw Neva staring at the area where you heard the noise which meant she had heard it too. "Who's there?" Whispering, you demanded. "Show yourself!"

11211222312132111111121111112111331231.content:
It was a black cat with a bushy tail and red eyes. It stared at you and Neva, still but poised to jump at a second's notice. You tried to get up but the covers held you firm. You turned to the cat, fearful that it had something to do with it. The cat took a step forward, causing you to worry and want to fight against the blankets holding you down. You knew you were not trained in magic, you had not even gotten your first lesson. As the cat took another step forward, it gave a low hiss to your crow, Neva who gave a squawk of warning. It was then you somehow suddenly knew what to do. You wiggled your fingers, willing the sheet and blanket to fly off you; they did instantly and you jumped to your feet.

The cat froze, its hair standing up right as it hissed at you. Neva gave a powerful cry, shaking the room and sending the cat flying into the far wall. As if you had been trained all your life, you summoned a flame to your hand. The flame was the size of a basketball, which surprised you but panicked the cat. It gave a frightful cry and backed towards the open window where you guessed it had come. You had no intentions to harm the cat, you just wanted to know where it came from and why it chose to enter your lair.

"Who sent you here?" Firmly but kindly, you demanded. "Is she another witch?"

The cat only responded with a growl and a hiss, keeping its eyes on your flame and on Neva who had moved to another perch, squawking warnings at it. You took a step closer and the cat ran for the window and leaped out. You turned to Neva who had flown to the window, squawking angrily at the cat for its invasion. You turned back to the cat to see it hop onto the back of a broom with a small dark feminine figure riding it. She looked up at you, not revealing her face and flew off into the cloudy night sky. You were temped to go after her but you were not certain if it was a wise choice, given your lack of experience.

"Who was she, Neva?" Shaken, you asked.

Neva hoped away from the window and squawked, "Curiosity should have killed that cat!"

You sighed. "I wonder if satisfaction will bring it back."

Nervous and uncertain, you turned to the closet where mom's broomstick was stored. Hours earlier, you had no idea how to fly a broom but now you somehow knew exactly what to do, it was baffling to you. Still, you needed answers and the longer you hesitated, the further away the mysterious witch would be...

You flew through a large arched door that lead up through the large chimney of the house, into the night sky. It did not take you long to spot the mysterious witch and you flew after her. It was only your intention to find out what she wanted.

The mysterious girl flew her broom away from the house, careening through alleys and side streets which were all thankfully clear of any people. You managed to stay on her tail, calling out to her to stop and listen. "Hold up!" Irritated, you yelled. "I just want to talk!"

You were so focused on catching up with the mysterious girl that you did not realize that you were now far away from home in a neighborhood you did not recognize. The girl finally stopped and lowered her broom to the ground with you following. "Didn't you hear me back there?" Dismayed, you demanded. "Why did you send your cat into my lair? Did you not sense that the rest of my family are mad scientists?"

"Oh, I sensed that." Calmly, the girl replied. Her voice was soft but cold. "I just wanted to lure you far enough away so that your father can't listen in. I'm Tessa Bog, by the way and this is my little coven."

You gasped, realizing that you were very far from home and that you were surrounded by four other young girls with witch brooms and a pet. "You- You lured me into a trap?!" Frightened, you demanded. "Why? What did I do?!"
