"It's no trouble at all." Smiling, Diana said. "We don't like to blow all of our money in one place either so we learned how to get the most for every dollar we spend."

"You should see these two in action, Jessica." Motioning to her friends, Tonya said. "They saved me hundreds the last time I went binge shopping."

Jasmine gulped. "Well... where do we start?"

"That depends upon what look you are after." Honestly, Emily replied. "Let me guess; tomboy, right?"

Jasmine nodded, causing both Emily and Diana to giggle. "Let's start with...."
11333112121122222333221.title: you meet friends at the mall.

113331121211222223332213.content:
"The first rule is never to eat on an empty stomach." Grinning, Emily said. "This one is on us."

"You really don't have to..." Politely, you began.

"Oh, its no bother, really." Lightly, Diana said. "Just let us do the talking."

Curious, you followed them to the food court where you were surprised to see every store owner smiling and waving them over to them. You exchanged worried looks with Jasmine then turned to Tonya who did not seem to notice at all. "Um.. Why does it seem like everyone here knows you two?" Concerned, you asked.

"Well, we bring them good luck." Giggling, Emily replied. She winked. "You'll see."

The two walked over to a salad bar where the shop owner, Mr Don Walker smiled. "Welcome back to my shop, girls." Happily, he said. "What will it be today?"

Diana giggled. "We would like five grilled chicken salads and five drinks for the table, please." Smiling, she said. She lightly waved her hand out into the crowds before adding, "You might want to be quick, though, Don. I see more hungry people coming your way."

Don looked out and chuckled. "Every time you come to my salad bar, I get busy." Smiling, he said. "I don't get it but I love it; I wish I knew your secret."

Emily shrugged. "We're just lucky, I guess."

Watching Diana, you frowned. You sensed magic in use. She was magically luring people to Don's salad bar so to entice him to give them a free meal. It was sneaky and you were certain it broke more than just a few rules of magic though you had to admit you had no training at all. After the salads were made, Emily reached for her purse but Don waved it off. "It's on the house, girls." Kindly, he said. "It's the least I can do for all the customers you bring with you every time you come."

"I knew it." Sighing, you thought. "These two are witches, just like me."

You remained silent as you and Jasmine followed them and Tonya to a seat away from the crowds. Once everyone was seated, Emily sighed. "Okay, I know you have magic." Softly, she said. "We also know that Jasmine here is not your cousin; likely a boy you accidentally transformed."

You gasped at that then turned to Tonya to find that she was completely unaware of the conversation taking place. "What did you do to her?" Worried, you demanded.

"It's a simple unaware spell." Lightly, Diana explained. "To her, we are having a normal conversation about everything and nothing." She sighed. "To the point, we're not breaking any real laws of magic other than using magic in public. Also, its a win- win sort of thing."

"The store owners get more business, thanks to us and we get free to drastically reduced merchandise and food in return." Smiling, Emily added. "Its the perfect set up."

"Only you are forcing people to spend money where they normally might not." Frowning, you countered.

"We only lure them to the store." Patiently, Diana said. "Also, we only lure those who have the money to spend as opposed to those who are barely getting by." She smiled. "You can always go shopping on your own; it makes no difference to us."

"Just don't report us." Suddenly frowning, Emily said. "You will find us better friends than foes."

Then a dark shadow fell upon the group as a voice stated, "I seriously doubt you want my child to consider you foes, ladies."

Emily and Diana looked up and instantly turned pale as they saw...
113331121211222223332213.title: Friends or foes.

choices: Emily and Diana blame you for getting caught.
Tonya heard your talk with Ella Mist.
1133311212112222233322131.content:
You looked up and smiled. "Hey, grandma." Kindly, you said. "What are you doing here?"

Emily and Diana turned even more pale, which you somehow did not notice. "Grandma?!" Stunned, they demanded. "Madam head witch, we..."

"Easy, you two." Firmly but kindly, Elle said. "For now, my granddaughter is unaware of our conversation. She is not yet ready to know of her legacy." Her face darkened. "It would be very wise of you not to tell her; I and her father will choose the proper time and place."

"We- We're not breaking any laws other than..." Rattled, Emily began.

"Other than using magic in public." Sternly, Elle interrupted. "However, your greed is raising too many questions from store owners. Did you know they are trying to figure out how you attract business?"

"They can't possibly figure it out, madam head witch." Defending herself, Diana protested.

"I am going to make this very clear, ladies." Darkly, Elle said. "You will cease and desist your greedy activities in this mall or I will personally strip you of your powers for the rest of your natural lives."

She then lightly waved her hand and turned to you. "I'm just here for some light shopping, dear." Answering your question, she said. "This must be your cousin, Jasmine; hello, dear child."

"How did you..." Curious, you began.

"I have exceptional hearing, my dear." Winking at you, Elle said. "No one can keep secrets from me for very long." She giggled, turning to Jasmine. "I heard you need a more tomboyish wardrobe. I think I can help you out."

"You don't have to, grandma." Wincing, you said.

"Oh, come now, Jessica." Smiling, Elle said. "When was the last time I got to spoil you?" She winked. "Your father and I go way back; he won't mind if I splurge a little for you and your cousin."

Blushing, you allowed Elle to lead you away from the food court with Jasmine reluctantly following while Emily and Diana remained at the food court, trembling from their meeting with the head witch.
1133311212112222233322131.title: Elle Mist, the head witch.

choices: I still have some shopping to do.
My mom is already here to pick me up.
11333112121122222333221311.content:
Upon entering the teen girls clothing department at the mall, Elle casually walked around Jasmine once, making her feel nervous. "You look like the type of girl who would rather keep things simple." Calmly, she said. "I believe some embroidered jeans, loose fitting blouses, and maybe a few moderate length earth tone skirts would suit you nicely."

"That's a lot better than what Mr M was offering." Relief in her voice, Jasmine said. "Even with that magical closet his wife left the family."

You winced, turning to Elle only she gave you a reassuring smile. "I take it your father told you that your mother was a powerful witch." Softly, she said. You nodded to which she smiled kindly. "I am assuming that Jasmine here is your handiwork then."

You blushed, causing Elle to giggle slightly before turning to Jasmine. "Let me guess, Jessica screamed upon seeing her first test flame and you barged in, thinking she was in trouble." She shook her head, bemused as Jasmine nodded. "That is classic."

Jasmine blushed as Elle giggled again then asked, "Um... Mrs Mist, can you possibly change me back to normal?"

"I have the power to do so but I will not." Calmly, Elle replied. "The reason is because doing so will rob you of the ability to resist magic." Before Jasmine could protest, Elle added, "If you catch a man a fish, you feed him for a day; if you teach a man to fish, you feed him for a lifetime."

"What does that have to do with this?" Frustrated, Jasmine demanded, motioning to her body.

Elle smiled. "The more magic is used against you, the more resistant you will become to its effects." Patiently, she explained. "If I change you back now, I save you for a day. If I allow your body and mind to resist magic, I save you for a lifetime."

"So it takes three months to resist magic?" Downhearted, Jasmine asked.

"Well, for a boy born into a witch family, it only takes three weeks." Calmly, Elle said. "That time is considerably longer for normal people such as yourself." She then motioned to the racks of clothing. "Shall we continue our little shopping adventure?"

Albeit reluctantly, Jasmine agreed and you helped her pick out a small wardrobe she could live with along with a few new outfits for you that Elle insisted upon you getting. Upon finishing, Elle paid for everything in cash. As you were leaving the mall, you noticed Tonya following. She seemed worried.

"Where did you run off to, Jess?!" Concerned, she demanded. "Diana and Emily seemed real upset that you took off all of a sudden!"

"That is my fault, I fear." Kindly, Elle said. "I am Jessica's grandmother. I took it upon myself to spoil her and her cousin today." She smiled at Tonya. "You need not worry about your friends, they will not cause any trouble over this." She then muttered, "Less they risk annoying her father."

"My father will be picking us up; would you like a ride home, Tonya?" Offering, you asked.

"I already informed your father that I would take you home." Smiling, Elle said. "If Tonya would like a ride home, I will gladly take her."

Tonya, though a bit confused by everything, replied...
11333112121122222333221311.title: Shopping with grandma.

113331121211222223332213111.content:
Elle smiled and in the next breath Tonya looked around more confused and rather startled as you were all suddenly standing outside of your house. "What...?"

Jasmine, although she had a better idea of what had happened, seemed startled as well. "You were fast asleep the instant you sat in the car, my dear." Looking concerned, Elle said. "Jessica, Jasmine, and I were very worried about you." She shook her head. "I fear you may be coming down with something. I advise you to have your mother check you over as soon as possible."

"Do you need me to go with you?" Kindly, you offered. "You do look a little pale."

"I better come along too." Nervous, Jasmine said. "It's been a strange day all around."

"May- Maybe you should." Confused and startled, Tonya said.

You nodded and lead Tonya to her house with while Elle got into her car and vanished from sight as if she were never there. Inside Tonya's house her mother, Stephanie gave you, Jasmine, and Tonya a surprised look. "Tonya doesn't feel well and my cousin, Jasmine is not feeling like herself." Wincing, you said.

Stephanie sighed. "Help Tonya into bed and I will take a look at Jasmine." Serious, she said. "Hopefully its something simple."

Once Tonya was in bed, sleeping, you lead Jasmine into Stephanie's sitting room where you explained what had happened. When you were done, Jasmine asked, "Can you help at all?"

Stephanie shook her head. "While I knew of your father's powers for years, I am not a witch, young lady." Softly, she said. "However, I know how mad science and magic works and I am immune to both."

"Any advice you can give us would be helpful." Wincing, you said.

"You will need training in magic eventually." Serious, Stephanie said. "In Jasmine's case, it is better that she build some resistance to magic as it will help him further on being so close to your family."
113331121211222223332213111.title: Okay, thank you.

114.content:
"What about James, dad?" curious, you asked. "Where has he been all this time?"

"James has been at a very special school for mad scientists." with a hint of pride, dad replied. "Eligere Sententia all boys boarding school. He arrived home late last night and is working on a project in his laboratory below the garage."

"The garage?" raising an eyebrow, you asked. you shrugged. "Okay, I'll bite, do you think James will let me in to see his secret laboratory and this project he's working on?"

"He might let you in but be warned, you might end up in one of his experiments." amused, dad said. "I can tell you where to knock but, ask yourself... Is it worth risking being experimented on to satisfy your curiosity?"

You rolled your eyes, causing dad to chuckle before he told you to sit in the old station wagon and honk the horn twice. This made no sense to you as the station wagon had not run for weeks. You wondered if it was worth your time to p[lay along or just leave dad and James to their silly little game.
114.title: You ask about James.

1141.content:
"This is ridiculous." entering the garage, you whispered. "What kind of crazy game is dad playing?"

You sighed, opening the driver's side door of the station wagon and got in. Nothing seemed out of the ordinary, as you had expected, but you decided to humor dad and closed the door before honking the horn twice. At first, nothing happened and you were about to get out when the seat belt suddenly pulled itself around you on its on, locking itself into place!

"Hey!" startled, you yelled.

You tried to get the seat belt off but it would not budge; you began to worry. Then, you heard the sound of machinery somewhere below you just before the car dropped like a rock! You screamed in terror as the car took you under the surface while the garage floor closed above you, eliminating any trace that you were once there. You continued to scream as the car plummeted several floors beneath the ground before gradually slowing to a stop where the seat belt released you and the door opened.

"What a rush!" getting out of the car, you muttered. "Where am I?"

You stepped away from the car but gasped as it rose back up, taking away what could have been your only way out of where you now were. Having no other choice, you walked forward to find what looked like a high budget science fiction movie with robots moving everywhere among station after station of computers, gadgets, vials of who knows what, and other items that were completely unknown to you.

"This must be James' laboratory." whispering, you said. "Only where is James?"
1141.title: You play along.

11413.content:
You turned around, startled to find James standing behind you with a bemused smile on his face. "Welcome to my little laboratory, sis." smiling, he said. "I take dad told you how to pay me a visit?" you nodded, fearful and James chuckled. "Relax. Outside of a few pranks, I would never intentionally harm you."

"Dad told me all of the boys in our family are mad scientists." regaining some of your composure, you said. "He also told me that you were working on a project of some kind."

"A DNA manipulation experiment." nodding, James replied. he then smiled. "Care to help me with it?"

"I guess." wincing, you replied. "What do I have to do?"

"Not much." leading you deeper into the lab, James said. "You see, I know how much you love fantasy stories and I want to help you experience one of those stories."

"By changing my body into something?" uncertain, you asked. "I'm not sure."

"It's perfectly safe." sighing, James said. he then smiled. "Besides, you already agreed."

With that, he gave you a hard shove and you fell backwards into a floor level tank of water then hit a button on a console before you broke the surface, closing the lid over you. "James!" pounding on the metal lid, you screamed. "Let me out!"

"Activating nanite saturation." ignoring you, James said. "Preparing subject for transformation."

Panic gripped you as you heard this and you began to slam your fists against the lid as hard as you could, kicking your legs in an attempt to push it open. Your panic grew as you felt the water against your body and found that your clothes had somehow turned to dust and was slowly sinking to the bottom of the tank. "This is not funny, James!" terrified, you screamed. "Let me out of here now!!"

"Nanites have successfully integrated with the test subject, activating transformation sequence." still ignoring you, James said. "Observing test subject for any complications."

With that, he hit a button and turned as a glass tank rose from the floor, fully revealing you in the water. He watched you with his face showing full concentration. You wanted to scream profanities at him but a strange sensation throughout your body stopped you cold. You body felt uncomfortably hot. You looked down to find your legs beginning to merge into one appendage with your feet widening and flattening into a dolphin like fin.

"NOOOO!" terrified, you screamed. "What are you doing to me!?!"

James ignored you completely, writing a number of notes onto a pad he was holding then continued to watch with only concentration showing on his face. This hurt you deeply but you were more worried about the changes that were occurring and turned back to find that your legs were gone, replaced with a long scaly tail. Not used to swimming with a tail, you fell into the water but you were surprised to find that you could breathe underwater. This confused you until you realized that you had gills on both sides of your neck, taking in water. "He's turned me into a mermaid!"

Becoming a mermaid was one of your childhood wishes but now it was a nightmare as you knew nothing about how to survive in an underwater world let alone if James could change you back.

"Experiment a complete success." smiling, James said. "The test subject shows no signs of being in any pain and the transformation appears to be stable."

"The test subject has a name!" pounding on the glass, you yelled.

"Sorry, Jessica." smiling, James said. "I have to be disconnected when taking notes; it's nothing personal."

"Well, your experiment was a success, congratulations!" sarcastically, you said. "Now how about changing me back?"

"I'm not done yet." to your horror, James said. "I want you to see something first."

He then hit a switch and you felt yourself being pulled. You looked down and creamed, seeing the water being quickly drained, taking you with it! You swam has hard as you could, trying to fight the current but it was too strong and you were pulled out of the tank through a strange spinning ring with several lights. There was a flash as you passed through it and you found yourself being ejected into what looked like an underwater cave. "Where am I?" shaken, you asked.

Swimming around, you found an opening large enough to swim through and peered out to find that you were somewhere under the pacific ocean, judging by the fish swimming by, meaning you were thousands of miles from home. "Why did James do this to me?" tearing up, you asked. "How am I going to get home?"

Feeling helpless, you sank to the cave floor and began to cry...
11413.title: Mermaid Jessica.

114131.content:
You sat on the cave floor for who knows how long. Being in the water like this felt so surreal, and not really in a good way. How in the world did this happen? One second, you were an ordinary girl. Now, you're a mermaid in some unknown part of the Pacific, with no sense of direction.

"What do I do?" you sniffed a bit.

The many fish and other sea creatures seemed indifferent to you, as if you weren't anything unusual. However, you did realize after a while that your clothes were torn to bits as a result of the transformation. Your bra was gone too, so you had to use your arms to cover up.

"Um....excuse me?" asked a petite voice.

It caught you off guard to hear a voice here in the ocean. You looked around for the source, eventually seeing someone small behind the cave wall. It was a young girl, perhaps no older than 8 years old. She was pretty cute for a kid.

At first, you wondered what a kid was doing here, but then it clicked. For there to be someone else here, they'd have to be....

And your question was answered when the girl swam out a bit, revealing her own mermaid tail.

"Are you new here?" asked the girl, who was wearing some seaweed around her chest.

"Um....yes you could say I am. Who are you?" you asked.

"I'm Jenna." introduced the girl.

"I'm Jessica." you replied. The girl smiled a bit as she took your arm.

"Are you lonely? You should come with me. Everyone else is further underground." said Jenna.

"Underground? Everyone? What do you mean?" you asked.

"The rest of the colony of course."
114131.title: Chance Encounter

1141311.content:
"The colony?" worried, you asked. "Um... no offense but I just want to go home."

Jenna smiled. "Ah, you're one of the changed ones." looking at you, she said. "A lot of the others here were changed too, in one way or another. I was born here."

"There are... mermen here as well?" surprised, you asked.

"Of course, silly." giggling, Jenna said. "How else would I have been born here?"

"You know how that works?" disturbed, you asked.

Jenna shrugged. "Mom told me it takes a boy and a girl to make a baby." shrugging, Jenna replied. "She told me that, if she told me more, I'd throw up."

You giggled at that then sighed. "Well, I have no idea how long I'm going to be stuck here." worried again, you said. "If you can promise me I can find my way back to this cave, I'll go with you."

"Oh that's easy." simply, Jenna said. "All the changed ones end up here at the beginning. It's just that most of them decide to stay as they learn to love their new life or find another they love."

"I see..." wincing, you said.

"Come on, the village is not far from here." grabbing your arm, Jenna said. "Follow me."

Albeit reluctantly, you followed Jenna deeper into the underwater cave towards parts unknown...
1141311.title: Explanations

11413111.content:
"So you were naturally born here?" you asked Jenna.

"Yeah. My parents were changed when they were kids. I think my mom said they fell in love and decided to stay as they got older." she smiled.

"I see. I don't know if that will be the case for me. I'd like to get back to my family." you said.

"Don't worry, we'll see. Who knows, you may end up liking the place." smiled Jenna.

"Speaking of which, how far underground is this village?" you asked.

"Not too far. Just far enough where no human will come. It gives us our privacy. Most of us care here the same way you did; as a result of science." said Jenna.

"Really?" you almost gasped.

"Yeah. I think some may have come a different way, but I'm not sure. Anyway, you see those lights? We're close." said Jenna as they began to saw some small orbs of light lighting the cave path. Jenna explained that the village had been around for at least a few decades, and that was how it was formed eventually. She said that there were at least 50 or so merfolk there.

"Ah, here we are." smiled Jenna.

And thus, it began.
11413111.title: The underwater village.

114131111.content:
As you followed Jenna out of the cave tunnel, you let your eyesight adjust to the low level of light in the cavern. As that occurred, you became aware of other merfolk swimming around the cavern; as well as primitive dwellings built into the cavern walls.

Swimming further into the cavern, you slowly realized the others had stopped what they were doing to look at you; the new arrival to their home. Unsure of what to do, you stayed close to Jenna; as she was the only person you'd met thus far.

It wasn't long before a mermaid and a merman swam up to where you and Jenna were floating. The mermaid looked at Jenna and said, "There you are, Jenna; how many times have I told you not to wander off without permission."

"I'm sorry, mom." Pausing, Jenna said, "I'll ask next time."

Realizing the mermaid was Jenna's mother, you said, "I hope you don't mind; but Jenna was just showing me around this place." Pausing, you said, "I don't know how I came to be here; but the last thing I knew I was in my house."

"You must be the new arrival." Smiling, the mermaid said, "I'm Jenna's mother; Rachel."

"Hi Rachel, it's nice to meet you." Shaking her hand, you said, "I'm Jessica."

Looking at you, the merman said, "You're probably wondering how it is that you came to be here?"

"That's right; the last thing I remember was this flash of light."

"We call it the Portal; it's how we all came to be here." Gesturing to a point further inside the cavern, the merman said, "Come, our village leaders will explain everything."

You cautiously followed Jenna and her parents further into the cavern; during which time you learned her father's name was Kevin.

Swimming through the cavern, you got a closer look at everything and everyone you swam past. You were so focused on your surroundings; you jumped when you suddenly heard someone calling your name.

Confused, you turned in the direction of the voice to find a merman around your age swimming towards you with a smile on his face; and there was something familiar about him. As he got closer, you realized why he was so familiar; he was an old friend you hadn't seen in almost 6 years.

"Kyle!?" shocked, you said, "Is that you!?"

Swimming up to you, Kyle hugged you and said, "Yeah, it's me."
114131111.title: Meeting the others

1141311111.content:
"How exactly did you get here Kyle? It's almost been six years since I last saw you." You said to him as he released you from his hug. He looked at you and began to tell his tale. "That long huh? We'll I guess I can try to explain as best as I can." He told you.

"As you know about six years ago I lived on the surface like you did, it's been so long since I've seen my family I've grown to miss them." Kyle said.

"You mean you were transformed like I was?" You asked him.

Kyle simply nodded and continued his story. " It was a dark and rainy day, I had just gotten off of school and was heading home, As I made my way home I found a very strange man talking with my mother, So I listened to there conversation even though I had little understanding of the words but I still remember some of it."

"What did he say to your mother?" You asked Kyle, quietly awaiting him to finish his story.

"He told her, Your bills have paid now you must pay us with what we have requested. My mother then told him, I beg of you please don't take my son away! I quickly learned that I was involved in it somehow but then it gets weird. The guy then tells my mom. I know the truth about your kind!" Kyle told me. "That's about all I remember about the conversation, the next thing I knew the guy took me and experimented on me, which eventually lead me to becoming what I am here."

Once Kyle's story was finished you continued heading towards the village leader's strangely enough hoping that some of them would not have sad back stories like Kyle's was.
1141311111.title: Kyle's Story

choices: go talk to one of his brothers
go talk to one of your friends
114132.content:
Think it'll be best to give her an hour to cool off James thought as he walked out of his lab, so he could get a drink. As he reached the kitchen, he saw Nathan waiting for him.

"I detected a temporal event, son" Nathan said. "Would you like to explain yourself?"

"I only distorted space, dad. No way I would try to do a space-time experiment" James protested.

"I see.. Where's your sister?"

"I teleported her" James said.

"Really? Let me see..."

James looked at his dad, remembering that your clothes were still in the tube, albeit in a fine powder. "I need to be alone, so I can bring her back..."

"What are you hiding?' Nathan demanded, suddenly suspicious. "Did you do anything else to Jess?"

"No. Course no" James protested, as Nathan pushed past him, and into his lab. What was your clothed was spotted immediately.

"You disintegrated her clothes?! What were you thinking? You know how shy girls can be when it comes to their bodies. Maybe you need first hand experience.."

"She was covered" James protested. Rather than the whole 'little mermaid look', James did the only think the DNA manipulator could do; cover your breasts with more scales.

"Really? So why is that tank containing trace amounts of liquid?"

James shifted uncomfortably. "I decided she needed to cool off, so I sent her into the ocean."

Nathan frowned. "I want the full truth. You know what sodium pentanal is?"

"Truth serum.. What? Fine! I kinda turned her into a mermaid first" James said, wincing. He wisely thought it was best to leave out the part that he thought it was ironic considering how must you liked that stuff growing up.

"You did what?! I don't care how you managed to do it, but you get my daughter here right now or I swear, you'll be joining her.."

"Dad, I need time alone to bring her back."

"Thirty minutes. Not a nanosecond more"

James thought about things for a couple seconds. No way he wanted to be turned into a mermaid... and that he had to stay behind. But who could he mermaidfy to bring you back...
114132.title: Back at home...

1141322.content:
James knew that dad was serious when it came to the time limit and his threat should he fail. Thirty minutes was all he had before dad came in with all his fury and his power was far greater than his own. The only issue was that he had to convince someone to be changed and teleported to get you back then change both individuals back in separate tanks, all within thirty minutes. "It would have to be someone Jess trusts without question." mussing, James said. "The logical choice would be Tonya Holmes only how do I convince her?"

After a moment of thought, James picked up a telephone and called Tonya's house and got her mother, Stephanie. "Hello."

"Ms Holmes, this is James; there has been an... incident." knowing that Steph was aware of dad's powers, James said. "Could you please send Tonya over?"

"Not unless I know more about this incident, young man." crossly, Steph replied. "I will not place my daughter into any unnecessary danger."

James sighed. "What I did was out of the best of intentions." defending himself, he said.

"Let's hear it." patiently, Steph said.

James quickly explained what had happened. "I teleported 'mermaid Jessica' to an underwater cave at a private island in the South Pacific." finishing his explanation, he said. "She only needs to swim back through the portal to return home but I am not given the time to allow her to figure that out on her own and I must be human to work the controls and change them back to normal."

"Who are you talking to, mom?" entering the room, Tonya asked.

"It's James." quickly, Steph replied. "Jessica is in trouble and he needs your help."

"What!?" shocked, Tonya asked.

She ran out of the house to your house where she knocked on the front door. Inside his lab, James saw her on one of his camera monitors and pressed a button. Tonya let out a scream as the floor vanished below her and she fell several feet into a large tank of water. The moment she broke the surface, James knelt down, facing her. "There is something you must know..."

Ten minutes later...
1141322.title: The logical choice.

11413221.content:
That bastard Tonya thought furiously as she flicked her tail in a manner showing her displeasure. While she was more than willing to have a talk with you, once James told her that he turned you into a 'mermaid', but she assumed you weren't actually part fish, and it would be done by scuba gear, Hence Tonya was equally displeased to see her body transforming like yours, and finding herself in a underwater cavern. "Jess, you here?" Tonya called out.

You heard your friend's voice clearly. "Tonya?! What... He got you too?" You swam closer and to your shock, you saw Tonya swimming in the cavern, a mermaid just like you.

"You dad is furious, Jess, and it seems it is making your jerk of a brother nervous. Even as he was doing this to me, he seemed to stress to me that I had to get you home within the next fifteen minutes. All we have to do is go through the portal again" Tonya said.

"D-daddy is angry" you stammered.

"Yes. I have a feeling your dad is going to experiment on him, if you don't come back within the remaining time' Tonya said.

"Good" you said. you was still angry, and wanted James to suffer.

"So do I. He transformed me, before asking" Tonya growled. She looked at her tail and said, "Its not like we imagined.."

"What?" you asked.

"Mad scientists?" Alarmed, she asked. She turned to the other instructors. "We have a rift breach!"

"So you were one of them." Sternly, Connie stated. "What did you do to bring about your transformation?"

"Yes; I am Jessica Moray." Nodding, you said. Wincing, you asked, "Are we really on the other side of the rift, where my grandmother came from?"

Connie raised a single eyebrow. "One question. Were you a guest or a worker on Transgender Island?" Serious, she asked.

"I'm a worker there." Serious, you replied. "I need to get these kids and myself back to the other side."

Connie bit her lip. "The boys and girl will be sent back immediately. However..." She winced.

"However what?" Worried, you asked.

Connie sighed. "I am very sorry, Jessica Moray." Sadly, she said. "We can't send you back, not just yet."

Connie shook her head. "When going through the rift, you have to go 'with the current'." Darkly, she explained. "You and the children fell through a momentary tear."

"How will you send them back?" Curious, you asked. "Also, why can't I go back?"

"The kids still have enough magic or mad science to go be pushed against the current and sent home without any injury." Serious, Connie replied. "Your magic is depleted. Sending you back would be risky."

"So I need to rest up before I can go home." Sighing, you said. "I see..."

You woke up in a plain looking bedroom in a stranger's house. That alone was unnerving enough. What was worse was the fact you were being watched by a pair of very young identical twins. Each had long forest brown hair and gem blue eyes. They both wore identical white dresses and were sitting in a small couch near the door. "Good morning." Smiling, they said in unison.

"Um... good morning." Nervous, you said. "Can you tell me who you are and where I am?"

"We can." Smiling, the first girl said. "That was easy to answer."

"Oh, boy..." Rolling your eyes, you thought.

"Please, who are you and where am I?" Rephrasing your question, you demanded.

"I'm Tia and this is my sister, Ina." Kindly, the first girl replied. "You are in our house. Mommy said that you are her aunt's granddaughter."

The second girl, Ina looked at you, curiously. "Are you really from the other side of the rift?" Softly, she demanded. "What's it like over there?"

Before you could answer, the door opened and a tall, muscular woman entered. She had long forest brown hair and gem blue eyes, like the twin girls; you guessed she was their mother. She was dressed in a simple black dress and mary-janes. "I told you two to alert me the moment our guest woke up." Scolding, she said. "You are dismissed."

Although clearly disappointed, the two little girls obeyed and left the room before the woman closed the door and turned to you with a kind smile. "Forgive them, Miss Moray." Kindly, she said. "They are curious and can be mischievous but they are, for the most part, kind."

"Sorry, who are you?" Wincing, you demanded.

The woman giggled slightly. "My name is Mrs. Mona Mage." Politely, she said. "My mother is Elle Mist; her twin sister, on the other side of the rift, is your grandmother, Ella Mist."

Your eyes widened as you realized you had been taken off the island to the home of your family on the other side. You turned to your wrist and found the return device missing. Mrs Mage blushed seeing your demanding expression. "My husband is a mad scientist." Softly, she said. "He is examining your device." She winced after saying that.

You were a bit nervous when you came face to face with your great aunt, Ella Mist. Indeed, she looked exactly like your grandmother. "I look forward to hearing all about your life on the other side." Kindly, she said. "That and I have a favor to ask of you."

Suddenly, your little brother appeared. He stood by your side in a threatening posture, his short hair standing up on end; something you never saw him do before. His misshapen, almost wolf like ears were leaning back like a real angry wolf. "Leave my sister alone!" Furious, he declared.

The boys all laughed at the little boy's threat. Only their laughter died in their throats the instant a large number of shadowy wolves appeared, surrounding them. The dark wolves growled and barked at the boys, baring their razor sharp teeth. Matt then transformed himself into a wolf his own size, growling with the others.

"It- It's a Neko boy!" Panicked, one boy declared.

"They can work magic and science!" Backing away another boy wailed. "We need to get out of here, immediately, at once!"

"Everyone back away slowly." Barely maintaining his calm, the dark haired boy ordered. "The kid's primary objective is to protect the witch."

The boys slowly backed away with the shadow wolves following their every step with their red glowing eyes. Once they were far enough away, they made a run for it, into the wooded area of the island. "That Neko boy brother of yours can't protect you forever, witch!" The dark haired boy called out. "This isn't over!"

Once the boys were gone, the shadowy wolves vanished with an eerie howl and Matt returned to his human self with a dull flash. He sighed tearfully before turning to you. "Are you here because of a hard choice too?" Wincing, he asked.

"I'm here for a summer job and to earn a girl to go with me to Witchbloom." Honestly, you said. "What choice are you talking about?"

"Dad told me that Neko traits are inherently feminine." Tears falling, he said. "Only I was born a boy so I can work both magic and chaotic science."

You gasped, realizing Matt's predicament. "You have to choose which power you want more, magic or chaotic science."

Matt nodded, rubbing his tears. "Uh-huh. Dad told me that this island will help me make the right decision and that his love for me will not change regardless of my gender when I return home."

"That's rough." Wincing, you said. You then managed a smile. "Thank you for coming to my rescue back there; you were like a knight in shinning armor."

Matt blushed at that. "Any good brother would have done the same." Softly, he said. He then turned serious. "That creep was right, I can't protect you forever. You need to stay on your toes and use your magic to defend yourself."

"I really don't know too much magic." Shrugging, you said.

Matt smiled. "I'm only seven and I figured it out." Amused, he countered.

Dad thought you rejected me after I told you this and decided to turn you into a boy. Only that stupid man jumped the gun and punished you when you were undeserving."

12312.content:
After securing you in your room for 'your own safety', James tracked down dad to find him inside his massive laboratory. He was feverishly moving from station to station with both aunt Viva Vogue and grandpa Devlin Moray following him. Each were giving him a riot act that would have placed any other man into tears. Viva was your mother's older sister and a near mirror image of her; tall and slender with long black hair and hazel eyes. Devlin Moray was a tall, dark elderly man who sported an eighteenth century gentleman's suit with unusually long coat tails that moved about as if they had a mind of their own. He wore knee high riding boots, a top hat covering his raven black hair, and carried a silver tipped cane with a large diamond. His eyes hid behind round shining glasses while he held a toothy, almost sinister grin.

"How dare you transform my sister's daughter before consulting me!" Enraged, Viva shouted. "Her birthright is to be a powerful witch and the next heir to the magical throne! You have just robbed me, the entire witching world of her talents!" She shook her head, fuming. "The witch council will not be pleased if her transformation becomes permanent and I cannot train her!"

"The right to train her is mine and mine alone, dear sister in law." Coldly, dad countered. "Also, although I accept the responsibility of an err in judgment, the transformation is not permanent." He turned to her with cold, calculating eyes which forced her to hesitate. "I am far more careful than that and for you to even suggest otherwise is a complete insult unlike your err of judgement with your former brother, Christian."

Viva took a step back as if she were slapped in the face, tears forming. "I payed for that mistake, in spades." Her voice quivering, she said. "Both Maria and I did together."

Devlin cleared his throat, catching dad's attention. "Son, I speak sincerely towards you; I trained you far better than that." In a deadly calm, he scolded. "I am dismayed both as your superior and as your Father." He motioned to Viva. "Bringing up past mistakes of others does not justify your own. The will of a mad scientist is to learn from your errors and the errors of others, not to repeat them."

"This is my first grand error as a father, my dear mentor and head mad scientist." More respectfully, dad replied. "My reference to Viva's error was not a justification but a reflection that even the most powerful to men and women are capable of mistakes." He frowned. "I began work on correcting my mistake immediately upon realizing it..."

"All errors, as a father are grand, my dear eldest child." Coldly, Devlin interrupted. "The point is this error effects more than just the transformed girl in question but an entire community of magically powerful women who are demanding answers..."

Back and forth, Devlin and Viva read dad the riot act as he worked on an antidote for your male condition which James knew had to be distracting to say the least. He jumped slightly as Devlin turned to him. "This is a private matter, dear grandchild!" Sternly, he said. "Speak nothing of what you have seen and heard or I promise you a greater riot act will come your way!"

With that, James found himself in the sitting room, shaken. "And Jessica thinks dad gives a rough riot act about her getting an A-minus on a test."

Later, dad made the antidote but...

123121.content:
"The antidote is complete." Flatly, dad announced after Devlin and Viva had finished their rant. "However, it will not be administered until my error is fully corrected."

"What?!" Dismayed, Viva demanded.

"Explain." Calmly, Devlin said.

"I made assumptions and jumped to conclusions; a novice error on my part." Frowning, dad explained. "As such, I have tarnished her trust in me and instilled a fear of chaotic science of which I must swiftly and completely correct."

"How exactly do you intend to correct this error, my dear eldest offspring?" Patiently, Devlin demanded. "The longer you wait, the more anxious the witching world will become."

Dad smiled. "I intend to show my temporary new son the wonders and greatness that await him through the power of chaotic science!" Ecstatic, he proclaimed. "This will serve both as a bonding experience and a reward for 'his' patience in the light of my error in judgement."

Dad then laughed hysterically with Devlin soon following. Viva was far from impressed. "Jessica has a legacy to uphold!" Serious, she protested.

"A legacy of her choice." Grinning, dad countered. "The antidote lies here, ready to be used at any time of my choosing." He then eyed Viva with a snake like grin. "If my 'son' demands to be changed back, despite my offer to show her such wonders, I will of course comply. However, if he does not make such a demand..."

"Then he is free to allow his son to explore his world." Smiling, Devlin said. "The same is so written within witch law." He turned to Viva. "You have the answers the witch council had demanded. The transformation is temporary, Nathan Moray has been reprimanded for his actions and steps are being made to correct the issue at hand."

"But to teach him mad science..." Wincing, Viva said.

"Is no different than you teaching your son witchcraft." Turning serious, Devlin said. "This issue has been corrected and our need to be here has expired." He turned to dad. "You have three days to entice your temporary son to try mad science then you must return her to her normal state, am I clear?"

"Crystal clear, head mad scientist." Bowing, dad said.

Devlin nodded then vanished, taking Viva with him in a flash and thunder like boom.

12312131332.title: Viva visits her brother.

"What's on your mind, Viva?" Flatly, Christian asked.

"I- I want to clear the air between us, bro." Nervous, she said. "It's been too long." She sighed, uncomfortable. "You know Maria and I were blamed for..."

"It's not always about you sis." With a dismissive wave of his hand, Christian said. "The witching world blames you and Maria for making me too strong but that is only to hide and mask their own guilt."

This caught Viva off guard. "What do you mean?"

"Do you seriously think was the first ironclad?" Irritated, he snapped. "I was merely the strongest in witch history and the first to organize a push for independence." He scoffed. "Those witches in power at the time feared losing all the control they had over us witch boys."

"Witch boys have power too..." Softly, Viva argued.

Christian nodded. "Yes, but they are not trained in how to use it until after the 'day of rage'." He shook his head. "It was a barbaric system and it had to be changed."

Viva gulped. The day of rage was the day a witch boy becomes so enraged from being tormented that his dormant magic lashes out on its own. When that happens, no magic could effect him and he sends all of girls in his family to the hospital.

"It was on my own day of rage that I became an Ironclad." Serious, Christian said. "I was not the first but..." He gave a rueful smile. "I literally brought the house down around all of your ears!"

Viva returned her brother's rueful smile. "It was like a sequence in a dream." Softly, she said. "One angered roar and the house literally imploded upon us all before exploding as if gas line had been ruptured."

"That was actually the cover story the head witch chose." Smiling, Christian said. He sighed. "It was not because of what you and Maria did to me that moved me to push for Ironclad independence. As I said, it was never about you or Maria."

"So why did you do it?" Curious, Viva asked.

"As I said, the current laws protecting witch boys was barbaric." Serious, Christian explained. "By making the Ironclads independent, we had a say in changing the laws protecting witch boys." he smiled. "Let those idiots blame you!"

"So... we are good then?" Hopeful, Viva asked.

"It's a work in progress." Grinning, Christian said.

Viva, seeing her brother's dry humor hugged him warmly. "Thank you, bro."

Christian nodded. "Don't worry, sis." Ruefully, he said. "With us witches and witch boys trapped in a world of mad science how long do you think it will be before we have our first pseudo witch or mad science woman?"

Viva cringed at the thought, causing Christian to laugh. "What we went through is mild compared to what it certainly yet to come so relax." He looked at a clock on the wall and turned serious. "Your time is up, thank you for visiting."

Viva nodded, a smile on her face as Christian normally said 'time to leave'. She left his house on good terms but was still rattled at the prospect of a boy working magic through science or a girl working mad science through magic. "The intricate web we weave..." Sighing, she thought.

You pouted. "So what am I supposed to do?" Worried, you asked. "I live here but I'm being treated as an outsider, made to sleep in the guest room."

"To answer your question, just lay low and don't say anything to give away your true identity. Also, be certain you are home before the time limit expires."

Dad had told him that only boys can work real mad science and the right time had to be carefully chosen to tell you. Worse, his powers were somewhat unstable, making his dream to have his own lab even further out of his grasp. The chaotic science book was a guide to help him towards that goal.

Thinking fast, Tex composed himself and turned back to you, smiling again. "Nah, can I see it?"

"Why, do you really believe in mad science?" giggling, you asked.

"I just want to see it; is that a crime?" chuckling, Tex fired back.

You shrugged and handed the book over. Once Tex had it, he stood up to leave.

"Where are you going?" standing up with him, you asked.

1321.content:
Not wanting to risk setting the house on fire with anything too bold, Tex decided the best way to introduce you to the family's secret was to simply show you his spark. Only, upon igniting it into his hand, it became a harmless flame. This confused him but it had the desired reaction. You let out a low scream and freaked but not in the way Tex had calculated you would. "Don't panic, bro!" you yelled, gabbing his hand. "I got this under control!"

You grabbed a throw off of the couch and began to try to smother the flame in Tex's hand, causing him to giggle. "Relax, Jess, it's okay." Amused, he said. "I'm not on fire, I'm a chaotic scientist and what I showed you, or tried to show you was my spark." He gave a rueful smile. "Only it turned into a flame... I guess I need more practice."

You looked at your brother as if he had lost his mind but then pulled the throw away from his hand and watched the seemingly harmless flame burn in is palm. "I thought you were... in trouble." you muttered, blushing.

Tex shook his head, remembering your motherly protective nature. "I'm sorry I scared you, sis." Softly, he said. "But it's important for me to point out that only the boys in our family can work chaotic science, girls can not." He chuckled. "Unless we change you into a boy."

Tex did not want to tell you that you had a power of your own but he had no idea what it was and did not wish to be pressed for answers he did not have. You gave him a startled look then looked at the flame again, becoming curious.

"Cool." Intrigued, you whispered. "You said that only boys can do this, right?"

Tex nodded. "As far as I understand it, you have the potential but its asleep inside of you." Serious, he said. "Becoming a boy will 'wake it up'."

Then, you surprised Tex by asking...
1321.title: Fire or lightning?

choices: I think this will make a fine test.
13212.content:
"Well, I'm dabbling with teleportation." Reluctantly, Tex replied. "Only my success rate is less than perfect." He sighed. "What I teleport keeps returning and I can't seem to grasp what I am missing in the event needed to make it work."

Being a fan of fantasy, you shrugged. "Maybe you are not using enough power or you are not fully focusing on exactly where you want to send what you are teleporting."

"Perhaps..." Blushing, Tex said. Then he thought, "Of course she'd be the one to figure out what I'm likely doing wrong." He sighed, reciting the event command in his head, not realizing he had made a critical error. He summoned his spark, a glowing spinning orb of energy to his hand, surprising you. He sighed. "I just wish I could show you where James has been all year."

To his and your surprise, Tex's spark seemed to explode, creating a blinding light. You screamed in fight and in pain, your eyes stinging before you felt a rush. Instantly after, you hit the floor with your head spinning and your eyes burning. Unknown to you, they were slightly scorched from Tex summoning too much of his power to bear. You struggled to your feet, hearing voices somewhere near by and began to feel your way along the wall to find help.

"What the hell was that, Tex?!" Annoyed, you called out. "Where'd you go?!"

You paused hearing a number of male voices, all stating, "Huh?" before stating, rather mischievously, "Hmmm!"

"As you were!" An authoritative voice barked. You recognized it as James. You jumped feeling someone firmly grip your shoulder. "Jessica, are you alright?"

"I think so, other than my eyes stinging." Feeling faint, you replied. "I can't see thanks to Tex blowing up his spark in my face."

You then explained what had happened to which James gave a low sigh. "You better come with me, sis." Wearily, he said. You felt something being clamped onto your wrist with a low beep. It felt like a tight bracelet or a handcuff. "Keep that on if you know what's good for you."

Confused, dizzy, feeling drained, you allowed James to lead you to a room where you heard another familiar voice, it was your grandfather, Devlin Moray. "What exactly transpired here?" With a sigh, he demanded.

James urged you to sit in a chair. "Stay here until I get back." Almost forcefully, he said. "I shall deal with this matter."

He then walked away and you heard him and grandpa talking but you could not hear what was being said. Finally, footsteps approached you again and you heard grandpa give a light chuckle as if he were amused by something. Finally, he said...
13212.title: Open questions opens the door to trouble.

choices: You are given a tour of the school.
132122.content:
James gasped upon hearing Devlin's words. "Lord..." Gasping, he began.

"It is not the test you are fearing, dear child." Calmly, Devlin said. "I only intend to heal Jessica's eyes and give her a tour of your Alma-Matter." He then gave a rather mad chuckle. "We shall see how your little brother and father deal with her absence, knowing what had sent the event into motion."

"What am I to tell father?" Worried James demanded.

"The truth, of course." Simply, Devlin said. "It is illogical to lie."

James sighed then gave you a warm hug. "Take care, sis." Whispering, she said. "I'll see you when you return home."

This startled you as Jame then walked away without a word. "Grandpa..." Worried, you asked. "What's going on?"

Devlin chuckled. "I assure you, Jessica, you are very safe." Calmly, he said. "First, we will tend to your eyes and then I will show you what your older brother had been doing during his year away from home."

Twenty minutes later, James returned home to a very concerned dad who beckoned him into his study. "Tex had come to me in a panic." Flatly, he said. "He recited a teleport event and inadvertently sent Jessica to part unknown..."

James sighed. "The teleport event scorched Jessica's eyes." Softly, he reported. "She is at Eligere Sententia all boys boarding school."

Dad sighed, a look of disapproval on his face. "Has she been enrolled as a new male student for the year?"

"Lord head mad scientist, Devlin Moray wishes to use the event as a test and intends to give Jessica a tour of the school." Frowning, James replied. "I do not know who the test was on or for, he would not elaborate."

Dad turned to a window as if to think. Moments later, he sighed. "I must make a number of phone calls." Serious, he said. "Please ensure Tex is complying with the punishment I had laid down for reckless use of untrained chaotic science."

James nodded and walked towards Tex's bedroom...
132122.title: Grandfather's mischief.

1321222.content:
You sat still while a sweet smelling cloth was placed over your eyes for a moment before it was removed. "You should be able to see now, my dear." Calmly, Devlin said. "Please open your eyes."

Slowly, you opened your eyes and found that you were in a spacious office overlooking a vast hallway with a large number of doors and stairways going in almost every direction. "Where am I?" Startled, you demanded. "Tex actually teleported me here?!"

"That he did though I have a feeling he is already regretting it after receiving the lecture of his life from his father." Bemused, Devlin said. "I asked you to remain so I could give you a tour of the fine institution that teaches young gentlemen like your brothers the powers and laws of chaotic science."

He offered his hand, which you reluctantly accepted and he guided you out of his office and into the vast hall. "How do you make your way around here without getting lost?" Wincing, you asked. "The halls and stairs seem to be going in every direction."

"How does one find his way through New York City or Tokyo as the streets and alleys seem to go in every direction?" Smiling, Devlin countered. "They explore, they ask for directions, they get a map..."

"I get the idea." Giggling, you said.

Devlin gave a short cackle. "The bracelet you are wearing, as ominous as it appears is a warning to all teachers and students that you are strictly a visitor and not a n enrolled student." Calmly, he said. "So long as you keep it on during your visit, you will have nothing to fear."

You nodded then again looked at the seemingly endless halls, doors, and stairs. "What did you want to show me first?"

Devlin smiled. "What would you like to see?" Bemused, he asked. "We offer a near endless array of classes here at Eligere Sententia all boys boarding school."

You decided to turn Devlin's question around. "What would you recommend?"

Devlin chuckled. "I would love to introduce you to..."
1321222.title: You are given a tour of the school.

13212221.content:
Devlin chuckled. "I would love to introduce you to Professor Nero Osis." Calmly he said. "He's your older brother's age."

"James' age?" Surprised, you asked. "How did he become a professor?"

"Great deeds bring great rewards in this world, Jessica." Motioning you to follow, Devlin replied. "Nero learned of a plot by a number of young mad scientists to raid Spellblossom all girls boarding school so to prank the teachers there." Seeing your confusion, he added, "A school for witchcraft, a power you will be discovering soon enough."

"How did he put a halt to this?" Curious, you inquired.

Devlin smiled. "He expertly infiltrated the school and picked the boys off one by one as they began their mischievous raid." Amused, he explained. "He left the would be raiders to be discovered by the teaching staff before any student was aware of their presence." He gave another chuckle. "What was even more impressive was that he remained undetected while doing it and left the school after he performed his deed."

"That is incredible." Impressed, you said. "How did he pull it off?"

Devlin grinned. "That is classified by request of the witch council." Opening a door, he said. "They do not want too many other mad scientists pulling that stunt."

You were led into a large classroom where you found a muscular man of average height with messy, longish black hair. He wore a boomer hat, and a black suit covered by a long white lab coat. He turned, hearing Devlin clear his throat, revealing bright hazel eyes under thick glasses with goggles hung onto his hat. He gave a toothy grin, saluting Devlin with a wolf's head cane.

"Welcome to my lair of teachings, great Devlin Moray!" Smiling, he said. "To what honor do I find you visiting my class here at Eligere Sententia?"

"The unexpected honor of proudly giving my granddaughter a tour of this fine school has been bestowed upon me." Motioning to you, Devlin explained. "I wish her to understand our powers rather than fear them." He then chuckled. "she has not yet discovered her lineage."

"I cannot contain my curiosity, my most patient leader." Grinning, Nero said. "How did this unexpected honor come your way?"

Devlin grinned. "Her twin brother attempted a teleport event but unintentionally used too much power and sent her here rather than elsewhere."

Nero threw his head back, laughing before turning to you. "It is a common error among chaotic scientists who are new to the use of events." Bemused, he said. "What do you make of our school thus far?"

"It's... interesting." In a guarded tone, you replied. "I have not really been given a full tour yet so... I'm holding judgement."

"Perhaps you will be enticed to enroll." Grinning, Nero said. "We offer far more than any normal academic institution..."

"It's not one of the first items on my to do list." Wincing, you said.

"Ah! You did not state it was not on your to do list!" Smiling, Nero pointed out. "You must be specific when answering a question as many answers can be turned against you if left open for interpretation."

You jumped at that and quickly said. "I have not yet decided."

Nero smiled. "That's better." Calmly, he said. "You will find that mad scientists and witches alike will use your own logic against you to get their way."

"Witches...?" Taken back, you asked.

"Magic wielders." Simply, Devlin said. "As I said, a power you will discover later in life."

"It almost sounds like you two are trying to recruit me..." Wincing, you said.

Nero and Devlin smiled. "Of course, we are, my dear." Calmly, Nero said. "You may not know it but you have great potential."
13212221.title: The professor who taught James.

132122211.content:
Just then, a number of students around your age entered the classroom, madly chuckling to themselves as they took their seats. Devlin pulled you into a large painted square on the floor near Nero's desk. "It would be wise to remain within the visitor's square during this class." Serious, he said. "These students are, shall we say, overzealous..."

The students were immediately aware of your presence the moment they took their seats and grinned madly before turning their attention to Nero. "I see you have you brought us a young lady to experiment on, my gracious professor." Smiling, one student asked. "What sort of madness will we be showing her today?"

You gulped only to see Devlin wink at you before turning to Nero who threw his head back, laughing upon seeing his knowledgeable glance. "I see all of you have skipped the all important chapter of magical lineage." Grinning madly, he said. "Consider yourselves fortunate this young lady has her grandfather's patience in her blood."

Setting eyes on Devlin, the students turned considerably pale to which Nero chuckled. "You have guessed correctly, my young miscreants." Motioning to you, he said. "The young lady you were so eager to experiment upon is the granddaughter of Devlin Moray and the next in line for the throne of the witching world, Jessica Moray."

Your eyes went wide in surprise but you quickly narrowed them, giving a small grin as you softly said, "Charmed..."

Devlin chuckled softly. "Epic save, Jessica." Whispering carefully, he said. He then said out loud, "You have your mother's quick wit."

"To what honor do we have both the head mad scientist and the heir to the throne of the witching world visiting our class?" Courtly, another student asked.

You cleared your throat then turned to Nero. "I ask permission to address your class, most patient professor." Calmly, you said.

Nero raised a single eyebrow, a curious look on his face. "By all means, fair witch." Grinning, he said. "Address my class of mad scientists in training."

"This should be interesting..." Whispering, Devlin said.

"I am here due to an experiment spearheaded by my twin brother, Tex Moray." With a straight face, you said. "However, being untrained, his theory was flawed."

"Exactly what was your brother's experiment?" Curious, Nero asked.

"To show me where my older brother was the previous year." Simply, I replied.

Devlin grinned. "Her twin brother attempted a teleport event but failed to take into account their augmented power as twins." bemused, he said. "Jessica appeared within the halls rather than outside the gates. Their combined power, as twins was strong enough to force a teleport through the shields, giving you a hint of her magical power."

All of the students turned pale in a stunned surprise. "Will Jessica Moray be studying here?" Politely, another student asked. "As identical twins, their power would be ten fold greater."

"A hundred fold, to be precise." Calmly, Devlin corrected. "However, do you seriously wish to risk the wrath of her grandmother, the current head witch?"

Tex grinned madly. "You really do have affections for him." Bemused, he said.

"Shut up..." Blushing, you said. "We're just friends... for now."

"Of course you are." Grinning, Tex said. Seeing your face harden, he turned serious. "No, Jack is not a chaotic scientist but he is not one to take lightly either. James is fully trained in the art and Matt will become one so long as nothing changes to prevent it."

"What do you mean? Wincing, you asked.

"It's a bit complicated." Sighing, Tex replied. "Also, a bit over my head so I'll let father explain that one to you when the time is right."

"You don't know?" Curious, you asked.

"My spark first ignited approximately a fortnight prior to this date." Slowly, Tex explained. "I had returned home early due to feeling ill and was excused from school." You nodded, indicating Tex to continue. "As you might imagine, my reaction was similar to your own. With father's protective nature, I was surprised he did not immediately come running to investigate." He sighed. "I had foolishly decided to keep the discovery of my new found powers a secret but quickly found that they were unstable at best. I needed training and turned to our father."

"What happened?" Whispering, I demanded.

"At first I thought he was going to panic then he showed me his own spark." Frowning, Tex replied. "Besides him, you are the only other individual aware of this, Jessica. My only hope is that father will not be displeased that I revealed our secret."
13213.title: Is Jack a chaotic scientist too?

1322.content:
"You want to show me something?" confused but curious, you asked.

Tex nodded then opened the book. "Excuse me a moment, I'm just learning."

You giggled, thinking your brother was trying to be funny. "What are you going to do?" lightly teasing, you asked. "Try to turn me into a frog?"

"Not quite." chuckling, Tex replied. "I'm just going to help you make a splash."

Before you could respond, you heard the sound of water sloshing around above you and looked up just in time to see a literal waterfall hit you, soaking everything in the room! The water was ice cold and you were soaked to the skin by the time the water stopped. Tex winced, seeing you dripping wet, then turned to the room and saw the damage. He knew that dad would not be pleased with him but he had no time to think of what to do as you screamed at the top of your lungs...

"DADDY!!"
1322.title: Making a big splash.

13221.content:
Dad ran into the room shortly after hearing your scream and took immediate notice of the water logged room. To say he was unimpressed would have been an understatement as he slowly turned to Tex, a death look in his eyes. "I want to know exactly what happened here." softly, he said.

"Dad, I can explain!" his face pale, Tex said.

"It was my fault, dad." sadly, you said.

Dad turned to you, a look of surprise on his face. "Yours, Jessica?" looking at you questionably, he asked.

"I- I teased Tex about the book I found." softly, you said. "I guess he was proving to me that mad science was real."

Dad sighed then turned to Tex. "Have you forgotten that we were going to wait with telling Jessica the truth until hers and your birthday next week?" sternly, he asked. "Also, do you realize the damage you had caused with your impatience to show off your unstable powers?"

Tex began to shiver. "Please don't do anything to me." near tears, he begged.

"Dad..." looking at him, you said. "Can you fix this?"

Dad snapped his fingers and the room was back to the way it was before in a flash. "It was not the damage to the room I was referring to, honey." more calmly, he said. "I was referring to the damage to the trust you have in this family."

"What do you mean?" worried, you asked.

Dad sighed. "Only boys can produce, harness, and control chaotic energy." softly, he explained. "Girls have this power as well but it lies dormant within them until they are transformed into a boy." he winced. "You can develop a resistance to this power but it must be used against you for it to build."

"So I'm powerless among a family of mad scientists?" fearful, you asked.

"You are far from powerless." chuckling, dad said. "You will discover this when the time is right." he then turned to Tex. "Mat will get his laboratory far before you if you keep this up. Also, if you don't earn the lab soon, you may find yourself in a... different situation."

He walked out of the room, leaving both you and Tex shaken but for different reasons.
13221.title: Dad runs in.

132212.content:
Before you could say a word, Tex stormed off. "Different situation..." frustrated, he muttered. "A fine way to put girlification... Humph!"

"Girlification?" confused, you asked.

Tex did not reply, he instead left the room, mumbling to himself about deserving a lab and not getting to have any fun while training. Learning that all the boys in your family were mad scientists was enough of a shock, let alone you did not have this power. Still, dad mentioned girls had a power but he did not explain what it was.

"Tex seems real upset over not earning his lab." trying to sort things out, you whispered. "I wonder why he has to earn it and what is girlification? dues it have anything to do with him earning his lab?"

"Your close." replied a voice, starting her.

You turned to find...
132212.title: Tex storms away.

1322121.content:
Upon seeing James, you gave him a warm hug, which he returned. "I missed you." releasing him, you said. "Where have you been all year?"

"Training." with a smile, James replied. "I take it you know the family secret."

"Yeah, Tex showed me by giving me a shower in the sitting room." ruefully, you replied. "Dad said something about him having a different situation if he didn't earn his lab soon..."

"That has to do with you." interrupting, James said. "You see, being twins, you and he share a sort of connection that determines both of your fates."

"Our fates?" worried, you asked. "What do you mean?"

James sighed and pointed to a portrait of mom, hanging on the wall above the fire place. "Dad, as you know, is a mad scientist." sadly, he said. "Mom was a witch, they fell in love. When the boy twin of a witch reaches a certain age, he becomes a girl and a witch to form a balance."

"Are you saying I'm a witch?" surprised, you asked. "Is that the power dad said I had?"

James nodded. "Only you must discover this power on your own; we do not have the ability, or rather, the magic to give it to you early." serious, James said. he summoned a flame to his hand. "When this appears in your hand, it means you have discovered the power and will need to be trained."

"By who?" nervous, you asked.

"Dad and I have that worked out, don't worry." with a rueful smile, James replied. "The point is, if you gain magic before Tex gets his lab, he will risk becoming your sister, your true twin."

"What!?" taken back, you asked. "That's why he wants his lab so badly..."

"On the same side of the coin, however." raising a finger, James said. "If he gets his lab before you discover magic, you may end up becoming his brother, his true twin."

"What do you mean 'might' become his brother?" not liking the idea, you asked.

"The magic within you may protect you from what we call the 'twin factor'." patiently, James replied. "Tex's chaotic energy, his mad science, may equally protect him but there is really no telling until it happens."

"I see..." softly, I said. "Talk about sibling rivalry."

"Its not really rivalry." gently, James said. "Just the life of a family of mad scientists and witches."

With that, he walked out of the room, leaving you more shaken than before.

You sighed, since there was no hiding it from him. "Found this book under the couch. Seems to be about 'mad scientists'" you said. You winced again, Why didn't I just tell him its Frankenstein of something. He would had said 'boring' and left

How does Mat respond?

Mat smiled, his eyes twinkling. "That's a very special book." almost giggling, he said. "That's a mad scientist book."

You rolled your eyes. "Let me guess, you are a mad scientist." sarcastically, you said.

"I'd say yes." giggling, Mat said. he then waved his finger at me, muttering something that sounded like babble before laughing. "I love your new look, sis."

"My new look?" curious, you asked. "Have you been into the sugar again?"

You looked down and immediately screamed as you were wearing...

1412.content:
You looked down and immediately screamed as you were wearing the black pleated skirt and white blouse that made up the school's cheerleading uniform. Matt laughed seeing you blush. You turned to him not knowing if you should be angry or frightened.

"It suits you!" Amused, he said. "You look really cute in that!"

"How did you do this?" Shaking, you asked. "Give me my normal clothes back!"

"Those are normal clothes." Grinning, Matt countered. "Or would you rather me change it into something one of your dollies wear?"

Your eyes went wide, knowing that you still had a few dolls which sported very feminine outfits. One of them was dressed in a wedding gown but you hoped Matt would not dare. "I- I'd just rather wear something from my closet, thank you." Taking a step back, you said.

Matt chuckled madly as you ran from him. "Your wish is my command, dear sister!" Taunting, he called.

You reached your room, slamming the door behind you. "Here I thought Matt was creepy before." Shaken, you muttered. "When did he become a mad scientist?"

Deciding it best to talk to dad, you hurried to your closet to change. Only, as you opened the doors, you found that...
1412.title: a cheer leader outfit.

choices: You got the cheer costume off in time.
The costume is stuck, it won't come off.
14121.content:
You screamed seeing an assortment of doll outfits in your size. Many of them you recognized and you were relieved not to find a wedding gown among them. Still, you could not help feel violated as Matt had clearly invaded your room and somehow switched out all of your clothes in your closet.

"Matt Moray!" Furious, you screamed. "What did you do to my clothes!?"

"Don't you like them?" Startling you, Matt asked.

You whipped around to find Matt standing behind you with a mischievous grin on his face. "I thought you liked the clothes you put onto your dollies"

You were fuming at this point and took a breath to scream for dad but Matt quickly hushed you silent, his face turning pale. "Don't scream the 'D' word!" Near tears, he pleaded. "I'm just playing with you!"

"I don't find it funny." More quietly, you hissed. "Change my clothes back to what they were, right now."

Matt sighed. "Okay.... Spoil sport!"

You raised a single eye brow as Matt waved his hand at your clothing. To your relief, all of your clothes were back to normal. "Thank you." Patiently, you said. "Now get out of my room, I need to change out of this cheerleader outfit before my friend, Tonya sees me and gets the wrong idea."

Just then the door bell rang. Moments later, dad called up. "Honey, Tonya is here to visit you!"

Matt giggled then called out, "She's up here, Tonya! She really wants to show you something!"

You blushed brightly, not believing the stunt Matt just pulled. "You little runt-rat!" Angry, you hissed.

Matt laughed and ran down the hall to the safety of his room. You wanted to go after him but you needed to get out of the cheerleader costume before Tonya reached your room. If she saw you, she would believe you wanted to try out for the cheer squad. You quickly began to remove it.
14121.title: Matt's mischief.

choices: you tell her it's for Jack
Matt hasn't finished pranking you yet
141213.content:
"Damn it, Matt" you yelled as you frantically tried to remove the uniform. You had managed to get rid of the top and were about to ditch the pleated skirt when Tonya walked in.

"Really, Jess?" Tonya said as she eyed the discarded top. "Why would you want to join those airheads, and when did you go for pink?"

"It's not like that" you stammered, realizing Matt had changed the color of your bra. It was an even greater violation than him entering your room. "It's all Matt's fault. He put his red hat in amongst my clothes"

"So that's why you were screaming?" Tonya asked.

"Yeah."

"So what's with the cheer uniform?" she asked.

You felt constricted, knowing you can't tell Tonya about your family's unusual talents, and that you can't blame Matt for this. It was well know he was a little afraid of girls, and wouldn't/couldn't physically dress you like this. After a second of thought, you realized that Jack was the answer...
141213.title: Tonya enters and sees you.

choices: Your closet. Matt is playing games.
1412131.content:
"For Jack?" Unconvinced, Tonya asked.

"No, really." Frowning, you pressed. "He keeps telling me that I would look real good in a cheer uniform so I borrowed one from school to sort of prank him."

Tonya giggled. "He will be shocked to see you in that get up alright." Smiling, she said. "Only do you really want him staring at you while you are wearing such a short skirt?"

You blushed, shaking your head them moved to the bathroom to quickly change into something more normal before coming out. "What brings you over anyway?" Curious, you asked.

"I figured you might want to go shopping at the mall." Casually, Tonya replied. "Are you free?"
