"Well, we could walk around the mall." Kindly, Tonya suggested. "We could tell everyone that you are a visiting relative or something."

"I could show you how we normal boys have fun on a lazy weekend." Smiling, Jack offered.

"Exercise caution, Jack." Smirking, James warned. "We could very easily have Tonya show you how girls have fun over the weekend."

Jack blushed at that as Tonya giggled. "That might be interesting to see." Teasing, she said.

"Um... let's focus on one issue at a time." Wincing, you said.

James smiled. "Quite right." Calmly, he said. "You have two offers in front of you for something to occupy your time. I suggest you pick one or come up with something on your own."
1422112111.title: Jack and Tonya come for a visit.

14221121111.content:
You winced. "Sorry, Jack but hanging around with you as a guy would be just too weird." You said. "I'd feel more comfortable going to the mall with Tonya."

"Just don't get too comfortable." Under his breath, Tex grumbled.

"Jealous, Tex?" Teasing, dad asked. He chuckled, seeing him blush slightly. "Relax. I am certain Tonya will not take advantage of your little brother."

Both you and Tonya blushed slightly before laughing. "I'll be back to normal in two days." Smiling, you said. "There is nothing to worry about, bro."

"Of course, there isn't." Chiming, in, dad said. "I'll drop you two off so you can do some shopping."

Twenty minutes later, you and Tonya were walking through the mall, looking in the windows of the various shops, talking and laughing with each other. "So, tell me, how does it feel to be a guy for a while?" Quietly, Tonya asked. "Is it as weird as I think it is?"

"It's different, I can tell you that." Frowning, you replied. "Everything feels weird; even walking." You shuddered. "Having a... thing between your legs carries its own challenges. If it falls to one side or the other, it feels uncomfortable..."

"I can imagine." Wincing, Tonya said. "No wonder some guys are constantly 'adjusting' themselves."

"Can we change the subject, please." Uncomfortable, you asked. "I really don't want to think about it."

Tonya nodded and the two of you looked around for a store to look around in. Suddenly, Tonya gripped your arm, smiling. "Look, they have a sale at the Curious Oddities store."

You winced, seeing the store that sold Gothic and science fiction themed curiosities "Dad has always told me never to step foot in that store." Serious, you explained. "It's owned and operated by Uncle Damien Cain, a really creepy relative of ours."

"Your dad is just being overly protective, as usual." lightly, Tonya said. "I had been in that store dozens of times. I have quite a collection of neat stuff from there."

You remembered Tonya's collection. It was a montage of strange gadgets and props that looked like they had been used in a number of B rated science fiction movies. Tonya had played with a number of them, none of course did anything but they still worried you somehow.

"I don't know." Uncertain, you said. "Dad told me that he has a habit of messing with girls."

"Mr Cain may be creepy and strange but he's never made a single inappropriate comment or move towards me." Confident, Tonya said. "In fact, he's the nicest man you would ever want to meet."

"They all are until they reel you in." Frowning, you muttered.

"That's your dad talking." Winking, Tonya said. She smiled. "I'm going in to look around. You can either come with me or wait out here."

With that, she walked into the store.
14221121111.title: You go to the mall with Tonya.

choices: You pull Tonya out of the store.
Tonya is transformed into a doll!
142211211111.content:
"You know as well as I do that a six year old boy can't be left unattended in the mall." Pouting, you protested. "Security will put me into the mall daycare until you bail me out."

"That's true." Grinning, Tonya said. "Even then, it will take a phone call to dad to get you signed out to me as I am not your legal guardian." She motioned to the oddities shop. "Shall we?"

"I don't like this one bit." Frowning, you said.

"Oh, come on." Lightly, Tonya said. "If he was really dangerous, the mad science community would not have allowed him to put up shop in the mall."

Tonya had a valid point but you remained on guard. Dad's warning about the man was still fresh in your mind and you were ready to run out screaming at a moment's notice. The inside of the shop was filled with shelves upon shelves of various items fitting virtually every subject imaginable. The owner, Damien Cain was standing behind a tall counter off to the side. He smiled seeing Tonya but raised an eyebrow seeing you. "I'm surprised your father transformed you, Jessica." Bemused, he said. "He is usually obsessively protective of you."

"You- You recognize me?" Startled, you asked.

Damien chuckled. "Everyone has, shall we say, a unique signature that some people can detect." He smiled like a python staring down a mouse. "I sensed your presence the moment you entered the mall but I never expected to see you in the form of a little boy... It suits you."

"Don't get used to it." Pouting, you said. "I'll be back to normal in a few days."

Damien scoffed. "I wonder..." He then turned to Tonya. "What brings you here today, my curious eclectic collector? Looking for something specific?"

Tonya giggled. "You know me better than that, Mr Cain." She motioned to the items on the shelves. "When something unusual catches my eye, I just got to buy it."

"You always were a compulsive buyer." Grinning, you stated.

"My money, my business." Grinning back, Tonya countered.

Damien laughed before motioning to a sturdy shelf of dolls. "You might be interested in these rare four foot dolls I had just acquired the other day. They are rather unique as they are specially crafted. "

You did not like how Damien emphasized 'specially crafted.' You took a closer look and gasped upon seeing a single tear run from one of the doll's eye. "They're alive!"

You began to panic as Tonya reached up to touch one of them...
142211211111.title: You follow Tonya in.

1422112111111.content:
Before Tonya could reach the doll, you grabbed her arm and pulled her away. Tonya turned to see your panicked expression. "What's wrong?"

"We're leaving." Firmly, you ordered. "I will not get grounded because you want to shop here!"

Without waiting for Tonya's response, you pulled her out of the store with a strength you did not know you could possess as a six year old. Damien watched you exit the store with a curious look on his face. "Come again." Casually, he said.

Once you were out of ear shot of anyone, you turned to your friend. "Those dolls were alive, Tonya!" Whispering, you explained. "I saw a single tear running from one of their eyes." You shivered at the thought of what might have happened to Tonya. "I'm calling father."

You pulled your cellphone out of your pocket and began to dial the number when someone grabbed the phone from your hand! Annoyed, you looked up to see...
1422112111111.title: You pull Tonya out of the store.

14221121111112.content:
"I am honestly trying to rebuild my reputation, young man." Irritated, Damien said. "Exactly why are you calling your father after briefly entering my place of business?"

"One of those 'dolls' were crying!" Whispering, you snapped. "They are alive! What did you do to them!?"

Damien paused before chuckling. "I can see how you would suspect that." Softly, he said. "However, I am a little more careful than that."

"What are they then?" Raising an eyebrow, you demanded. "Also, if they were nothing, why did you take my phone from me?"

"No explanation would be good enough for your father once you hit the 'panic button'." Evenly, Damien replied. "That is especially true when it involves me as his trust in me is virtually nonexistent." He sighed. "The dolls were designed to look like real children. I merely modified them to act like real children as well for certain collectors."

"Why?" Unconvinced, you asked.

Damien smiled, handing you back your cell phone. "You would be surprised how many 'scientific folk' do not have any children." Simply, he said. "These models fill that void in their lives."

You looked at your cellphone and frowned seeing that the battery was nearly completely drained. Damien shrugged at your accusing glare. "Let's get out of here, Tonya." Huffing, you said.

Tonya sighed then...
14221121111112.title: Damien Cain.

143.content:
"That's weird." Walking up to you, Matt said. "Who would buy a book about mad scientists?"

He casually took the book from your hand and gasped before dropping it to the floor. You became concerned as your little brother looked as if he had just been electrocuted. His hair was almost literally standing straight up and he had a stunned look on his face. "Are you okay?" Worried, you asked. "What happened?"

"I- I'm not sure." Shaken, Matt said. "The second I touched that book, I got a jolt like I had just stuck a key into a light socket."

"Seriously?" Surprised, you asked. "It didn't do anything to me."

Matt pouted. "You don't believe me, do you?"

"I believe you, Matt." Reassuringly, you said. "Your hair stood on end the moment you touched the book. What I want to know is why."

"I'm not touching that book again." stepping back, Matt said. "It's probably boring anyway."

You watched Matt run out of the room before turning to the book lying on the floor. You picked it up without any incident except for the fact you were now drawn to open it and gaze upon the pages within. After what had happened to Matt, you were hesitant to follow that urge. If he got a shock from just touching it, what would happen if you peered into the pages?
143.title: He doen't know about the book, and is curious

choices: he tells you its guys stuff
dad reluctantly tells you about science
all three brothers burst in, and for some reason, they're in skirts
1432.content:
The fact that Matt wasn't faking it by having visible signs of electrocution was enough to convince you that opening this book would be bad for your health. Silently, you picked up the book and took it to dad. He was alone in the den, watching tv.

"Yes, sweetie" dad said as he noticed your approach.

"I found this weird book. I showed Matt it, but it zapped him badly as he tried to open it" you said, not wanting to say your youngest brother got electrocuted by a book. Dad would never believe you. Surprisingly, he focused his full attention onto you the second you said 'weird book'. It was highly unnerving.

"Matt got a severe electric shock? Did he manage to open it?" dad asked, concerned.

"No. I don't think he wants to touch it again, though. How did you know? What is this thing?" you asked.

Dad visibly relaxed upon hearing that Matt didn't see anything, but tensed up almost immediately afterwards. "Did you manage to see anything?"

"No, but I felt like reading it. I-it's weird. What is going on, daddy?" you asked.

"You've set in motion something that has to be stopped. I know it's cryptic, and probably a little creepy, but trust me, you do not want to know" dad said.

"What is going on? Daddy, I'm nearly 13" you said.

"I know, sweetie" dad said...
1432.title: You take it to dad.

choices: the room suited for a little girl.
Matt wearing your old play clothes.
Matt talking to a girl his age.
14321.content:
"For now, I will only tell you its a 'guy thing', Jessica." Smiling slightly, dad said. "It, err, zapped Matt because he is a little too young and well... a bit on the feminine side."

"That's not funny, dad." Unimpressed, you said. "Matt may be girl-phobic but he is far from a sissy."

Dad shook his head. "Matt is transgender, Jessica." Surprising you, he said. "As it stands, he is more a 'she' though he does not see it that way quite yet."

"What?" Shocked, you asked. You frowned. "That does not explain how a book could electrocute Matt by just touching it. Also, why did it not zap me, I am fully female."

Dad sighed. "It's really all too much for you to take in right now, Jessica." Firmly, he said. "Just promise me not to look into the pages of this book." His smile returned. "After all, it's just a book... right?"

You rolled your eyes and walked out of the room. "Whatever, dad." Frustrated, you said. "I'm going to check on Matt; make sure he's okay."

You were annoyed that dad was treating an unusual event like some kind of joke. Every answer he gave you just brought more questions. What was set into motion that had to be stopped?"

Upon reaching Matt's room you noticed that the door was slightly open. Curious, you peered in and was surprised to find...
14321.title: Answers bring more questions.

143213.content:
You saw Matt, still in his school uniform, sitting on the floor talking to a girl his age. She was wearing the girls' school uniform, sitting across from Matt in Indian style. You did not remember hearing or seeing anyone enter the house. What was more disturbing was the girl looked identical to Matt minus the gender.

"I don't know who you are or where you came from, Maddie." Frightened, Matt said. "Still, you will not convince this family that you are me! Not in a million years!"

"Oh how little you understand, Matt." Grinning, the girl, Maddie said. "I am you! The only difference is that I'm a girl rather than an icky mud covered boy."

"Better a mud covered boy than a weed smelling girl!" Annoyed, Matt countered. "I belong here, you don't!"

"You can't get rid of me that easily, Matt." Amused, Maddie said. "We share the same body! It is only a matter of time before one of us takes over completely."

"I won't let you!" Angry, Matt yelled. "I was here first!"

"Face it, girl!" Taunting, Maddie said. "You are more female than male on the outside. The insides will catch up soon enough and the boy you will go bye bye!"

Matt screamed, throwing a fist only the girl vanished, her giggles echoing in the room. Matt fell to his knees, crying. "I don't want to be an icky girl!" Whispering, he sobbed. "There has to be a way to stop her, there just has to be!"

You were not sure what to make of what you had seen. Backing away from the door, you wondered what to do, if there was anything you could do.
143213.title: Matt's gender conflict.

choices: you shock Tex in silence by mentioning the book
you're too busy to notice Matt's approach
you sneak back to your own bedroom
1432133.content:
You don't know why, but your gut feeling told you that you should investigate Matt's room. Quickly, but cautiously, as you didn't want to be detected, you walked up to the bedrooms and threw open Matt's door. You didn't even have to take a step before you gave a loud gasp. Matt's room appeared to be as unstable as his body, with a mixture of his normal things and some belongings that were more suited to a girly girl's bedroom, such as a partial canopy over part of his bed. Even his bedroom walls were a weird cream color and not his usual blue.

"I didn't think you could get a cream that looked pink and blue at the same time" you muttered, worried for your brother. It was a mistake; your gasps and mutterings attracted Tex, though fortunately, he was too lazy to get up and investigate in person. "What are you doing, Jess?" he called from his room.

"Nothing" you replied. You knew Matt wouldn't like it if you got Tex involved. You were certain he wouldn't like it if you openly said to him you knew what was happening.

"Really? You're up to something" Tex said.

You bit your lip, hoping he wouldn't investigate. "Yeah, I'm really up to no good" you said in a dry voice, hoping to deter him.
1432133.title: You enter Matt's room.

choices: You take Matt to dad and demand answers.
14321332.content:
"Enjoying the view?" Startling you, Matt asked sarcastically.

You jumped then turned to Matt before quickly pulling him into his room and closing the door. "How long as this been happening?" Urgently, you asked. "Why have you not told dad?"

"This started about a week ago." Tearing up, Matt said. "Did you have anything to do with this? Wanting a little sister in the family?"

"I had nothing to do with this!" Surprised Matt suspected you. "How do you think I could even manage something even remotely close to this?"

"I dunno." Scuffing his feet, Matt said. "Magic, maybe..."

"Magic?" Scoffing, you asked. "Really?"

"How else would you say this is happening to me?!" Tears falling, Matt demanded. "I have a crazy girl who looks like me wanting to replace me!" He sobbed the added, "She wants me to go bye bye!"

"Maybe we can go see Dr Homes." Worried for your brother, you suggested. "She might know something or know someone who can shed more light on this."

Reluctantly, Matt agreed and you took him next door to your friend's house, Tonya Homes whose mother was your family physician. You knocked on the door and Dr. Christina Homes answered. She sighed seeing the tears in Matt's eyes and the worry in yours. "I take it that it's started." Softly, she said.

"What has started?" In unison, you and Matt asked.

Christina sighed again and ushered you both inside. "Matt, you are a Transgender." Patiently, Christina said. "That means that you are between being a boy and a girl. Normally, transgender children lead a somewhat normal life but, in your case, it is a bit more complicated."

"What do you mean?" Worried, you asked.

"A lot of this you will have to get from your father." Wincing, Christina said. "It is not that I don't want to tell you it is that I do not completely understand it all myself."

"What do you understand then?" Pressing, you demanded. "You have to know something."

Christina sighed. "All I can tell you two is that Matt is making the transition from boy to girl only the boy part of him is fighting it, causing a sort of split personality issue."

"Is there any way to fight this?" Desperate, Matt asked. "Please, Dr. Homes... I- I'm scared!"

Stephanie gave Matt a warm hug. "I know you are, Matt." Gently, she said. "However, what you are going through is beyond my power to control let alone reverse." She paused to think then said, "If your father will not help you, I suggest you call your aunt Viva or talk to the portrait of you mom."

"Talk to the portrait...?" Raising an eyebrow, you asked. "What...?"

"There are a lot of things you have yet to learn, Jessica." Softly, Christina said. "Just trust me. This is all I can do for you and Matt."

Upon returning home, you looked at the portrait, turned to the phone, then looking towards dad's study; the door was open. You were not entirely certain what to do. All you were certain of was that you had a lot of questions and you wanted answers.
14321332.title: You try to help Matt.

choices: You run out of your closet.
143213322.content:
"I must be out of my mind." Sighing, you thought.

You looked up at the portrait of your mother over the mantle of the fireplace in the sitting room of your home. She resembled you in many ways with her long raven hair and ocean blue eyes. The portrait was done so well, the image looked almost alive. You cleared your throat then said, "Mommy.... I need your help."

To your surprise, the portrait moved! The image of mom smiled kindly at you! "Please tell me what troubles you, Jessica." Softly, she said. There was a slight echo in her voice as if shew and you were in a completely empty room.

You briefly explained the events that had happened since you returned from school for the weekend including the book of Chaotic Science, the shock Matt got from it and his apparent slow transformation into a girl. When you were done, you added, "Dad and Dr. Holmes aren't telling us anything useful. Please, mommy, can you help me?"

The image of mom smiled. "I was a witch in life, Jessica." Calmly, she said. "I know this is hard to believe but you will find proof of it in the attic; there is a secret door to it in the back of your closet." Mom then blew you a kiss. "When one door closes, another will open; all of your answers are there."

With that said, the portrait stopped moving and fell silent once more. "The back of my closet?" Confused, you asked. "I never saw a door there before."

Shaken and confused, you hurried to your room and entered your walk in closet. Moving to the rear, you found no door. Then you thought of what mom had said. "When one door closes..."

You walked back to the closet door and closed it. The instant you did, you felt a draft and hurried to the back of your closet to find an open door leading to a ladder leading up into the attic. "This is creepy."
143213322.title: You talk to the portrait.

1432133221.content:
You could almost feel your heart pounding in your throat as you slowly ascended the ladder into the attic. Finding a light switch, you expected a few light bulbs to illuminate the space. Only, to your surprise, a number of torches lit inside strange lanterns that were hovering in the air on their own. You walked passed selves upon shelves of old, dusty books in semi-circular shelves into an open area where you found a huge cauldron surrounded by two semi-circular stacked gardens on either side with a large variety of herbs, flowers, and plants. On the far side of the attic was a small platform near an opening in the house's sizable chimney with a broomstick resting upon a stand. Not too far from the platform was a bed with a huge row of shelves holding various vials with different colored liquids inside. Taking it all in left you in a state of awe and wonder.

"What is all of this?" Whispering, you muttered.

Turning to the cauldron, you felt compelled to approach it but stopped upon seeing your pet crow, Neva fly in through a window. The black crow was given to you by mom the year she died. You named her Neva after your mom's maiden name. Neva perched upon a tall stand near the cauldron and squawked, "Welcome!"

You smiled slightly and looked into the cauldron, wondering what to do. Neva then squawked, "Just say something!"

Taken back by Neva's sudden increase in vocabulary, you spoke into the cauldron. "I need help; mom told me I can get my answers here."

At first, nothing happened. Then, the water in the cauldron began to boil, causing you to step back as a bright green flame shot out from the waters! A startled scream echoed from your lips just before an image of your aunt, Viva Vogue appeared within the smoke.

"What is it that troubles you, my apprentice witch?" Kindly, Viva asked. "I will walk you through the steps to solve whatever issue you may have."

What happens now?
1432133221.title: You enter the attic.

choices: Dad searches for a cure for Matt.
14321332211.content:
"Apprentice witch?" Taken back, you asked. "I'm not a witch."

"Of course, you are, dear child." Smiling, Viva replied. "Only we must deal with one issue at a time. You said that you needed help."

"Oh, yes!" Remembering Matt, you said. "It's about my little brother, Matt. He's having a gender issue."

You briefly explained what had happened as you did with the portrait of mom. When you were finished, Viva shook her head, a bemused look on her face. "What you described can only be resolved by your little brother's will to remain a boy." Softly, she said. "This was going to happen when he became a teenager anyway but touching the book of chaotic science sped things along."

"Is there anything I can do at all?" Worried for your brother, you asked.

"Not without learning magic." Serious, Viva said. "I could help but only if your brother or your father calls me and asks for it."

"I'm asking for help." Wincing, you protested. "Can't you at least come over and look at him?"

Viva smiled sadly. "You father and I are under a no interference agreement with each other." Apologetically, she said. "For me to jump in, Matt needs to call me himself or your father must call me on his behalf. It's kind of a legal matter."

You sighed. "Then teach me how to help him." Knotting your jaws, you demanded. "Where do i start to learn this magic?"

"It will take you weeks to learn the needed spells to help your brother." Wincing, Viva said. "I know I seem to be acting the part of 'the villain' right now but I can not break the agreement." After a thought, she added, "If you are determined to help your brother, I will teach you all you need to know but it will come at a cost."

"I'm ready when you are, aunt Viva." Determined, you said.

Viva nodded. "Prepare yourself, Jessica Moray." Serious, she said. "You are in for a rough week of study scramming and crash courses in spells and potions."

You sighed then steeled yourself. "It will be worth it to help my family." Serious, you replied.
14321332211.title: You talk to aunt Viva.

143213322113.content:
While aunt Viva began to give you a crash course in witchcraft, dad entered his laboratory. It was a massive lair deep underground of which he prided himself in building with his own two hands. He marched passed nearly countless stations before coming to a large number of computer screens that faced a circular disk built into the floor with a podium holding a control panel. Dad stepped onto the disk and tapped a number of keys on a control panel. "Fellow mad scientists, hear my plea!" Firmly, he called.

The monitors instantly came to life with a number of mad scientists all with concerned to panicked looks upon their faces. Below their images, their names appeared on the screen. "It is very rare that you call upon the collective for assistance, Nathan Moray." Worry in his voice, one man, named Don said. "What is it that you require of us?"

"This is a personal matter which involves scientific pride." Standing his ground, dad said. "I have spawned a son with Neko traits; his potential for scientific might is great!"

"However, there is clearly an issue." Guessing correctly, another mad scientist, named Frank stated. "Otherwise, you would not have called upon us for guidance."

"I have guided you all individually and as a group!" Annoyed, dad thundered. "This is your chance to pay your debt of honor to me!"

"Explain the situation which involves your Neko son." Calmly, Don said. "We will discuss options with you for a solution."

Dad took a breath. "As explained, my youngest son, Matt was born male with Neko wolf traits." Calmly, he began. "My wife, fearing the scenario I now face, attempted to permanently transform him into the female state of which I denied her with my own efforts."

"This is an issue of mixing magics then." Frowning, Frank said. "Please continue."

"Matt's chaotic power has begun to surface." Showing pride, dad said. He sighed. "However, so has is magical power. He is now locked in mental combat with his female self in a battle for supremacy."

"The answer to your problem is elementary, my dear Nathan Moray." Serious, Don said. "Make use of the restoration formula or, as it had been dubbed by witches, the 'boy maker'."

"I have considered that option." Frowning, dad countered. "The reset potion, dubbed the 'girl maker' did not have any effect upon Matt when used by my late wife. The restoration formula is similar in design, its chances of success are just as remote."

"Then I suggest you make a better formula to assist your offspring, Nathan Moray." Frowning, a third scientist, named Robert, said. "It is the most logical option."

"There is another option." After a thought, Frank said. "However, its chances of success all hinges upon the boy's determination to remain male."

"Tell me of this option so I may consider it!" Firmly, dad barked.

"Balance his existence." Serious, Frank said. "With a perfect mixture of both magic and chaotic energy your Neko son will be able to become the mad scientist he is destined to be as well as become a human familiar the likes of which witches would tremble in his presence!"

Dad paused, considering the options given to him. "I thank you for your guidance, fellow mad scientists!" Smiling, he finally said. "I shall, of course, praise your efforts to assist the Moray family!"

The scientists all bowed before the screens went blank. As dad then walked away from the podium, he considered his options. Finally, he decided to...
143213322113.title: Dad searches for a cure for Matt.

choices: Dad slips the serum into Matt's tea.
Dad decides to just give Matt a shot.
1432133221132.content:
"I will treat this as I did with Jessica and Tex." Moving from station to station, dad mused. "Just as there must be a balance between a witch and mad scientist who are twins, a similar balance must be made in Matt who is both a witch and a mad scientist at once."

Dad began to laugh hysterically as he worked the various controls, jumped from one station to the next. Sparks flew and machinery hummed while dad mixed chemicals, exotic herbs, and rare minerals through a single machine. Watching with a snake like grin, a small vile filled one drop at a time until it was filled before dad carefully drew the strange elixir into a syringe.

"Mad science yet again prevails!" Screaming in delight, he announced to his empty lab. "Behold, vile world, the gender balance serum!"

Dad again laughed hysterically, holding the syringe up as if it were a rare jewel before suddenly pausing. "Only how to administer this serum into Matt without causing either his male or female side to suspect anything is out of the ordinary...

After another pause, dad chuckled madly before stating, "Oh, I know how..."
1432133221132.title: Try to balance Matt's powers.

choices: Matt's blast missed but hit someone else.
14321332211323.content:
Moments later, a grandfather clock in the sitting room moved aside on its own and dad emerged from a small elevator hidden behind it with the syringe in hand. "Matt has a unquestionable fear of needles." Smiling, he muttered to himself. "Both sides of him will be too panicked to notice anything is the slightest out of the ordinary." He chuckled. "It will make it more difficult to administer but it will be more fun."

Dad walked up the stairs to Matt's bedroom where he found him sitting on the floor, arguing with a ghostly image of his female self. Listening to them, dad smiled, knowing that they were essentially the same person just holding the view point of opposite genders. He politely knocked and opened the door, a mischievous grin forming upon his face. "I do apologize for interrupting your enthusiastic debate." His smile becoming sinister, he said. "However, it is time for my little brain child to take his medicine."

Dad held up the syringe he had up till now been hiding behind his back. Upon seeing it, both Matt and Mattie's eyes grew wide in fear as dad chuckled madly. The two versions of Matt screamed in unison and ran for the nearest wall as the door was blocked. With a wave of his right hand, a door instantly appeared and he ran through it with his female version right behind. Dad laughed hysterically as the door vanished behind them and gave pursuit through the halls. "Come now, my needle phobic off spring!" Amused, dad called. "It's just a pinch on the arm, really!"

"Its what's in the needle I don't trust!" Running, Matt yelled back. "Cease and desist this pursuit! I will not comply to your syringe!"

"You will comply, Matt!" Chuckling, dad countered. "I am quite persistent!"

"We are more so today!" Crossly, Mattie yelled.

"Witches and mad scientists alike must learn to identify potions without looking at a label." Serious, Rose explained. "This will help you in more ways than you might realize."

"So you don't accidentally drink something that will bring you trouble." Guessing, Mattie said.

"That's exactly right." Smiling, Rose said. She turned to you. "Wave your hand over the vile you had selected and allow your magic to give you a sense of what it is."

"Okay..." Uncertain, you said.

You slowly waved your hand over the vile and almost immediately got a dreadful sense of the world growing larger around you. A gasp escaped your lips, almost causing you to drop the vile. "It's a shrinking potion!" Startled, you announced! "If I had drank that..."

"You are close." Smiling, Rose said. "That is an age regression serum."

"I picked a serum?" Worried, you asked. "The other vile seemed to be drawn towards me so I thought..."

"You thought that opposites attract." Bemused, Rose said. "The two powers may be at opposite poles but potions and serums alike can go either way, depending upon what they are designed to do." She motioned to the vile you were still holding. "What sense did you get when you tested the serum?"

"It was a dreadful feeling of the world growing larger around me." Shuddering, you replied.

Rose nodded. "That dreadful feeling was the negative charge of chaotic energy you sensed." Calmly, she explained. "Had it been a magic potion, you would have experienced a surreal feeling instead."

"So chaotic energy has a negative feel to it?" Curious, Kimi asked.

"It's really a matter of perspective." Honestly, Rose said. "To a mad scientist, real magic has a sickly sweet sense to it, almost like pure, unrefined sugar."

The class giggled at that before Rose took the vile from you then waved her hand, causing the two viles to vanish and two new ones to appear. "Who would like yo go next?"
1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.title: Test it and find out.

1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.content:
"Why don't you try it this time, Mattie." Kindly, Rose suggested. "As a Neko, you have powerful magic within you but, like your sister, you also have chaotic energy."

"I- I'll try." Uncertain, Mattie said.

She waved her hands over the potions, shuddering at the feeling she got from both of them but hesitated before turning to Rose. "These are both potions, Miss Rose." Confused, she said. "I thought you told us one would be a serum."

Rose smiled. "You are right, I did say that." Calmly, she said. "However, one of those viles holds a particular mixture that is the same in both magic and mad science."

"How is that possible?" Confused, Tessa demanded.

Rose giggled. "Simple, the mixture works the same regardless if is in enhanced with magic or chaotic energy and its effects are the same for either a witch or a mad scientist."

"Intriguing..." Curious, Mattie muttered. "Then I would say that..." He picked up one vile. "...this is that mixture as I got no sense from it at all other than a sense of calm."

"That is what it is, class." Motioning to the vile, Rose said. "It is a calming potion. The very same ingredients are used in a calming serum." She smiled. "As all it does is enhance calm, it works the same for both powers."

"Only it also makes it impossible for a witch or mad scientist to identify it." Worried, Mattie said. "So if a calming potion or serum were to be added to the mixture of another potion, it would mask its intent."

Rose nodded, looking serious. "That is correct, Mattie." Calmly, she said. "Well Done. There is nothing added to this calming potion but there could have been."

"Then one must be very careful to test any unknown potions with more than just what sense they get from it." Catching on, you said. "Is there such a way?"

"You are correct, Jessica." Smiling again, Rose said. "There is a simple spell or event that will tell you exactly what is within any given potion which we will learn later this year." She then caused the viles to vanish and added, "Masking potions is heavily frowned upon but only illegal if one can prove the potion or serum was masked with cruel intentions."

"What are we going to learn next, Miss Rose?" Curious, Mattie asked.

Rose smiled. "We are going to move on to..."
1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.title: The lesson continues.

1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.content:
"As you are all aware, magic allows you to do many wondrous things." Smiling slightly, Rose said. "You will all be tempted to be mischievous by changing the gender and or age of a friend or family member." She then turned serious. "However, take heed; those who possess mad science have similar abilities."

"Tell me about it." Sulking, Mattie said. "Only you can't always change back."

"Unfortunately, you are right, Mattie." With a sympathetic smile, Rose said. "Sometimes, a change becomes permanent and the one changed has to adapt to a completely new way of life. That is why there are strict laws behind the use of magic and mad science alike."

"What laws apply to those permanently changed?" Worried, you asked.

"Each case is different." Serious, Rose explained. "In Mattie's case, her parents attempted to change 'him' at a very young age to save him from a terrible transition in his teen years."

"What happened?" Curious, Tessa asked.

"My parents' legal attempts failed but it created an unforeseen imbalance within him." Frowning, you said. "One transformation was all it took to make 'Matt' Mattie for life."

"I can assure you, Mattie that the end result saved you in ways you might not realize." Serious, Rose said. "You see, Nekos are prominently female and have incredible magical power. Being born male in a family of mad scientists, you would have faced a gender war within you upon reaching the age of thirteen."

Mattie gulped. "Is daddy in trouble?" Worried, she asked.

Rose gave a patient smile. "Mad scientists are held accountable for every mistake, regardless of how insignificant they may seem, Mattie." Calmly, she said. "They believe that any mistake left unresolved can and will cascade into disaster." She turned to the class. "Witches are held accountable for their mistakes as well. In Mattie's case, she needed training so her father was ordered to provide that training for both her and Jessica."

"No justice for me though." Pouting, Raven said. "I'm trapped here."

"You will receive compensation, Raven." Patiently, Rose said. "Just like all the witches who found themselves trapped here two hundred years ago." She sighed. "Class, the point is this; you must be very careful not to go too far with any planned mischief you might have after training. Witch boys who have no mad science have a power of their own. Just as all girls in mad science families who have no magic."

This surprised your entire class, bringing a smile to Rose's face. "What do those with no power have, Miss Rose?" Curious, Fae asked.

"Listen closely and I will explain." Softly, Rose said. "There is a balance in everything."
1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.title: magic vs mad science mischief.

choices: you get a call from dad.
1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.content:
"Not all witches fall in love with a mad scientist, class." Patiently, Rose explained. "Just as not all mad scientists fall in love with a witch. Sometimes, they fall in love with a normal person."

"We understand that." Politely, Fae said. "What powers do normal people have?"

"Boys born into a witch family who have a normal father are blessed physically rather than magically." Serious, Rose said. "Through this, they can gain incredible attributes that will level the playing field." She sighed. "There have been a growing number of cases where an enraged boy had broken the bones of their witch siblings in retaliation to overzealous magical mischief."

"That's barbaric..." Stunned, Tessa said.

"No, its Karma." Darkly, Rose said. "Just as witch boys gain resistance to magic through its use on them, witches gain resistance to physical harm through their male siblings attacking them."

"A balance of power." Whispering, you said. "Might and magic."

"Correct." Calmly, Rose said. "Witch born boys with no mad science become defenders of their family; of their secrets. There is nothing unusual about a strong boy who knows how to fight."

"What of girls born into mad science families who have no magic?" Curious, Kimi asked.

"Girls born into mad science families who have no magic possess elemental abilities." Serious, Rose explained. "These are limited powers over the five elements; Fire, Water, Air, Earth, and Metal." She smiled. "Normally, such a girl only possesses control over two of the five elements. Those who possess all five are powerful indeed."

"Isn't that like magic?" Confused, Raven asked.

Rose shook her head. "No; not at all." Bemused, she said. "Elementals can not cast spells, just control the elements to a small degree. For example, one who has power over Earth can change gravity in an isolated area, throwing her mad science brother to the ceiling or making it hard for him to move."

"Would such a power make a boy a witch or a girl a mad scientist?" Worried, Avery asked.

Rose nodded. "Unfortunately, yes." Calmly, she said. "A witch boy with too much strength can find himself transforming into a girl and a witch. On the same coin, a girl with too much elemental power can become a boy and a mad scientist."

"If a boy were turned into a girl, would he become a witch, like Mattie?" Curious you asked. "Would that be the same for a girl turned into a boy; become a mad scientist?"

"Only if the father and mother have the two powers in their bloodlines." Serious, Rose replied. "However, a normal boy can be granted the power of a mad scientist and a normal girl can be granted the power of a witch but both come with prerequisites."

"Such as...?" Curious, Fae asked.

"In both cases, the boy or girl would have had to performed a great selfless act or deed that saved a witch or mad scientist or gained the attention of the respective powers." Honestly, Rose said. "Such a gift is not bestowed upon a normal individual lightly."

"So witch boys with no mad science are juggernauts and mad science girls with no magic are elementals." trying to understand, Raven said. "What creates this balance?"

"That is a good question." Smiling, Rose said. "Both mad science and magic are somewhat supernatural. Those born into these families without the prerequisite of being the proper gender have the power but it lies dormant. That dormant power is what gives them their natural abilities."

"Then over use of those natural abilities is what wakes up that power." Understanding, Avery said. "Do they offer training for these abilities?"

Rose nodded. "We do have schools for these children." Calmly, she said. "They too have laws to follow and consequences to face if they break them."

She looked at the clock then sighed. "That is all for this morning's class." Standing up, she said. "Please take this time to reflect on what you have learned. "We will continue your lessons after lunch."

Later, as you enjoyed lunch with your class...
1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.title: A lecture of balance.

1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.content:
You were still a bit rattled by the news that you and Mattie were essentially 'royalty' when you sat down for lunch in the cafeteria. Mattie sat next to you; she looked just as shaken. "Do you have any idea why daddy never told us about this, Jessica?" Whispering, Mattie asked.

You shrugged. "Maybe he felt we were not ready to hear it." Guessing, you replied. "Its not like we live a rich life in a mansion with servants waiting on us hand and foot."

"Maybe it was to keep it all quiet." Worried, Mattie said. "So we don't become spoiled."

"Its too late for that; you're already spoiled." Teasing, you said.

"As is the once only daughter." Grinning, Mattie countered.

You giggled slightly at that. "Touche."

"Is this seat taken?" Politely, a voice asked.

You and Mattie looked up to see Fae standing before you with a tray in hand, smiling. You yet had no reason not to trust her so you motioned her to sit down. "How are you handling girlhood so far, Mattie?" Kindly, Fae asked. "Are you coping well?"

Mattie sighed. "Other than the school's choice of wardrobe, I'm coping well enough." Wincing, she replied. "Adapting to any major change will take time."

"You are taking this better than most transformed boys." Smiling slightly, Fae said. "I respect that." She leaned onto her elbows, eyeing Mattie. "Tell me; what did you make of Miss Rose's lectures this morning? It all seems surreal, doesn't it?"

"Enlightening, actually." Honestly, Mattie said. "I always had this feeling that some girls were from another planet." She smiled. "Theory confirmed."

Fae gave a polite giggle. "Only you are a girl yourself now with ancestry that is, well, out of this world." Smiling, she said. "Have you tried any magic yet?"

"Some, not with much success." Pouting, Mattie replied. "I hope this school can help me improve."

"I already have some training under my belt." Calmly, Fae offered. "I could teach you a few tricks to impress Miss Rose."

Mattie hesitated, raising a single eyebrow. "I'm not sure if you are qualified to teach magic." Bluntly, she said. "Otherwise, you would be a teacher rather than a student."

"I am self taught, something the witching world frowns upon." Rolling her eyes at the end, Fae explained. "I'm here to make certain my training is done right." She then smiled again. "Think about it, Mattie; it would benefit us both if we were friends."

With that said, she quietly began to enjoy her lunch while you and Mattie continued your own meal. Later, on your way back to classes, Mattie whispered, "What is that Fae up to, sis? She just met us and she already wants to be best friends with me."

"I'm not sure." Honestly, you whispered back. "Just be polite, for now. When she starts to show her hand, we will have a better idea of how to act."

When classes resumed, Rose asked everyone to pair up into groups of two. "The one without a partner shall assist me in this next lesson." Politely, Rose said.

As you all began to pair up, Fae...
1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.title: Fae sparks a conversation.

choices: Can I be the teacher's assistant?
1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.content:
"I'd like to pair up with Mattie Moray." Raising her hand, Fae said. "I believe I can be the best help to her as I already have some training, albeit self taught."

"Your offer is appreciated and I applaud your enthusiasm." Politely, Rose said. "However, it is not for me to decide this, you must ask Mattie if she wishes to pair with you." She smiled seeing Mattie sitting next to you at the desks. "By trying to persuade me, you lost the opportunity to gain the pair you desired. You will be assisting me instead."

Fae looked around and found that everyone had paired up, leaving her standing alone. Tessa had paired up with Avery, Kimi had paired up with Raven and you had paired up with Mattie. "This is not fair!" Annoyed, Fae blurted out. "I'm being singled out because of who my mother is!"

"I asked everyone to pair up into groups of two." Patiently, Rose countered. "I did not ask everyone to vote for who they wished to be paired up with. You need to pay more attention." Sighing, she turned to you and Mattie and asked, "Would you two be willing to allow this pair up with one of you assisting me instead?"

You turned to Mattie who shrugged her shoulders. "It's up to you, sis." Quietly, you whispered. "You are the one who will be paired up with her."

Mattie sighed then replied...
1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.title: tried to pair with Mattie.

1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.content:
Fae smiled as if she had won a victory but the faint smile on Rose's face told you that the lesson she had in mind would not please her at all. "Very well." Calmly, she said. "Jessica, you will be assisting me in this lesson."

You walked up to Rose's side who gave you a quick wink then turned to the class. "Those in pairs will face each other in a dormant power duel." Serious, she explained. "When a witch finds she can not access her magic, she must fall upon her dormant energy to win or get away from the battle she is currently fighting."

Fae turned white in both shock and horror. "What?!"

"None of you will change genders so long as you keep your duel spheres intact." Instructing the class, Rose explained. "To activate it, summon a test flame and order it to protect you like a shield before tapping into your dormant power."

Mattie was the first to summon his duel sphere with Fae quickly following, vainly hiding her sudden lack of confidence. "I've never had to tap into my dormant power before." Attempting a protest, she said. "I don't even know what it might be."

"Your father was an ordinary man." Calmly, Rose replied. "You will have to rely upon the powers of an Ironclad which are enhanced attributes and physical forces of will."

"This should be interesting." Smiling slightly, Avery said. "My father is an Ironclad solider."

"My father was a mad scientist." Smiling back, Tessa said. "Let's see who's more a tomboy."

"No wagers permitted, students." Grinning, Rose warned. "This is an important lesson you will all need in the years to come after graduation."

"What are the rules of the duel?" Curious, you asked.

"You will not be dueling anyone this time, Jessica." Serious, Rose replied. "You will be helping me judge the duels." She smiled. "To answer your question, the duel ends when one forces the other to drop their duel sphere. Everyone may begin when they are ready!"
1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.title: I'll pair up with Fae.

1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.content:
By the middle of the day, the duels were finished. Mattie was victorious over Fae who sat in a chair, stunned and confused. "How was she able to access her dormant powers so easily where I had to struggle just to summon them?" Gasping, she demanded.

"Mattie was originally a male Neko." Simply, Rose explained. "As such, 'he' was able to access both powers." She smiled, adding, "She still can to some degree."

Rose looked about the room and smiled seeing that Tessa had bested Avery. "Although Ironclads are very powerful, their gifts take more concentration to summon forth." motioning to Fae, she added, "That difficulty is increased two fold if it happens to be your dormant power as other students have discovered as well. You must be able to summon it forth quickly in case you should find your back against the wall."

"We- We stunned each other." Blushing, Raven said. "What does that mean, Miss Rose?"

Rose giggled. "It means that you two are evenly matched." Kindly, she replied. "There will be cases where you will meet someone whose power is equal to your own. You must use your wits as well as your magic and might."

"Who will Jessica be facing?" Curious, Mattie asked.

Rose smiled. "She will be facing the winner between Mattie and Tessa under the same rules as Raven and Kimi had stunned each other." Kindly, she said. The winner of that match will face me in the same duel."

"I don't think that would be fair." Wincing, you said. "Each time we use our powers, dormant or not, it drains us. You will be at full strength."

"An excellent point, Jessica." Serious, Rose said. "Yes, you will be at a disadvantage but there is a point to this lesson."

"What might that be?" Curious, Mattie asked.

"Males in this world, regardless of their power affiliation, have incredible reserves of strength and endurance." Smiling, Rose said. "By tapping into that dormant power, you tap into those reserves and remain at full strength longer." She giggled. "Mad scientists with dormant magical power can do the same but they take a greater risk of transformation."

"Do we have to duel each other now?" Wincing, Mattie asked.

Rose nodded. "When ever you two are ready."

Reluctantly, Mattie and Tessa faced each other with their duel spheres active while the others watched uncertain.
1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.title: The results of the duels.

1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.content:
Rose smiled seeing both Mattie and Tessa panting back to back on the floor, both exhausted from their duel. "Although Mattie is powerful, being a Neko, she is still uncomfortable with her feminine form and thus finds it difficult to concentrate." Calmly, she said. "Tessa took advantage of this but she was unable to tap into the nearly endless reserves of her dormant power. As such, they only succeeded in exhausting each other; the duel is a draw."

I guess that means I will be dueling you." Nervous, you said. "Should we start now?"

"Whenever you are ready, Jessica." Calmly, Rose said. "Be on your guard and remember to only use your dormant power."

With that said, you and Rose bowed and the duel began...
1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.title: They stun each other.

choices: Fae wants a rematch with Mattie.
Jack discovers you and Matt are missing.
1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.content:
Minutes after the duel began, you sat in a chair, stunned and exhausted while Rose stood in front of the class, just now beginning to put up a sweat. "Do not feel too bad, Jessica." Calmly, Rose said. "I have years more experience than any of you."

"It was a lot harder to call upon my dormant power than I thought." Catching your breath, you said. "I'll have to work on that."

"You will all be working on that as the year progresses." Kindly, Rose said. "However, there is more to learn here than merely how to use your dormant powers." She smiled. "All of you learned new ways to use your dormant power for both defense and offense during these duels which you can use yourselves in found in a corner."

"Mattie used force waves as both an offense and a defense." Thoughtful, Fae said. "That made it hard for me to make a direct hit."

"Force waves are a witch boy's strength converted into energy." Smiling, Rose explained. "It can be used in ways that will surprise you which is one of the reasons Ironclads are both feared and respected by the witch community."

"I found that I could move really fast." Timidly, Raven said. "What does that mean?"

"It means that your dormant power is of an Ironclad or the equivalent of one from your world." Serious, Rose replied. "You see, everything physical is turned up to an eleven with Ironclads, including attributes, senses, and reflexes."

"Can I tap into these reserves to power my magic?" Curious, Raven asked.

Rose nodded. "You can but it takes much concentration as well as practice." Calmly, she replied. "Do not attempt such practice without my supervision."

Raven nodded as Kimi spoke up. "I guess my dormant power is that of a mad scientist only i wasn't able to call upon any of its powers."

"The powers of a mad scientist requires constant focus until that focus becomes second nature." Serious, Rose explained. "You will learn to summon such powers but it will not happen overnight." She smiled. "A little patience will go a long way."

"We all learned new ways to use our dormant powers." Catching on, you said. "Will there be other duels later?"

"Actually, there is a tournament at the end of each year where students will be facing other classes is duels of dormant powers." Smiling, Rose replied. "There will also be honorable duels of dominant powers against mad science students from Eligere Sententia."

Your eyes widened as everyone responded the same. "What?!"

"This is both to maintain good relations and a competitive edge." Calmly, Rose said. "Mad scientists follow a very strict code of conduct of which you will find almost exactly mirrors the rules of magic."

"Well... where do we go from here?" Nervous, you asked.

Rose smiled. "The rest of the day is yours, girls." Calmly, she said. "I think we all earned a little rest and relaxation."

With that, the class was dismissed and Mattie turned to me, curious. "What shall we do now?"
1441211111212111212132311223112131332121.title: Rose wins.

144121111121211121213231122311213133213.content:
"You will be staying at your aunt Viva's house for six months while her son, Ty will be staying with me for the same amount of time." Calmly, dad said. "Your aunt is certified to teach witchcraft and you will be going to the same school during this time."

"What about aunt Viva's daughter, Zoe?" Curious, you asked. "Has she discovered her magic powers yet?"

Dad smiled, giving you your answer. "Her power is weak but still existent." Amused, he replied. "She will want a few lessons in magic too though I doubt they will be the lessons she will be expecting."

You sighed, wondering if Mattie will also be getting such lessons. "When do we leave?"

"Just as soon as she arrives with Ty." Calmly, dad said.
144121111121211121213231122311213133213.title: Your aunt viva's house for six months.

14412112.content:
"Do you think Mattie exists just because of what she did to you?" raising a single eyebrow dad asked.

"What do you mean?" taken back, you asked. "I never knew Mat to be a 'girl hater'."

Dad chuckled. "No, Mat does not hate girls but he has a strong fear of them." touching my shoulder, dad said. "This will lead to greater difficulties in his life unless he can get over this fear."

"Does it have to do with his mad science?" curious, you asked.

"I can not give Mat his laboratory unless he can prove he can be responsible enough to use his powers wisely." serious, dad replied. "That 'girl phobia' he has pushes him into making rash decisions with can be very dangerous with the power he wields within him." pausing, he added, "I need you to help your little sister, Mattie get over her fear so Mat can return."

"So you want me to show Mattie that girls are not scary by showing him a girl's world?" trying to understand, you asked.

"In a way, yes." nodding, dad replied. "However, I also need to help you get over your own fear."

"My fear?" becoming worried, you asked.

Dad sighed. "You fainted upon learning mad science was real." looking at you, he said. "I want you to see that there is nothing for you to really fear."

"Oh no!" taking a step back, you said. "You're going to change me into a guy!?"

Dad gave me a toothy grin. "What an interesting suggestion." to your horror, he said. "That way, your could help each other to get over your fears."

Your eyes went wide as dad rose his hand but stopped as you cringed, expecting to change. "Why are you so afraid?" softly, he asked. "You should know I would not leave you a boy forever."

Dad's question took you off guard. "I- I'm not sure." still shaken, you replied. "Maybe its being changed into someone who is not me."

Dad smiled more kindly and pulled you into a warm hug. "Fears must be conquered, Jessica." whispering, he said. "This is especially true in the world of mad science as they can be used against you, like a weapon."

"Who would want to hurt us like that?" tearing up, you asked. "Why would they?"

"Because, my dear, your grandfather, Devon Bizarre is the reigning mad scientist king." breaking the hug, dad replied. "He is the leader of our secret world."

"What does that have to do with me?" your eyes wide with shock, you asked.

Dad smiled. "Only boys can be mad scientists." simply, he replied, "but only a girl, turned boy, can reign as king." he proudly looked you in the eye, adding, "You, my daughter, are next in line, if you want it."

"What if I don't?" wincing, you asked.

Dad shrugged. "Then it goes to the youngest son, once 'she' adapts to womanhood." he said. "Only a girl, turned boy, can reign as king."

"That is twisted." unnerved, you said.

Dad nodded. "That is mad science." serious, he said. "Either you or Mat will be the new mad scientist king."
14412112.title: Phobias must be conquered.

15.content:
You looked around and saw no one. You paused, listening carefully but heard nothing and turned back to the book you had found. Opening it, you were immediately bombarded by an eerie dim light. It startled you at first but it quickly faded and you shrugged it off to flip through the pages. As you read the first few pages, though, your face began to turn pale; the contents of each page had an uncanny familiarity to them.

"This page talks about serum making." you whispered. "This page, 'events' or spells... and this page..."

You quickly closed the book, shaking your head. "It can't be..."

You placed the book down then leaned over the coffee table, waving your delicate hand over the center of it. The table top seemed to melt away and a large faded book rose from inside before the table top became solid again. On the cover of the book, in large bold letters was the title, 'The Magic Book'. You took the book into your hands and held it close to your heart. "Is it possible?" whispering, you asked yourself.

The book had been given to you by your Aunt Viva, shortly after your brother, James vanished. At the time, you blamed yourself for it happening, though your dad said it was not your fault. You did not fully understand then what Aunt Viva meant when she spoke to you about it.

"Everything in life occurs for a reason, Jessica." she said. "That is why I am passing this book on to you."

"What is it?" you asked her, curious.

"Something that has been passed down from mother to daughter for centuries in our family." cryptically, Viva replied. She then pointed to you serious. "You must not tell anyone about that book you now possess, especially not your father."

"Why?"

"He's not ready to let go." again, cryptically, Viva replied. "Study and practice the contents of that book well, Jessica, and I promise you it will, someday, save your family."

When you first opened the book, you found instructions to a hidden door in your bedroom and how to gain access to it. Beyond the door, you found a series of secret hallways that moved throughout the house and a secret room in a full attic you did not know was there before. It was already fully equipped with everything any witch could want or need, including libraries of books on the subject of magic. Upon exploring this new floor of the house, you discovered it belonged to mom who had passed away a few short years after your little brother Mat was born. You decided to follow in your mother's footsteps and began to study the curios book inside the secret room.

As time passed, you began to practice and soon love magic and witchcraft. You understood then why you could not tell your family. Your father would have feared for your safety and forbid you to study the magic any further, you were not about to allow that to happen. Volunteering to do help with the house keeping after school was a brilliant plan in your mind to earn some peace so to practice your magic without interruption. In the year that passed since then, you had become quite talented and, thanks to a few successful spells, rather intelligent. Only that had a down side as well. School became too easy, thus slightly boring, as you could teach the teacher a thing or two. Fortunately, at home, you found that just being yourself kept any suspicions from rising.

Returning your mind to the present, you looked at your book then to the one you found and sighed. "I guess there's only one way to be certain."

You placed your book next to the other and opened them both up to compare them to each other. As you did, your eyes widened, a cold chill running down your back. "This is nuts!" your fear and voice rising above a whisper, you said. "These books are practically identical!"

You then held out your hand and concentrated, summoning a bright but harmless flame to your hand, thinking about your discovery. "Have I been studying witchcraft.... or mad science!?!"

Unknown to you, as you mussed over your own question, someone was watching and listening....

Who was it?
15.title: Magic or science!?

choices: Get James then talk to you.
151.content:
Dad looks sadly at the flame burning in your hand. "So... It's happening already." tearing up, he whispered. "Jessica has discovered her power, she is growing up."

Unknown to you, dad was a mad scientist and his wife was a witch. He thought back to his late wife and wished she was still around to guide you. Sadly, she passed away shortly after Mat was born and made him promise to help you learn magic when you discovered it. Only, dad had hoped it would not happen for a little while longer. He did not have the ability to teach you, being a master of mad science and not witchcraft, he would have to send you to a special school, as he had his eldest son.

"I'm not ready to let go of my little girl." proud but sad, dad whispered. "Forgive me, Maria, my love but I have to stall this for just a little longer...."

What does your father do...?
151.title: Dad.

choices: A visit from your aunt Viva.
1512.content:
Dad knew you were just as stubborn as your late mother. He needed someone to help him talk to you about the power you possessed. He teleported away from the sitting room, materializing inside James' room who frowned upon seeing him. "Your heart rate and blood pressure are abnormally high, father." Concerned, he said. "What's wrong?"

"Jessica has discovered her power." Flatly, dad said. "I need your help to talk to her."

"Neither you or I possess the knowledge or skill to teach her witchcraft, father." Standing up, James stated. "It will be necessary to ship her off to a school that specializes in that form of education."

"I'm not ready to..." Sighing, dad began.

James folded his arms. "It is inevitable that she learns magic, father. You can not deny her." Firmly but respectfully, he said. "Witchcraft is a part of who she is, just as mad science is a part of who we are."

"She is not ready." Sternly, dad countered. "She needs a strong foundation to start from and I need you to help me think of how to make her one."

James was thoughtful for a moment. "Why not teach her some mad science?" Finally, he suggested. "It would not harm her to be male for a few weeks to build some resistance to chaotic energy."

"It would also give her a foundation to start from as I heard all witches become males sometime during their training to understand the principals behind transformation spells." Smiling slightly, dad said. His smile faltered. "However, I will still require your support; Jessica is as stubborn as your late mother."

James nodded. "I will assist you, father." Sighing, he said. "Perhaps Jessica will like the idea of being 'one of the boys' for a while."

Dad and James vanished from the bed room and materialized in the sitting room. You screamed, nearly dropping both books. "Dad! James! You scared me half to death!"

"I'm afraid that this is just the beginning, my dear daughter." In a serious tone, dad said. "I was hoping that you would not discover this for some time but we can adapt."

He rose his hand which began to spark with electricity. There was a dull flash and a spinning globe of crackling energy hovered over his hand. Your eyes widened like saucers as James did the same before speaking. "The big question is, can you adapt with us?"

"You two are mad scientists!?" Stunned, you asked.

Dad nodded. "That is correct, young lady." Firmly but kindly, dad said. "Now that you have discovered this and your own magical power, we need to have a serious discussion about your future."
1512.title: Get James then talk to you.

15121.content:
"Who gave you the book?" Calmly, dad demanded.

"A- Aunt Viva." Wincing, you replied. "She told me not to tell you because you are not ready to let go..."

"Your aunt is a fine witch but she is not a psychiatrist." Remaining calm, dad said. "Did she at least have the sense to guide you in your studies?"

"She called me every night to give me lessons." Calmly, you said. "I advanced on my own in between because it was just so fascinating and fun...." You winced at the end, seeing dad's face harden... he was not impressed.

"Both magic and chaotic science are dangerous in the wrong hands." Firmly, he said. "You were foolish to advance on your own."

"However, what is done is done." Calmly, James added. "All we can do now is move forward with your training."

"Indeed." Smiling slightly, dad agreed. "Therefore, we shall move forward with James and I advancing your training with a much needed foundation to build upon."

"A... foundation?" Worried, you asked.

Dad nodded. "I shall be teaching you the fine art of chaotic science." Proudly, he said. "Upon mastering the basics, magic will become child's play to you."

You did not know how to take that nor did you know how dad would react to you refusing his offer, if there even was an option to refuse...
15121.title: The talk goes well.

choices: Dad allows Viva to train you.
15123.content:
"What do you mean my future?" Worried, you asked.

"There is no one in this household qualified to teach you magic." Bluntly, James replied. "Whoever gave you that book to study alone took a monumental risk as you could have seriously injured yourself."

"I'm sure you injured yourself learning your mad science." Flatly, you countered.

"That is true." Calmly, James retorted. "However, I had a qualified instructor and a medical team on standby in case of accidents. Do you have any such safeguards in place?"

"We are concerned for your well being, honey." Chiming in, dad said. "You need training but you also need a firm foundation to go with that training."

"What are you saying?" Becoming nervous, you asked.

Dad opened his mouth to speak but paused, turning to the front door. James, as if sensing something, turned towards the same direction. Both let out a low moan. "Viva." Annoyed, dad muttered.

"What brings aunt Viva here at this time?" Frustrated, James asked. "She has such inconvenient timing as of late."

"You can see though walls?" Surprised, you asked. Your face hardened. "You and your brothers better not do than near my room."

Dad smiled slightly. "They won't unless they want to wear matching outfits."

You giggled at that, breaking the ice, then turned as the doorbell rang. Apparently, Aunt Viva had come for a visit. "Are we going to let her in?"

"I'll get it." From the hall, Tex called.

He opened the door and sighed upon seeing aunt Viva who lovingly pinched his cheek before stepping inside with a number of boxes in her arms. "Happy early birthday, Jessica." Sweetly, she gushed.

"It will be Tex's birthday too, aunt Viva." Politely, you pointed out.

"That is true, my dear." Smiling, Viva said. "Only I ran out of room in my arms." She giggled then turned to Tex. "You gifts are in the car, care to go fetch them?"

Tex, seeing the number of boxes Viva had brought you, ran out the door with anticipation in his eyes. Viva giggled then turned to you as you spoke. "Um... you didn't have to go through all this trouble for my bother and I."

"It's no trouble at all." Beaming, Viva said. "I see I came just in time."

"We are in the middle of an important discussion with my daughter, Viva." Frowning, dad said. "She has discovered her talent and has been practicing unsupervised."

"She has not been practicing unsupervised." With a cheeky grin, Viva said. "I had been helping her over the phone and Skype for the passed several months."

Dad's face turned red with impatience. "It was you who gave Jessica that magic book!" Angry, he accused. "It is my place to decide when she receives it, not yours!"

"What is done is done." Maintaining her smile, Viva countered. "What would you do? Erase her memory, transform her into a boy and teach her your mad science?"

You winced at both options as dad sighed, controlling his growing rage. "Learning how mad science works will be beneficial to her training in witchcraft." Through gritted teeth, he argued. "You had no place to interfere with my family."

"I have given your daughter the solid foundation she needs for higher training in witchcraft." Boldly, Viva said. "As such, it is my duty to continue that training unless you intend to ship her off to a school of witchcraft where her training will keep her away for a year."

You had never seen your father more furious; it frightened you. "Daddy...."

Dad sighed then turned to you. It was impossible to tell what he was thinking.
15123.title: A visit from your aunt Viva.

choices: You stop the fight by threating them both
151233.content:
"There is only one way to settle this" Dad said as he produced a high tech remote from out of nowhere.

"Agreed" Viva said as a pale flame shot out of her left hand.

"What is going on?" you demanded, alarmed at their sudden change of demeanor. It looked as if they were getting ready for combat.

"Its a magic-science duel" Dad said in a calm voice, which was odd considering what was happening.

"I can see that. Why?" you demanded.

"We're at an impasse. Basically its a version of 'might is right'. Whoever wins decides the best course for your training" Viva said.

"What?!" you screamed, outraged that neither of them seemed to care to ask for your input. Before you could protest, Dad gave Viva a sign to attack, oddly content to wait for Vera to deliver the first strike. Which in your option was foolish. Viva obliged, and quickly a jet of white gas shot into the room.

"What is going on?" you screamed, though neither of them answered. To your surprise, you quickly found the gas was water vapor.

Dad chuckled to himself. "Nice try, witch. Blind your target. Might work against another witch, but you're forgetting who I am. As long as I'm not seeing in visible ranges or 3600nm, I'll be able to see perfectly."

"Yes. I know about your infrared capabilities" Viva countered, as unseen, Dad launched an attack of his own....
151233.title: Dad and Viva- magic/science duel.

choices: Dad and Viva fight; force the fail-safe.
1512333.content:
James pulled you out of the way as dad and Viva began to fire strange globes of energy at each other. This was followed by blasts of energy from a long thin rod from Viva and a strange remote control from dad; this caused the furniture in the room to come to life and join in the fight.

"They won't hurt each other too much." Holding you back, James assured. "It's just best not to be caught in the middle of the crossfire."

"Stop this!" Struggling against James, you yelled. "Stop it! Don't make me activate the fail-safe!"

Both dad and Viva stopped fighting and turned to you, curious. The fail-safe was a spell/event on all witch and mad scientist households. It was designed to reduce any pair of witch or mad scientist to three year olds if they fight out of anger. You did not know if it had been deactivated but you knew you could trigger it with your magic.

"We are settling a dispute, young lady." Sternly, dad said. "It has nothing to do with you.

"It has everything to do with me as it concerns my right to study magic." Crossly, you countered.

"I have no intentions to bar that right, Jessica." Eying you, dad said. "However, your aunt crossed the line by handing you a book of magic without first consulting me. I am your guardian, not her."

"Dad, I need a teacher." Trying another approach, you said. "Who would you rather it be? Aunt Viva whom you can monitor and intervene when needed or a witch school where you would not likely be permitted to enter as an adult male?"

Dad sighed. "I'd rather you learn here at home but learn mad science first."

"Nonsense!" Barked Viva. "She does not need high tech gadgetry and an over glorified laboratory to work her natural born powers!"

"You are asking for it, Viva..." Darkly, dad warned.

"I'm begging for it!" Teasing, Viva countered. "Who is going to give it to me?"

Dad turned to Viva, his anger returning....
1512333.title: The Fail-Safe.

choices: Dad and Viva are easy to care for.
Dad and Viva give you trouble.
15123331.content:
Before you could protest, dad and Viva were at it again, dueling with energy blasts and spells of their own nature, trying to best the other. Thus far, it had been an even match. You could not blame dad for being angry with Viva for not asking him first; you partially blamed yourself for not telling him sooner.

"I think they're getting better at this." Slightly shaking his head, James said.

"What?" Turning to him, you asked. "They've fought like this before?"

James sighed, nodding. "Use your magic to search your memory." Patiently, he said. "They enchanted us to not notice it while we were unaware of real magic and mad science."

You used your magic to enhance your memory and gasped. "My first babysitting job was with the two of them just before you left for that mad science school!"

James grinned. "The fail safe can only keep them three year olds for twenty four hours as they have a family to raise." Bemused, he said. "If we were to fight, we'd stay three year olds until someone changed us back or we grew up again."

"Why were they fighting the last time?" Curious, you asked.

"They fight at the drop of a hat." Lightly, James said. "I think its because they have affections for each other only they are not willing to admit it."

Then a bright flash caught your attention. You turned to see a three year old girl sitting in dad's clothes and a three year old boy sitting in aunt Viva's clothes still fighting each other. James shook his head, chuckling. "They must have really set it off this time." shaking his head, he said. "They've switched genders as well as regressed."

You sighed. "It looks like I have another baby sitting job." Bemused, you said.

James waved his hand and a pile of toddler clothing appeared in your hands. "You'll need to get them dressed, sis." sighing, he said. "I'll help if you need it."
15123331.title: You must babysit dad and Viva.

151233313.content:
"I think I'll need it" you said as you looked towards Viva and Dad. Both looked deeply unhappy, though you could see that Viva was more upset than Dad. You knew why; the gender change robbed her the ability to use magic. "We'll get them sorted out, then tell Matt and Tex what had happened."

"Yes.... Matt" James said, chuckling slightly. You knew why he was bemused; Matt would like the fact Dad was younger than him, but horrified that he would be a girl.

"Where is he?" you asked.

James never answered. Instead, a high pitched voice wailed, "Jessica!". It sounded like Matt, though it was slightly higher pitched than normal. A few seconds later, you and James saw what you both had began to suspect; somehow Matt's gender had been changed too.

"What happened?" you and James said almost simultaneously.

"I don't know. I was playing then I found myself as a gross girl" Matt said, her voice a mixture of embarrassment about her change, and slight annoyance that you and James were normal. She stood awkwardly as her clothes remained the same.

"Where's Tex?" James asked.

"Here" a embarrassed, feminine sounding voice replied.

"You got changed too?" you asked.

"Yeah...." Tex said as she stepped into the open. Like Matt, you twin was turned into his female equivalent, though from the way she had her arms crossed beneath her breasts, Tex was finding her change more difficult to deal with.
151233313.title: Tex and Matt enter.

1512333131.content:
"That, I fear, was my doing." Surprised by her new voice, dad said.

"Is- Is that dad!?" Panicked, Matt asked. "What happened!?"

"What did you do?" Eying dad with annoyance, Viva asked.

Dad sighed. "I modified the fail safe so that it would change those in the house unaware of mad science into the opposite gender." Blushing slightly, he replied. "It was meant as a reminder to me to remain composed when using my powers."

"Only Viva giving Jessica the magic book was too much for you to take." Shaking his head, James said. "How long will they be this way?"

"You did this?" Alarmed, Matt asked. "Change me back!"

"They will be that way until someone who knows mad science changes them back to normal." Simply, dad said. "Viva and I must be this way for twenty four hours as we are the heads of our households." She shook her head, muttering, "Stupid, 'you should know better' law." You did not hear her.

"What about aunt Viva's kids?" Worried, you asked. "Who is going to watch over them until she changes back?"

Viva crossed his arms, glaring at dad who childishly stuck her tongue out at him. Seeing this, James sighed. "I will call Dr. Holmes and have her bring Zoe and Ty here."
