"Just great." Rolling your eyes, you said. You turned to dad and Viva. "I should charge you both for having to babysit you two and Viva's kids."

"Um... Jessica?" Wincing, Matt said.

"What is it, Matt?" Sighing, you asked.

"Can you change me back?" Tearing up, Matt asked. "Please..."

You turned to James who frowned. "I can change them back easily once my lab is ready." Flatly, he said. "Unfortunately, it still requires a pass event to open it to me."

"A pass event?" Curious, Tex asked. "What is that?"

"It's like a spell only better as it uses science." Smugly, dad said. "The event transfers the laboratory I had constructed for James into his possession." He winced, adding, "Unfortunately, I will not be able to cast that event until I return to normal."

"We're stuck like this for twenty four hours!?" Screaming, Tex asked.

Matt looked like she was going to be sick before she fainted while Tex crumbled to the floor, sobbing. You sighed as James picked up the telephone. "After I call Dr Holmes, I'll order some pizza." Calmly, he said. "It's going to be a long twenty four hours."
1512333131.title: Dad's precaution.

choices: Princess dress you bought for Zoe.
15123331312.content:
You winced, looking at your two new reluctant sisters. "I hate to be the one to say this but you two need some girl clothes." Taking Matt's hand, you said. "I'll help you pick something out."

As you expected, Matt began to cry as Tex stomped her foot. "Why!?"

"Would you rather lead your cousins to believe that you are visiting relatives or tell them the truth of our unusual situation?" Chiming in, James asked.

Both Matt and Tex paled, knowing that Zoe took being a 'princess' to an extreme while Ty was protective of girls to an annoying, almost possessive scale. "We're coming." Sighing, they said.

You led the two into your room where you opened your closet and pulled out a number of boxes that were filled with clothing from when you were younger. "I'll let you pick something out of here to wear... Mattie." Giggling, you teased.

"Not funny." Pouting, Mattie complained. "I hope you have some jeans in here."

While Mattie rummaged through the boxes, you pointed to your closet. "Just pick something out that speaks to you." Sighing, you instructed. "If you need help, let me know."

"Hey!" Annoyed, Mattie yelled. "Didn't you have any jeans or shorts when you were my age?"

"Sorry, Mattie." Wincing, you replied. "I was more into the princess look than Zoe at your age."

"Well, if I have to wear a dress, so does Tina!" Emphasizing Tex's new name, she yelled.

Tex, dubbed Tina, threw Mattie an annoyed look then sighed at your pleading look. "I don't want to have to deal with four three year olds." Softly, you said. "Please just humor me until you can be changed back."

"Fine." Through gritted teeth, Tina said. "I'll wear a stupid dress."

Without looking, he reached into your closet and pulled out a...
15123331312.title: Helping your new sisters.

choices: Jack and Tonya came over to visit.
Enter Devlin Moray, Head Mad Scientist.
151233313121.content:
Tina screamed as she found herself shrinking to fit the dress she had pulled out of your closet. "Why am I regressing!?" Panicking, she demanded. "Did you put a spell onto your closet!?"

"Why would I cast a spell onto my own clothes!?" Annoyed, you countered. "Your own magic must be changing you to suit your selection." After a thought, you added, "Or, it may be another one of dad's modifications to the fail-safe."

"This sucks!" Pouting, Tina protested in her new smaller voice. "I don't want to be little!"

"It's just until we can change you back tomorrow." Sighing, you said. "It's not so bad."

"Try being a boy and tell me that." Pouting, Tina countered.

You sighed then turned to Mattie who had reluctantly donned a peach dress you had worn to your own seventh birthday party. "That looks good on you... as a girl, Mattie."

"Yeah, well don't get used to it." Gruffly, Mattie said. "We'll be back to normal tomorrow."

Before you could respond, you heard a knock at the door. You had a visitor.
151233313121.title: Seven year old Tina.

1512333131213.content:
Unknown to all, as you helped your new reluctant sisters, dark clouds quickly moved over the area as flashes of lightning and distant thunder shook the skies. One lightning bolt struck the front porch at an unnatural angle. There was a flash before a tall, dark elderly man appeared where the odd lightning had struck. He sported an eighteenth century gentleman's suit with unusually long coat tails that moved about as if they had a mind of their own. He wore knee high riding boots, a top hat covering his raven black hair, and carried a silver tipped cane with a large diamond. His eyes hid behind round shining glasses while he held a toothy, almost sinister grin. It was your grandfather, Devlin Moray.

"I simply must remember to tone down that teleporter." Waving at a number of stunned people, he muttered. "It's so dramatic."

The people nodded as if it strangely made perfect sense. They then turned away from the elderly man to go about their business as if nothing had happened. Chuckling, the elderly man firmly knocked on the door. Inside your room, you sighed, hearing the knock. "That must be Dr Holmes with our cousins." Sighing, you said. "I might as well let them in."

You hurried down the stairs to the front door and opened it. Instead of finding Stephanie Holmes and your cousins, you were greeted by a familiar figure. "Grandpa!"

"Greetings, my sweet wildflower." Grinning, Devlin said. "Something told me that you were going to need my help so I 'bolted' here straight away." He chuckled at his little joke, which you did not get, then sighed. "I take it you were told the family secret."

You sighed, tears swelling in your eyes and pulled Devlin into a warm hug. "It's been so insane around here today, grandpa!" Near tears, you said. "Dad told me the secret, he and aunt Viva got into a fight and got turned into a little boy and girl...."

"I know, dear." Gently, Devlin said. "I'm here to help."

You released Devlin, startled. "You- You are a mad scientist too?"

"All males in this family are mad scientists, Jessica." Casually entering the house, Devlin replied. "You see, I am the Head mad scientist, the leader of our world."

Your jaw dropped as you began to shake before Devlin tapped his cane onto the floor. The noise seemed to snap you out of your momentary panic. "Can you fix this?" Finding your voice, you asked.

Devlin gave you a toothy grin. "Of course, I can." Soothingly, he said. "Just not without first teaching your father and aunt a valuable lesson."

"Getting changed into children was not enough?" Wincing, you asked.

Devlin sighed. "Your father tampered with an event that was meant to punish only those who were involved in a fight." Patiently, he explained. "By doing so, he has made things uncomfortable for his children; this can not go unchallenged."

"What are you going to do?" Curious, you asked.

"Follow me and find out, my dear." Chuckling, Devlin said. "You might find this interesting."
1512333131213.title: Enter Devlin Moray, Head Mad Scientist.

choices: Your children will attend the special schools!
15123331312131.content:
Both dad and Viva paled seeing Devlin enter the room with a toothy grin. "Well, well, well." Still chuckling, he said. "It seems as if my 'daughter' and 'son' in law have placed themselves into a bit of a jam."

"We will be our normal selves in twenty four hours, Devlin." Pouting, dad protested. "It is nothing that required a special visit from you."

"Daddy..." Annoyed, you scolded, "He's your father; why are you calling him by his first name?"

"Protocol, my dear." Simply, Devlin replied. "Everyone must call me by my first name to eliminate any accusations of favoritism."

You nodded then sighed seeing 'Tina' and 'Maddie' entering the room. Devlin saw them and chuckled. "Please don't laugh, grandpa!" Sobbing, Maddie begged. "This is hard enough!"

"Not the best way to learn the family secret." Kindly, Devlin said. "However, I promise you will survive the experience, eventually becoming yourselves again." He turned to dad. "It is not frowned upon to modify the fail-safe event but it is frowned upon to expand it beyond its original targets."

"An unforeseen side effect." Wincing, dad said. "It was not intentional."

Devlin grunted then turned to Viva. "There are laws among witches and mad scientists for a reason... young man." Scolding, he said. "Unless granted by the witch coven council, you are not to interfere with the development of a young witch in a mad scientist household." He grinned madly. "Unless you wish to have Nathan Moray grant your son, Ty mad science training."

Viva paled at the very idea. "Ty is too young and impulsive! He is not ready!"

"You are not trained in mad science." Raising an eyebrow, Devlin countered. "What deems you qualified to determine this?"

"He is my son!" Angry, Viva protested. "It is my place to..." She wisely stopped herself as Devlin began to grin wickedly.

"You two are both guilty in this matter." Maintaining his grin, Devlin said. "I will restore your children and repair the fail-safe."

"However....?" Knowing there will be a catch, dad asked.

Devlin grinned madly. "However, until you two learn that there are reasons for our laws and treaties..."
15123331312131.title: Devlin's solution.

choices: Your cousins are unaware of anything wrong.
Zoe is amused, Ty is not.
151233313121312.content:
Before anyone could react, Devlin raised his cane and brought it down hard onto the floor. There was a bright flash and a surge of energy that shook the house. When the light faded, Tex and Matt were thrilled to find themselves boys again. They were less than impressed however to find themselves still wearing the dresses but in their individual sizes.

Devlin chuckled at their reaction then turned serious. "You two will be trained by James in mad science." His tone hinting a warning, he said. "If you do not take the lessons seriously, you will join your sister in magic training. Is that understood?" The two quickly nodded. "You may go change into your normal clothing then."

As Tex and Matt gladly ran to their rooms to change, Devlin turned to Nathan. "Now then... Bethany." Chuckling, he said. "I have granted you full magical training. You now have the power to train your daughter at home. The only way to become your male self again is to complete her training or to get her to accept mad science training as a boy."

"How inventive of you." Sarcastically, Nathan, now Bethany said. "How did you gain the power to grant me such knowledge?"

"The head witch taught magic to a certain frightened but powerful little girl a few years back." Sporting a toothy grin, he replied. "I tolerated it in the name of science."

"You tricked the head witch?" Disturbed, you asked.

Devlin chuckled madly. "Do not fret, my little cherub." Grinning, he said. "She returned the favor by coming to me as a frightened but powerful little boy. We tricked each other."

"What about me?" Crossly, Viva asked. "Am I to train Ty in mad science?"

"If you so wish." Amused, Devlin replied. "However, you are to supervise James' training of his brothers and help if anything goes wrong. You have the same amount of training at your disposal and it will help you both greatly in the future."

"Does she have an early way out like dad, er, mom?" Wincing, you asked.

"They can both end this early in one of two ways." Turning serious, Devlin said. "One, Jessica and her brothers complete their training; Ty as well if Geo so chooses. Two, both Ty agrees to learn magic and Jessica agrees to learn mad science. Both have to agree, not just one or the other."

"Perfect." Annoyed, Geo said. "Just perfect."

"I am so glad you agree and approve of my solution." Grinning madly, Devlin said. "My work here is done for now. Chow!"

With a flash of light and a hollow thunder like boom, he was gone. Geo and... mom glared at each other but paused as the doorbell rang. Your cousins had arrived.
151233313121312.title: You will remain gender switched!

1513.content:
Dad started pacing, wondering aloud what to do. He knew that knowledge of magic and witchcraft was far beyond him. Sure, he heard the rumors, that magic was not native to this world, but he didn't quite believe that. After all, how many of them had a witch for a wife... Pausing, he shook his head. "Focus on the present, Nathan" he muttered as he slowly saw there were three alternatives. Doing nothing, and risking your powers going out of control was out of the question. So was sending you away. That left option three; bring someone to you. With slight hesitation, dad grabbed a phone, and started to dial.


"Who is this?" a grumpy voice said

"You know who I am, and why I'm calling" dad said.

"Really?" the voice said quizzingly.

"Enough with the mind games. Do you accept the job?"'

"Its for Jessica, right? Yes... I could throw in tutoring for three other students... maybe a fourth...."

Dad slammed down the phone. "Damn witches.."

An hour later you was focussed on the book, when you heard that something was by the window. Your heart sinking, you spun around, fearing that it was Tex or someone climbing along the outside of the house trying to scare you. instead, you saw it was
1513.title: call for a witch tutor.

15131.content:
You nearly screamed, seeing the cloaked woman standing outside the window. She grinned, catching your eye, causing you to shiver. You were about to scream for dad when the woman walked into the sitting room as if the window was nothing but an open door. Seeing this stunned you into a fearful silence but you managed to keep your wits about you. With a wave of your hand, the two books you were examining vanished from sight.

"You have nothing to fear, child." seeing your move, the woman said. "I mean you no harm. In fact, I was summoned here to assist you."

"Assist me how?" finding your voice, you asked. "Who summoned you? Who are you?"

"So many questions." shaking her head, the woman sighed. "However, I understand your caution..."

With that, she slowly removed her cloak, revealing a slender young woman in her early twenties. She had long, flowing honey blond hair and piercing blue-green eyes. "First, I am here to assist you in learning the use, control, and laws of magic." serious, the woman said. "Second, your father summoned me as he is not comfortable with you teaching yourself a power he can not grasp nor is he willing to send you away where he can not follow to learn it." she sighed, extending her hand. "Lastly, I am Nina Vague. It is a pleasure to meet you, Jessica Moray."

"I have been studying magic for nearly a year now, Nina." politely shaking her hand, you said. "I think I have the basics down."

Nina giggled. "Do you now?" smiling, she asked. "Would you mind if I test that?"

"How would you test it?" curious, you asked.

Nina smiled, pointing to a mousy face peering into the room. "That, I believe, is your youngest brother, Mat." whispering, she said. "If I were to make him your younger sister, could you change 'her' back?" seeing your startled look, she added, "It's a simple spell, that is if you know the basics."

You knew how to change a person's gender, it was a simple spell as Nina had said. Also, you had planned to use it on one of your brothers to have some fun later but you did not want to change Mat. He thought girls were from another planet as it was, you did not want to strengthen that belief. You sensed Nina was about to cast the spell, you had only second to decide what to do. In the end, you tried to block the spell but it got passed you. Matt's eyes grew wide as if he somehow sensed it to then...
15131.title: a cloaked woman

151311.content:
You winced, hearing Mat scream as you helplessly watched Nina's spell hit him. He completely freaked, as you feared he would, seeing himself changing into a girl. Only he, or rather, she surprised you when she glared at Nina instead of running off in tears. "Who are you, lady!?" ignoring her new feminine voice, she demanded. "Why did you change me into a girl!?"

Nina folded her arms. "Why don't you change yourself back instead of whining like a spoiled brat?" she countered. "Come now, we both know you can."

"Change himself back?" startled and confused, you asked.

Nina smiled. "You'll see." giggling, she said.

Mat suddenly turned red. "You paradoxical, obstinate, irksome, tempestuous, post adolescent nincompoop!" angry, she rambled. "Do you have any idea the number of procedures, processes, and all around red tape you had forced into motion!?!"

You were stunned by Mat's uncharacteristic response. "Hey!" unsure of what he had said. "Watch your language, young lady!"

Mat blushed brightly, remembering you were in the room then...
151311.title: screamed as it hit him.

1513112.content:
"Jessica!" blushing, Mat said. "I didn't see you there. I... I..."

Nina giggled as she then ran from the room. "You think that was funny!?" annoyed, you demanded.

"Oh, come now, dear." lightly, Nina said. "You must admit, from your... sister's reaction, she is far more advanced than most children her age."

"The book I found..." almost whispering, you said. then you asked, "Are you telling me that Mat is a some kind of super genius or mad scientist?"

Nina laughed. "Right on the first guess." smiling, she said. "All of the boys in your family, including your father, are mad scientists." she then turned serious. "I chose Mat as an example because he would have the power to change 'herself' back but not be old enough to have any real combat skills."

"So he, or she, could be pacified if things get out of hand." worried, you said.

"Your little brother will be back and with his older siblings in tow." serious, Nina said. "I have been asked to teach you magic so you do not accidentally injure your siblings or worse, you injure yourself while trying to keep up with their mad science." she offered her hand. "All you must do is accept my help as a teacher."

You looked at Nina's hand, uncertain as you heard hurried footfalls in the hall. The crackle of electricity made you turn and you saw your older brother, James standing in the doorway. He had returned from being away for a year and was staring down Nina with a scorned look only a protective older brother can make. You gulped, seeing a ball of crackling electricity in his hand. Behind him, your twin brother, Tex stood with a ball of electricity in his hand as well with Mat, a boy again, holding some strange device.

"You must decide or I must leave." quickly, Nina said.

What do you do...?
1513112.title: ran from the room.

15131122.content:
"You may have proven yourself as a witch, Vague." whispering, you hissed. "But dad would never send anyone to me unless he told me first."

With that, you ran to your brothers, who made room for you to pass them before closing the gap, holding up their sparking electric spheres in a threatening posture. "You will explain your presence and actions in this household or face my wrath." darkly, James said. "Speak now or run for your life."

James was well over two inches taller than you with a near perfect physique, sporting short brown hair and fire hazel eyes that seemed to sparkle like real fire. Your twin brother, Tex, right behind him, had a similar build to yourself with the same jet black hair but fire hazel eyes like his brother.

"I was summoned here by your father." annoyance in her voice, Nina argued. "If you doubt the words of a witch, ask him yourself."

"Why would father summon the services of an outsider?" his eyes narrowing, Tex asked. "What purpose would it serve to bring you into our home?"

"To teach me magic." evenly, you said. "Aunt Viva gave me a book on my twelfth birthday, a magic book and I found that mom was a witch." after a pause, you added, "I've been teaching myself for almost a year and this Nina Vague claims that dad summoned her."

"That does not compute." unimpressed, James said. "True, mom was a witch so it is only logical that Jessica would be a witch as well." His eyes narrowed further, showing anger. "However, Dad would have informed us of this action to avoid this such scenario."

"I am telling you the truth." taking a defensive stance, Nina said. "Why would I enter the lair of a family of mad scientists alone unless for such a service?"

James paused, as if to take in what Nina had said then...
15131122.title: Run to your brothers.

151311222.content:
James paused, as if to take in what Nina had said then slowly cancelled his 'fire'. "Any witch of ill intention would have made a move to fight or escape by this point." softly, he said. "I believe you."

Nina relaxed slightly. "Only that does not mean you trust me." in a guarded tone, she said.

"Trust is earned, not given." darkly, James replied. "It is now up to Jessica to either accept or decline your services as a teacher of witchcraft."

"That subject is not up for discussion." with a booming voice, dad said.

Everyone turned to see him appearing inside the room with a dull flash. "James, I did not inform you of this as I was hoping to keep Jessica's training discrete until such time temptation moved you to try to transform her into another state of being."

"You were hoping to open a 'mad test' for character evaluation." frowning, James said. "Only you did not factor in Matt returning home from school early."

"I was prepared for that scenario." smiling, dad replied. "You see, you have proved yourself to be protective of your brothers and sister." he then motioned to Niva. "You also proved that, through that protective nature, you had the wisdom to hear an outsider out before taking rash action."

James smiled. "Well played, father."

Dad nodded then turned to Nina. "I do apologize for making you an unwitting and unwilling participant in this test on my sons but it was a necessary part of the test."

"I... understand." softly, Nina said. then she whispered, "Damn mad scientists!"

Dad chuckled then turned to you. "Jessica, Ms Nina Vague will be your magic tutor." turning darkly serious, he said. "This is not a matter of choice but of a lack of more desirable options. You need training in a skill and power of which I lack sufficient knowledge to provide."

You sighed before slowly nodding. "Yes, father."

"This is for the best, Jessica." serious, dad said. he then turned to your brothers. "I expect you three to be of good sport during Jessica's training." he then smiled. "I know all of you have mischievous plans for her and that some will later include Ms Nina..."

"I will not be distracted from my duties as a tutor!" irritated, Nina protested.

"However, any mischief you do will carry the risk of retaliation." ignoring Nina, dad said. "I will not disrupt Jessica's training unless I sense a risk to her well being."

"In other words... gentlemen," smiling, Nina said. "If you start anything, you are fair game."

"The door swings both ways... Ms Nina Vague." with a toothy grin, Tex replied.

"Caution, Tex." serious, James warned. "We are only to retaliate if the 'mischievous' act can be proven not to be a part of a training session."

"The same rule applies to you, Ms Vague." serious, dad replied. "James will be training his brothers; Jessica and, occasionally, you will be called upon to participate to keep things fair."

"Of course, Mr. Moray." patiently, Nina said. "With your permission, I would like to begin your daughter's training."

Dad nodded and Nina turned to you. "We will start with your bedroom."

"My bedroom?" curious, you asked. "Why?"

"There is where most mischievous attacks occur, my dear." smiling, Nina replied. "The first thing you need to learn is how to defend yourself against your brothers mischief."
151311222.title: A 'mad' test begins your training.

choices: The first page, best not take chances.
1513112221.content:
You lead Nina to your bedroom and she stepped in, looking everywhere. It was your typical bedroom for a teenage girl with a simple bed, a white dresser, vanity, and boy band posters. Only Nina did not seem interested in them, she was studying the odd angles of the room. It was not your typical square room; it had an odd dome shaped ceiling with a mural of the night sky. The walls were slightly bowed inward to give the room a more round look. "As I thought, this room has already been fortified." Smiling slightly, she said. "I sensed that your father was very protective; this confirms my suspicions."

"Yeah, he's always worrying about me."Sighing slightly, you said. "Only what does this have to do with my magic training?"

"This room has been fortified to defend against mad mischief." Serious, Nina explained. "As such, your room is a 'safe zone' so long as the door is closed."

"Well, that's a good thing, right?" Curious, you asked.

"It depends upon how you look at it." Shrugging, Nina replied. "You see, mad science is a 'technological' magic that works much differently from what my people call real magic." She sighed. "With the right 'mad' command, this room can change from a safe zone to a prison."

"Dad would never do that to me!" Taken back, you said.

"If he feared you would be taken away or worse, he would." Serious, Nina said. "However, there is a magical solution to that scenario. You can seal the room as it is and your father would not be able to change the conditions of its protective properties unless you allow it."

"I'm not so sure about that." Wincing, you said.

"I am merely stating the facts, Miss Moray." Simply, Nina said. "It is up to you to use or not use the spells and techniques I am about to teach you."

"Okay..." Feeling uncomfortable, you said.

"Relax, my dear." Smiling, Nina said. "I am not trying to place you at odds with your family. I am only making you aware of all the possibilities." She paused then added, "I know of a family where the roles are quite revered; a single witch mother with three daughters and a lone son."

"Is his mother as protective as of him as dad is of me?" Wincing, you asked.

Nina nodded. "Only she knows that, as a girl, her son will have magic." With a rueful smile, she said. "It's never easy to make that kind of decision; to turn your child's world upside down by changing his or her gender." She sighed. "By calling me, your father has decided he wants his daughter to learn magic and grow up into a beautiful young woman."

This caused you to smile and you relaxed slightly. "What will I be learning today?" you asked.

Nina produced a magic book and replied, "We will start with..."
1513112221.title: Safe zone or prison.

15131122212.content:
"I have to start over?" Exasperated, you asked. "I've been studying the book hard for a year!"

"Magic is a powerful tool, my dear." Patiently, Nina said. "It is also an exact art; it can be deadly if used improperly or recklessly. Please summon your book."

Sighing, you did as you were asked and Nina began going over the basics with you. Most of it you already knew but you were surprised to find there were many things you had missed. "I- I swear I read each page carefully." Blushing, you said. "How did I miss that?"

Nina smiled. "There are certain pages that can only be seen while in the presence of a witch teacher or and experienced witch." Softly, she said. "This is to prevent an inexperienced witch from trying these spells without supervision."

"Do my brothers' books have the same safety measures?" Curious, you asked.

Nina Nodded. "Yes, they do." Smiling, she said. "It was actually their book that gave us the idea to follow this practice." She giggled. "I guess boys are good for something."

You giggled at that then paused as a thought entered your mind. "Nina, did you know my mother?"

"I was her teacher." After a pause, Nina replied. "You mother was my best student." she sighed. "I wished she could have seen the world we came from."

"What do you mean?" Curious, you asked.

"Magic is not a native power to this world, Miss Moray." Serious, Nina said. "About two hundred years ago, a tear in time and space opened on a small island. Several dozen women, girls, and... boys were violently pulled through."

"That's horrible!" Shocked, you said. "Was anyone badly hurt?"

"Nothing more than a few scrapes and bruises." Shrugging, Nina replied. "The point is, we were all swept into and stranded in another world."

"There is no way back for you?" Worried, you asked.

"How we got here was purely accidental; it would be difficult to near impossible to find a safe way back home." Sadly, Nina replied. "I was just a child when that happened."

"What?" Confused, you asked. "I thought you said it happened about two hundred years ago."

"Age is relative when it comes to magic and mad science." With a thin smile, Nina said. "In my birth world, only girls could work magic and boys with the power of 'mad science' was very rare." she gave a low giggle, smiling at the irony. "Here, only boys can work magic but they call it 'mad science' and girls with the power of real magic, like you and I, are the rarity."

"I'm sorry." Wincing, you said. "I didn't mean to open any old wounds."

"It was a lifetime ago, my dear." Smiling, Nina said. "Don't worry about it." She turned back to the magic book. "Let us continue, shall we?"

You nodded.
15131122212.title: The first page, best not take chances.

151311222121.content:
"The first thing you need to know and remember about magic is that emotion augments its power." In a serious tone, Nina said. "If you use magic out of anger, it will make the spell or even potion you use stronger than you intend it to be."

"Is mad science the same?" Curious, you asked.

Nina nodded. "Yes, the two powers almost mirror each other." Smiling slightly, she replied. "You are lucky in a way as your mother was a witch."

"What do you mean?"

"Not all mad scientists marry a witch, my dear." Almost sadly, Nina said. "Had your father married a normal woman, you would not have any power all unless you were transformed into a boy." She sighed. "On the same coin, if your mother had married a normal man, your brothers would not have any powers either unless they were turned into girls."

"Is there no balance in these families?" Startled, you asked.

"Everything has a balance, my dear." With a sigh, Nina explained. "In witch families, boys are blessed physically. In mad science families, girls are blessed through karma."

"Karma?" Confused, you asked. "You mean a type of uncanny luck?"

"Something like that." Chuckling, Nina said. "They have a hypnotic beauty and uncanny intelligence that allows them to make use of normal science. They can fight back in ways that greatly surprise the boys who underestimate their sisters."

You smiled that that. The lessons continued.

What spell does Nina teach you first?
151311222121.title: Not all families are the same.

1513112221211.content:
"The first spells you will need to learn are gender swap, age regression, and age progression." Firmly but kindly, Nina said. "Your brothers will likely want to change you into a boy of different ages in their attempt to have some 'fun' with you. Witch girls do this to their brothers as well."

"That's disturbing." Wincing, you said.

"It's harmless for the most part." Smiling, Nina said. "The more magic is used against a boy, the more resistant he becomes to its effects. The same benefit comes from exposure to mad science."

"I read all about that but it seems too easy." Worried, you said. "There's more to it, right?"

Nina grimly nodded, pointing to a paragraph in the book. "You have to be specific when casting an age regression or progression spell." Serious, she warned. "Say you regress you brother to the age of one; his body would become to frail to change back. He would have to grow up again until the age of three before it is safe to cast the counter spell."

You shivered at that. "What about age progression?"

"Magic and mad science have one thing in common; they can not kill." With a thin smile, Nina explained. "The age progression spell contains a fail safe that will cancel itself if given too much power. You can, at best, progress a person into early to mid adulthood. Beyond that, the spell will not work."

"Is there anything else I should know about these spells?" Curious, you asked.

Nina giggled. "Be certain that you are focusing on the person you want to change." Smiling, she said. "Both with your eyes and your thoughts. If you do not, you risk the spell effecting you rather than your intended target. This is what we call a backfire spell." She laughed. "I have seen many an inexperienced witch and mad scientist find themselves in an embarrassing situation because of it."

You giggled at that then asked. "Did you want me to try this spell?"

Nina nodded and told you to try it on....
1513112221211.title: Gender spells.

choices: The spell hit but Matt did not change.
15131122212112.content:
"Matt has a fear of girls." Wincing, you said. "He has already been changed once. Also, he hates being called Mattie."

Nina grinned. "Yet he found the courage, as a girl, to curse me out with 'her' long words." Unphased, she countered. "That and you did see him return moments later with his brothers in tow."

You sighed. "I'd rather him know that its a practice spell and not just something to make him mad or uncomfortable." Firmly but kindly, you said. "It doesn't seem right to just change someone's gender without any warning or reason."

"You have a good heart, Jessica." Smiling, Nina said. "Matt is the best subject for your first supervised gender transformation spell. As your twin, Tex faces the risk of that transformation becoming permanent if you use too much power in the gender spell."

"Permanent?" Gulping, you asked.

"You face the same risk if he makes the same mistake changing you, my dear." Serious, Nina said. "Both he and you are connected magically and chaotically. As such, you augment each others power but, being of opposite poles so to speak..."

"The balance is unstable." Whispering, you said.

Nina nodded. "No one knows when or if the change will occur." Comforting you, she said. "However, it is best not to take chances until you have more training under your belt."

You nodded then opened the door to your room. "Matt, could you come to my room, please?"

Matt walked up to your room, suspecting nothing. "What's up, sis?"

You sighed. "I need to cast a gender spell under Ms Vague's supervision." To Matt's horror, you said. "I promise I will change you back to normal once she is convinced I have cast the spell correctly."

"It's more than that, Jessica." Smiling, Nina said. "You see, the more magic is used against a witch born boy, the more resistant he becomes to its effects. Your spell must push through his resistance." She then smiled at Matt. "I know you will fight this, young man."

"You would be correct in that assumption." Frowning, Matt replied. "I will not allow myself to be subject to change while I am able to ward off the invading transforming effects of magical energy."

Nina giggled. "I want you to fight this." Surprising both you and Matt, she said. "I want Jessica to know how strong a chaotic boy's defenses are."

Matt paused, thoughtful then nodded. "So she will have an idea what she is up against if she were to meet a mad scientist not of this family."

Nina nodded. "Precisely."

Matt smiled. "Okay, Jessica." Taking a stand, he said. "That woman caught me off guard. Let's see what a girl can do when I'm ready for her."

Nina smiled as you giggled. "Okay, Matt, you asked for it."

You then cast your spell...
15131122212112.title: Mattie.

choices: By changing himself back to normal.
151311222121123.content:
You smiled as Matt became her female equivalent once more. The annoyed look on his, or rather, her face was priceless. Still, you wondered why you were out of breath. "That took more out of me than I thought it would." Catching your breath, you muttered.

"That is because Mattie had gained some magical resistance due to his last experience." Kindly, Nina explained. "That and you have never tried a gender spell before now. Each time you transform a witch or chaotic born boy, it will take more magical energy to push passed their resistance."

"Thus the need for practice." Chiming in, Mattie said. "May I please return to my gender of birth?"

Nina giggled. "Of course... young lady." Teasing, she said. "Please return yourself to normal." She then turned serious. "You have an opportunity to learn some magic, as a girl."

Mattie huffed. "Other opportunities will arise in their own time." In a stressed tone, she countered. "Please focus on training my sister."

"Are you certain I can't persuade you?" Grinning, Nina asked. "You may find it... fascinating."

Matt groaned then replied...
151311222121123.title: Matt becomes Maddie again.

choices: a robot fly on the wall.
Matt peering in from the hall.
1513112221211233.content:
Matt groaned then replied by changing himself back to normal with a small, strange device he had hanging from a necklace. One quick injection and he was a boy again. "Once 'bitten', twice prepared." With a smug smile, he said. "That is the mad science way."

He then turned on his heel and marched out of the room while Nina giggled. You could only shake your head, bemused then turned to Nina. "What's so funny?"

"Your little brother is interested in magic, I can see the longing in his eyes." Amused, Nina said. "Only, he suspects he would be trapped as the one thing he fears the most."

"A girl." Grinning, you said. "He thinks we all come from an alien world."

"Well, he is not entirely incorrect." Ruefully, Nina replied. "Some of us girls are."

"Do you think his interest has anything to do with his Neko traits?" Curious, you asked.

"That is actually the heart of it." Turning serious, Nina said. "Neko people are inherently female. Your little brother is an anomaly, one many witches would want to 'repair' for the boy's own good."

You gasped at that. "So that's why dad keeps him so sheltered." Worried, you said. "Are you going to try to 'repair' him?"

Nina shook her head. "Although it would be in his best interest that I do, I dare not risk the wrath of this family." Softly, Nina said. "Nature will take its course in due time." She smiled then whispered, "Let us continue while we still have an audience."

You raised a single eyebrow to which Nina discretely pointed towards the door. You glanced at the mirror on your dresser to find...
1513112221211233.title: Once 'bitten', twice prepared.

choices: said he'd rather keep a distance.
15131122212112332.content:
You were bemused to find Matt peering in from the shadows of the hall, jotting down notes as he listened in. From his stance, you guessed that he was hoping you or Nina could not see him and discretely nodded before Nina continued. "Neko boys are literally one in a million among the witching world." Smiling, she said. "For the Neko boy to be of chaotic blood is one in a billion."

"Does Matt have magical abilities?" Curious, you asked.

"Well, yes and no." Calmly, Nina replied. "His magical power lies dormant, being a witch born boy but that power is unusually strong given his Neko traits." She sighed. "Being born a chaotic boy as well gives him some protection from girlification but his teenage years will be a struggle."

You turned hearing a yelp as Matt dropped his pen. He turned to you and Nina with his ears falling back like a frightened puppy. He look almost too adorable to bear. "Come on, Matt." Sighing, you said. "You don't have to hide to listen in."

Matt stammered, as if to search for an answer then...
15131122212112332.title: Matt peering in from the hall.

151311222121123324.content:
Before Matt could respond, dad appeared behind him and clutched his small shoulder. "Fate will determine your true form, Matt." Firmly but kindly, dad said. "Come, I have something for you to take notes on."

With that, dad and Matt both vanished from the hall. After they were gone, Nina sighed. "He is just as protective of him as he is of you, I'm afraid." Softly, she said. "I have no doubt that his bedroom is of the same design as yours." She shook her head. "Let's move on then."

"What will happen to Matt if he changes into a girl?" Worried, you asked. "Will the witching world accept... her?"

"Of course they will, dear." Gently, Nina said. "The witching world is not like the world of the normals who judge people based upon their differences; we are a bit more civilized than that."

As your studies then continued, dad took Matt to...
151311222121123324.title: dad pulled him away.

choices: You show Tia your study room.
15133.content:
A teenage girl you had never seen before was knocking on the sitting room window, peering in. She was about your size, maybe a little more petite, with long honey blond hair and blue eyes. Deciding it best to be cautious, you waved your hand over the two books, making them vanish, then walked to the sitting room entrance.

"May I help you?" opening the door a crack, you asked.

"Are you Jessica Moray?" firmly but kindly, the girl asked.

"Yes, I am." curious, you replied. "Who might you be?"

The girl offered you a small stack of papers. "I am Tia Rae, top graduate of Spell Blossom all girls boarding school." introducing herself, she said. "I have been summoned by your father to tutor you in the fine arts of magic and witchcraft."

"This is a joke, right?" hiding your nervousness, you said. "There's no such thing."

Tia smiled before discretely summoning a harmless flame to her hand. "We both know it exists, Jessica." quietly, she said. "I would prefer to continue this talk over a friendly cup of tea."

Your eyes widened, seeing the flame burn in Tia's hand and stepped aside, allowing her to enter. "Okay, I admit it would be foolish to think I was the only one with these powers, since mom had them." sitting down with Tia, you said. "Only how could dad know? I've been so careful."

"Your father has a power of his own." calmly, Tia replied. "Only its not my place to tell you what that power is, he must choose the right time to tell you."

"Or I must choose the right time to ask." to Tia's nod, you said. "I see..."

"Basically, he sensed you out and filled out the forms for a tutoring service request." summoning a tea set from nowhere, Tia said. "You will find his signature on the bottom of the last page."

You looked and saw that everything seemed to have been legit. "Okay, so where do we start?" curious, you asked. "I think I have all the basics down."

"Magic is a powerful tool, Jessica." offering you a cup of tea, Tia said. "However, if misused, it can do a lot of damage or even indirectly cause someone's death. Teaching yourself is not always a good idea, you must be properly trained."

"So you are here to get me to sign up for this Spell Blossom school?" curious, you asked.

"That would be preferable but your father is against this." sounding disappointed, Tia replied. "He has asked the dean of our school to send a tutor to help you learn her at home." she sighed, looking about. "I must admit, though, I am a bit nervous taking on this job."

"What do you mean?" confused, you asked. "I don't bite."

Tia giggled then sighed. "Its not you I'm concerned about." quietly, she said. "Remember me telling you that your father has a power of his own?" you nodded. "Well, your brothers have the same power and I am told they are very protective of you."

"Well... there is a place we could go." hesitant, you said. "Only it belonged to my mom so..."

"Its a personal space you rather not share with a stranger." softly, Tia said. "I understand that. You could come to my house to learn, its your choice."

Which do you prefer?
15133.title: someone else

151332.content:
Not willing to show your mother's private space to anyone yet, especially not someone outside the family, you agreed to go to Tia's house. After retrieving your magic book, you left a note, telling dad where you would be for a while then followed Tia outside to an awaiting car. There, in the driver's seat, was a tall, slender woman with honey blond hair and blue eyes was patiently waiting. She smiled at you as Tia opened the back passenger door for you. "Good day, Jessica Moray." politely, she said.

"This is my mother." motioning you to get in the car, Tia said. "She dropped me off and was waiting for me to either bring you out or for me to say I would be staying a while."

"It's a pleasure to meet you, ma'am." smiling, you said.

"Please, call me Cate." smiling back, the woman replied. "I sense you have a great magical talent. I am eager to see what you have learned so far from the book your aunt Viva gave you."

"You- You know my aunt gave me the book?" nervous, you asked. "How?"

Cate nodded. "Her name is etched on the cover." smiling, she replied. "That, and I went to witch school with her along with my sister."

"I see." getting into the car, you said. "She never mentioned you, though."

"Your mother was a private woman." with a sad smile, Cate replied. "She was still a good friend."

After Tia got into the car and closed the door, Cate drove away from your house to another house on the other side of town. It was a quaint, white two story house with brown shutters for the windows and a beautiful patio in the front. "Your house is beautiful." smiling, you said.

"Thank you." parking in the driveway, Cate replied. she sighed. "I must tell you, though, that I have a seven year old son, named Toby, who is very curious about everything."

You giggled. "I have a little brother like that." smiling, you said. "Only he thinks girls are from an alien world."

Cate smiled.
151332.title: You visit Tia's home.

1513321.content:
Inside the Rae house hold, you were led to a spacious private room. There, you found what looked like a movie mock up of a witch's cave. There was a large cauldron in the center of the room with a burner beneath it instead of a fire. There were a number of chairs around an oak table to the right in the back and a small indoor garden in the back to the left.

Before Matt could react, Ms Port pulled him inside her house and slammed the door. The mechanical fly flew off the book unseen and landed onto the ceiling to gain a panoramic view of the room. Matt was frightened but not speechless. "Change me back, witch!" Angry, he demanded.

"Silence, child!" Forcefully, Ms Port barked. "Do not move!"

Matt was startled into silence; he froze on the spot. Ms Port placed a light hand onto her head and gazed deeply into her eyes. After a moment, she sighed. "You were lucky this time." Ruefully, Ms Port said. "Your own power prevented the spell from forcing a permanent change. I'd dare say you will return to your annoying self in about two hours."

This news relieved Matt but he remained defiant. "Why won't you change Samuel back to normal?"

This caused you to panic as you followed dad to the grandfather clock. He opened the face door and turned it to 13 o'clock. You found this unusual as all clocks only went up to twelve. This clock went up to 24. Dad had said it was a military time clock when you were much younger. The clock moved aside, revealing a secret doorway. "We don't have a second to lose!" running through, dad said. "I must act now or we will lose Matt!"

1521111211321122311111222.content:
Ms Port was a part of a large criminal enterprise, and they didn't last long without some form of escape plan. But what mattered right now was escaping, and Samantha was going to be a part of that. Ms Port's daughters had been alerted, if the house was ever breached. The woman knew that her children would be at the safehouse on the other side of the rift by this point, waiting for their Mother to arrive.

Without saying a word Ms Port teleported away from the door, the police took that as a cue that she wasn't going quietly. And they wasted no time in storming the place, only when they got to the living room Ms Port was there. Holding Samantha in her arms as a human shield.

"Do not take a single step further, or she'll become a girl permanently!" Voe barked out.

"M-Mom! Stop this!" Samantha shouted out, the poor kid was scared witless. He or she had no idea of what the hell was going on. The officers hesitated, and Ms Port took that chance. She kicked out the carpet in front of her, exposing a large sigil carved into the wood. It was an old witch spell, that would take her to where it had been drawn. In an instant there was a flash of red lights as Ms Port stepped on it.

And then she was gone, Samantha with her.


Back at the Moray house Matt had arrived back safely, Jessica and her Father having turned him back to normal.
"Damm, she got away." Jessica said sighing at the screen.

However Mr Moray didn't seem the least bit concerned, in fact he was smiling.
"What's with the large grin Dad? By all accounts you should be annoyed that Ms Port got away with my friend." Matt muttered.

"Well let's just say that where Ms Port is going will be anywhere but safe, rouge witches have much to fear....." Nathan said with a bemused grin.


Meanwhile Ms Port had escaped, going through the sigil on the other side. It was a little safehouse on the other side of the rift, Samantha was silent aside from sobbing. Her Mother just glared at her child, annoyed that her offspring was weak. Unlike her older daughters, speaking of which they should be in the room ready to plan.

They were there, only not the way Ms Port thought they would be. Her eldest daughter Jane was in the middle, in her late teens. The one to her right was second youngest, Patricia who was just 13. And lastly there was Erica, a girl about Matt's age who had been the most eager to turn Samuel into a girl.

They were all sitting on chairs, bound by thick rope with gags over their mouths. Ms Port was shocked by this, and then a flash came out the corner of her eyes to the left. In an instant she then yelped out, a Jian was thrown at her. A type of Chinese blade stabbed her right in the left shoulder with enough force to pin her to the nearby wall, blood lightly seeped out of it.

And then a figure emerged from the shadows.......
http://www.fightersgeneration.com/np8/ch...

"Y-....You!!" Ms Port spat out, Samantha by this point had entered a state of mild shock. It was all too much to take in.

"Voe Port, we meet at last. I must say this has been too easy. Your daughters are piss poor witches, even the Bane family put up a better fight. But I like it when it's easy to take down my targets." the man was Chon Kay. This man was feared by any witch who didn't abide by the law, to the point where they gave him the nickname of blind vengeance. Ms Port knew of this man, how most magic attacks seemed to just brush off of him. He had never been turned into a girl either, Chon was a master of the Asian art of chi. An energy hardly understood by the witches of the western world, in fact all rouge witches were ordered to kill him on sight. He was that much of a danger to them.

Following him were two girls named Viva and Vogue, dressed in the same type of armour that Chon wore. Only it was fit for their size, both girls were daughters to a known rouge witch. Who only used them as pawns, the blind vengeance didn't stand for this. And in a surprising act took the girls under his care, the girls were considered traitors by rouge kind from then on.

Ms Port was about to try and move when Chon closed in, backhanding her with his left hand. He then muttered "I suggest you don't move an inch, all I need to do is move the blade down and into your heart." to show this the blind vengeance's left hand then moved to caress the handle of the sword. Almost as if he contemplated it.

Chon then moved his blindfold covered gaze down to Samantha, who by this point had passed out. "Girls take this child away, and restore his gender. I'm sure he'll be thankful."

Viva and Vogue said not a word, they knew that their adoptive Father was quite serious about this. Viva picked Samantha up and over her shoulder, thanks to Chon's martial arts training the girls had developed good upper body strength. It came in handy as most witches didn't expect the use of hand to hand combat when fighting another witch.

Once the V twins had left Chon muttered to Ms Port in a dark tone "Now Voe, you will tell me everything I want to know. If I like what I hear then you'll be fine, if not......I leave you where you are and the sword stays too. Tell me about the people involved in the rift smuggling operation....."

The his cellphone dinged. Annoyed, he answered to hear a strange, familiar female voice on the other line. "Thank you, Chon for getting rid of our most annoying competition." ".....What's going to happen now?" Samuel asked quietly.

"We need to talk, just a few questions. Nothing more, after that we'll get you turned back into a guy if you want it. And go from there, we can help you trust us." Viva said.

Samuel was a bit hesitant but then nodded and said "What about that Chinese guy, Chon was his name right?"

"He's busy at the moment but he told us to speak to you, don't worry you can trust us. Not all witches are evil." Vogue said to assure their guest, it was true. The girls had been slaves to their Mother before Chon saved them.

"Okay, what do you want to ask?" Samuel states.

"Your Sisters, when did you first find out they had magic?" Viva says, she produced a notebook and pen from the folds of her outfit.

"A....few months ago, they asked me to come and help them tidy in the kitchen. When suddenly the door was shut and the next thing I knew...."

Vogue raises a hand to say that Samuel didn't need to continue, Viva wrote down his words. Vogue would then state "Do all your Sisters have magic?"

"Yes, I was turned into a girl by all of them. So I feel correct in saying they do." Samuel says as she huffed.

I think there was Lily Sweetie, Eliza Ren and Helena Young."

He decided it best to slip away without your notice and consult with dad as what to do about your discovery of the chaotic science book and what he had observed regarding a possible power of your own. Unknown to him, you were uncertain what to make of your strange discovery. You decided it best to return both the chaotic science book and your magic book back to where you had found them and sneak away before anyone took notice of you. As you walked out of the sitting room, however, James had second thoughts and returned to speak with you. Both he and you nearly collided in the hall and stepped back startled. For a moment, you both stared at each other with an uncomfortable awkwardness in the air.

"Um.. Hey, James." Slowly, you said. "I'm glad to see you back."

"Thanks, sis." Softly, James replied. "It feels good to be home again."

You and James again felt the awkwardness in the air. The silence was maddening to both of you. James looked you in the eye to find them wavering, as if you wanted to say or ask something. As you looked into his eyes, you noticed the same thing, only his eyes seemed to be trying to pry into your mind as if hoping to read your thoughts.

"He suspects something." you thought. "Did he see me earlier? How am I going to tell him I'm a witch?"

"She suspects something." thought James. "I know she found the book of chaotic science. How am I going to tell her all the boys in her family are mad scientists?"

"I... I missed you, bro." you said, trying to break the ice. "For a while, I thought I had something to do with you running off so suddenly." Your eyes began to water. "I'm really glad you're back."

You were eager to learn as you had a close relationship with dad and your brothers, as well as your friends, Tonya and Jack. You did not want to accidentally harm them. It really hurt you not to tell anyone, especially dad, what you were really doing in the attic but you knew it was the right thing to do. Viva told you during her lectures on Skype that you would know when the time was right to reveal your powers to the family.

"I so want to show him everything." you thought, frustrated. "I'm also curious to know where he's been all this time, but how do I do it without completely freaking him out?"

"I so want to tell her everything." thought James. "I'm also curious to know what she's been up to all this time, acting so strangely, but how do I do it without completely blowing her mind or worse, freaking her out completely?"

"Even if those secrets may jeopardize her well being, father?" Frowning, James demanded. "Only boys are supposed to be able to read the book of chaotic science."

"Only because of the nanites woven into the pages programmed to detect chaotic power." Smiling slightly, dad said. "A strong magical aura can sometimes be mistaken for the power of a mad scientist."

"That troubles me as well, father." Frustrated, James said. "Jessica summoned a flame that showed at least a year of experience. Are you not even curious as to who may be teaching her?"

Dad sighed. "I have my suspicions." Serious, he said. "However, you nor I can not act on suspicion alone; we need more evidence than a single visual encounter."

"Would you care to share your suspicions, father?" Raising an eyebrow, James inquired.

Dad shook his head. "I rather not speak of it until I am absolutely certain." Firmly, he said. "If I am correct, Jessica is in way over her head. If my logic is flawed then this is simply a family affair."

Dad then turned to the window. "If I discover that either of those two witch schools are trying to pull away my little girl behind my back, I will cry havoc and let slip the dogs of war!"

James gulped seeing a death look in dad's eye. "Father...?"

Dad's expression quickly softened as he turned to James and smiled. "My earlier scans of the weather indicate that the conditions tonight will be perfect for a full test run on your new anti gravity bar. Results of your simulated flights at Eligere Sententia showed that a night flight often cleared your mind of turmoil."

Elsewhere, inside your secret attic lair, you stood in front of your cauldron facing an image of your aunt Viva in a flume of smoke bellowing from it after casting a spell to call upon her. She looked down at you with a look of concern on her face. "You look troubled my dear." Softly, she said. "Tell me what worries you so; I would like to help."

You briefly explained what had happened in the sitting room upon discovering the book of chaotic science and finished saying, "I don't know how I am going to tell him I am witch. I'm even more worried about telling daddy that I had been studying magic without telling him."

Viva was silent for a moment then replied, "I believe it is supposed to be warm and quite cloudy tonight. A good night ride on your broomstick will do well to help place your mind and spirit back into balance. The answers will come to you more clearly."

You smiled at that as you always wanted to take your 'broomstick' out and give it a real shake down.
"Four hours to launch!" you said, now smiling. "I can't wait!"

One hour later, you approached James and gave him a warm hug, surprising him. "I'm sorry I didn't hug you when I saw you back home." you said, kindly. "I sort of blamed myself for your leaving so quickly. When I saw you return, I was afraid that you might..." you teared up. "...push me away."

"You are completely blameless regarding my sudden departure." Calmly, James replied. "I was offered a once in a lifetime chance at a higher education early in life and I accepted." he paused. "Rumor has it you were a bit of a lone wolf during my absence."

"He's fishing." you thought. then you said, "Because I was studying and helping with the household chores. It kind of took a lot of my time so I cherished my alone time."

That became the main topic of your dinner conversation that night but both you, James, and dad avoided the subject of any secrets you or other may have. Still both you and James used casual conversation to try to pry answers out of each other. Neither he or you gained any ground but this did not detour any future plans to try again later. Near midnight, you opened your walk-in closet doors, entered, and closed them behind you. That triggered a secret door in the back of the closet to open revealing a hidden dim lit staircase. You followed them to your attic lair where you found your broomstick waiting for you. It was a remake of the early eighteen hundreds broomstick fabled to carry witches through the air only this model was made of solid oak with bristles of grapevine woven together with thick spindle thread.

Upon mounting it, you were immediately hovering over the floor, looking at a tunnel that led to the very wide chimney of the house. You turned to a small mirror which, after a quick spell, showed you the outside area from your pet crow nestled in a nest on the roof. Her name was Neva, she served as your eyes outside of the house. "Everything looks clear." Smiling, you said. "Thanks, Neva."

Neva squawked, "Fly already!"

You giggled and willed your broom to fly up the chimney. You cheered as you flew straight out into the night sky. Unknown to you, James had launched through the same chimney ten minutes before you and was already in flight above the clouds.

Moments later, James was hovering high above the clouds, staring at the moon. It was full that night but the heavy cloud cover kept everything dark below, so it was safe to fly about unseen.

"There is something about staring at a full moon that just takes my breath away." he said, with a sigh. "I wish I could show Jessica this. Maybe it will open her up. I want to help her." He paused sensing magic nearby and looked about but saw noting alarming. "There is a witch nearby but who..."

He let out a low gasp as he saw you rise above the clouds, in front of him on a magical broomstick! Normally, he would have laughed at the notion of a mere broomstick carrying the weight of an average human being. Only there you were, hovering several hundred feet above the ground on just such a device!

"James loves to stare at the moon." you said aloud to yourself. "I can see why. It really placing things into a new perspective." you sighed. "I wish I could show James the moon this close. Maybe it will open him up and he will tell me what is troubling him."

"She's just nervous about talking to me as I am!" thought James. "Fascinating!" He then loudly cleared his throat, causing you to turn around, startled. He then stated, "It seems as if we both have more than a few secrets to hide. I'm willing to share a few, if you are."

How do you reply?

152231132.content:
You fired a ball of magical energy near James, hoping to get him to stop so you could throttle him for his prank that had scared you so badly. Only he spun around, flying backwards, grinning at you.

"It was you who pranked me first, dear sister." Amused, he said. "It frightened me as well."

"A partial gender change will not kill you!" Annoyed, you countered. "A fall from ten thousand feet will!"

James nodded. "I concede your point; I apologize." Smiling, he said. "If you can manage to hit me once, I'll answer your questions."

You smiled at that, being confident in your flying skills. "You are on!"

James laughed and dived down at an incredible speed. His bold move caused you to do a double take but you recovered swiftly and cackled as you gave pursuit. James glanced into the rear view mirror on his bar, expecting to find you far behind. He let out a snort and laugh seeing you were less than a car's length away, grinning wickedly.

"Well, at least now I can see what kind of power she is packing." Bemused, he thought. "Let's see if she can keep up on that piece of wood and vine."

You felt a surge of adrenaline, seeing that you were quickly coming within striking range with your magic. Normally, it was not easy to fire off blasts while flying a broomstick at such speeds. Fortunately, you had found a way around that. You had added oak branches to the broomstick which acted like handlebars, allowing you to fly one handed. You fired off several blasts and a few spells with your free hand only to find James firing back. He was using rear view mirrors on his bar to watch you and counter your attacks.

"He's better at this than I thought!" Smiling, you muttered. "I have to admit, win or lose, this is going to be great fun!"

High into the night sky, through the dense clouds, and around tall buildings, you chased James, just managing to stay right on his tail as you fired while he defended. You managed to take out one of his rear view mirrors, taking away at least part of his advantage.

"She's actually very skilled with that broomstick." Impressed, James stated to himself. "I haven't been able to shake her yet." He then grinned proudly. "Still, she has yet to strike a single blow."

"Gez!, I'm just barely staying on his tail and I'm giving it all she has!" Frustrated, you stated. "What is powering that thing!?!" Then you smiled. "It's time to add a little magic to the mix!"

With that, you gripped both the handlebars and added your magic to the broomstick. Only, in your zealous move, you used too much and ended up passing James in a blur! This time, he was forced to do a double take. "What could she be up to?" Raising an eyebrow, he wondered.

Then he let out a low scream as you suddenly turned around and fired magical blasts at him! He spun out of your path just narrowly missing getting hit by one of them as you passed. James laughed seeing that you still had a few tricks up your sleeve. He then became serious, knowing that he had to end the duel before things got out of hand. He allowed you to get within hearing rage then called to you.

"It's getting late, Jessica!" He called. "We will call this match a draw! Last one home talks first!"

You nodded then kicked your broomstick into overdrive but James was ready for you and activated some form of booster rocket, staying several feet ahead of you. Knowing that you were not going to win, you quickly touched one of your pierced earrings, calling to your crow, Neva.

"I am coming in fast with an invited guest twenty feet ahead." you said. "Be ready to welcome James to my lair, Neva."

"One boy in the pot!" Squawking, Neva said in your ear.

"Behave, Neva!" Giggling, you scolded.

James flew down into the chimney with you right behind him giggling. When you reached the landing area, ten seconds after your brother, you found him looking about. "Fascinating..." Whispering, he said.

"Welcome to my lair, James." you said.

James turned to you, smiling slightly then turned back to the scene before him. You could tell that he was impressed; that made you smile.

"I lost the race so here it goes..." Smiling, you told him. "I am a witch, just like my mother."

James knew that his and your mother was a witch but he did not suspect that you knew of this. Nor was he aware that your aunt Viva was a witch as she hid her power very well from him. Dad seemed to know something but did not wish to speak of it unless he was certain. He guessed that your lair would provide the clues he needed to determine who had been teaching you magic.

1522311321.content:
James looked about with his eyes welling with tears. Your lair took up the entire width and length of the house with a vaulted ceiling painted to look like the night sky. All of the far walls were covered with books from floor to ceiling with the exception of a small door on the far side near the rear of the house where your bedroom lied on the second floor.

Where you and he stood was a small workshop set up to make and repair broomsticks with a small chemistry set to make magical armaments. He guessed they were to defend yourself against other witches as not all witches or mad scientists were united. Dad had told James before he left for training that some witches would try to attack her merely because of her last name. He was not sure why then but he knew now. Mad scientists and witches, though allies, do not fully trust the other.

In the center of the room was a huge cauldron surrounded by a maze of hanging gardens with tables throughout to assemble ingredients for potions. From what James could tell from the short duel, you had become fairly skilled in the art of making potions. What concerned him was why he was not informed of your training. It was a question he intended to find an answer to soon.

There were sectioned off areas of the room, hidden by office divider walls that he guessed served as a form of infirmary and or nap area for over night projects. There was also a crow, standing on the edge of the large cauldron staring at him. The crow itself did not unsettle him; it was the magical power he sensed coming from it. Certain animals such as crows or cats can accumulate magical power, though they can not use it. However, they can grant that power to augment the magical power of a witch they chose to bond with. These creatures were called familiars. James knew for a fact that mom had such a crow and now it was loyal to Jessica.

"This was mother's sanctuary." Whispering, James said. "How did you come to acquire it?"

"Through mom's will." Sadly, you replied. "Only I did not know about it until aunt Viva approached me on my twelfth birthday."

You told James everything that had happened that day aunt Viva had approached you and how you came to practice and love magic and witchcraft. James listened intently; only nodding or grunting in response. When you had finished, he drew in a long breath then slowly released it. "I take it aunt Viva has been your teacher for the entire eleven months since you gained access to this lair and the magic book?" Evenly, he inquired. "You have not been attending any schools of witchcraft?"

"The only training I had been given was from aunt Viva." Calmly, you said. "She told me that if Spellblossom or Witchbloom all girls boarding schools learned I was practicing magic, they would try to quietly coax me into signing up with one of them."

"That would be ill-advised." Serious, James said. "You are the only witch in a family of mad scientists."

"I sort of figured that part on my own." Shuddering, you said. "But what does that have to do with either of these schools that teach witchcraft?"

"We fear the attending staff of either school would try to convince you to 'transfer' into a family of all witches." Frowning, James replied. "We the Moray family will not stand for that sort of practice."

"They would try to kidnap me?" Startled, you asked.

"It is just a rumor; likely unfounded." Flatly, James said. "Still, would you take that chance?"

His face then softened. "I am curious to see how you hold yourself in a one on one practice duel; low level energy bursts only."

You smiled slightly. "Okay. What are the rules?"

James pointed to the circular landing platform you and he were standing on. Both yours and his broomstick were already placed on special hooks near the workstation. "The first to knock the other off this landing wins." Smiling, James said.

You giggled. "I can handle that."

James chuckled. "Let's have at it then!"

15223113211231222.content:
You suddenly felt strange before finding yourself standing in an immense grand hall. Large elaborate gold chandeliers light the scene as you looked down to the end to find a wide staircase that branched off into two directions to the floor above.

"...of Eligere Sententia!" Finishing his sentence, dad announced.

"What?!" Stunned, you asked. You turned to dad and your brother angrily. "You tricked me!"

"Nonsense!" Smiling, dad scoffed. "This is where my laboratory, every mad scientist's laboratory began!"

"We are answering all of your questions, Jessica." Smiling, James said. "This is where I was all year."

"You are not suggesting that I..." Worried, you began.

"No, you will not be spending a year here, dear child." Amused, dad said. "Unless you wish to, of course."

You quickly shook your head. "No, thank you."

Dad smiled and summoned a strange bracelet to his hand. "This is a visitor's band." Kindly, he said. "Put it on so you will be seen as a guest and not a student."

You took the bracelet from dad and put it on; it snapped shut around your wrist with a click and a beep. This startled you but James gave you a reassuring smile. "It is forbidden for a mad scientist to lie; it is illogical to do so." Calmly, he explained. "That bracelet will come off when you are away from the school."

"I hope so." Sighing, you said.

You shuddered hearing screams and moans echoing from the many halls followed by the mad laughter of hundreds of people from all directions. Seeing your reaction, dad placed a gentle hand onto your shoulder. "The screams and moans you hear are actually the sirens that mark the end of a school day." Smiling, he said. "You only hear screams and moans because you are not a student."

This confused you until James added, "It is to detour the curious who happen to stumble upon the school castle grounds despite our efforts to make it invisible to the eyes of normal people."

"Sort of like a creepy no trespassing sign." Guessing correctly, you said.

Dad nodded. "Precisely." He motioned you forward. "We want you to completely understand what mad science is all about so you will not fear it but rather respect it."

"Much like Tex and Matt will learn to respect your magic." Serious, James added.

"Well, I guess that makes sense." Sighing, you said. You forced a smile. "Where do we start the tour?"

Dad smiled and replied...
15223113211231222.title: of Eligere Sententia; you've been tricked!

152231132112312222.content:
"Who was your professor?" Curious, you asked.

James smiled. "His name is Professor Nero Osis." Calmly he said. "He's really my age."

"Your age?" Surprised, you asked. "How did he become a professor?"

"Great deeds bring great rewards in this world, Jessie." Using your new name, dad said. "Nero learned of a plot by a number of young mad scientists to raid Spellblossom all girls boarding school and cause chaos."

"How did he put a halt to this plot to evoke panic and disorder?" Curious, you inquired.

Dad smiled. "He expertly infiltrated the school and picked the boys off one by one as they began their mischievous raid." Amused, he explained. "He left the would be raiders to be discovered by the teaching staff before any student was aware of their presence."

"He was willing to become a girl to protect the peace between the two powers." Smiling, James added. "What was even more amazing was that he remained undetected while doing it and left the school after he performed his deed."

"That is incredible." Impressed, you said. "How did he pull it off?"

Dad grinned. "That is classified by request of the witch council." Opening a door, he said. "They do not want too many other mad scientists pulling that stunt."

You were led into a large classroom where you found a muscular man of average height with messy, longish black hair. He wore a boomer hat, and a black suit covered by a long white lab coat. He turned, hearing dad's voice, revealing bright hazel eyes under thick glasses with goggles hung onto his hat. He gave a toothy grin, saluting dad with a wolf's head cane.

"Welcome back to my lair of teachings, James Moray!" Smiling, he said. "To what honor do I find you returning to Eligere Sententia?"

"My father and I are proudly giving my transformed sister a tour of this fine school so she will understand our powers rather than fear them." Motioning to you, James replied. "He is rather skilled for being a home schooled witch."

Nero threw his head back, laughing before turning to you. "How well are you coping to having a male form rather than being female, my dear?" Amused, he asked.

"I'm trying not to think about it." Wincing, you said.

Nero chuckled, more kindly. "It will take time to adjust to any new form." Calmly, he said. "You are not the first to experience a gender transformation." He paused then asked, "Are you planning to attend our prestigious academy of advanced learning of mad science?"

"It's not one of the first items on my to do list." Wincing, you said.

"Ah! You did not state it was not on your to do list!" Smiling, Nero pointed out. "You must be specific when answering a question as many answers can be turned against you if left open for interpretation."

You jumped at that and quickly said. "I have not yet decided."

Nero smiled. "That's better." Calmly, he said. "You will find that mad scientists and witches alike will use your own logic against you to get their way."

"What logic are you using then, professor?" Smiling slightly, you asked. "I get the sense that you are trying to recruit me."

Nero chuckled. "Of course, I am, dear child..."
152231132112312222.title: We first meet James' professor.
