1522311321123122221.content:
Nero chuckled. "Of course I am, dear child. You are of the Moray family."

"What does that have to do with anything?" Raising an eyebrow, you demanded.

Dad and James chuckled. "He has not yet been brought up to full speed, professor." Smiling, James explained. "Would you care to elaborate for us?"

Nero grinned. "I would be honored, your highness." Bowing, he replied.

"Highness?" Confused, you asked. "Are we some kind of mad science royalty?"

Dad laughed with James and Nero following. "In a way, yes." Smiling, Nero said. "Your grandfather is the head mad scientist of the global collective; the king of all mad scientists."

"That makes me the next in line." Smiling, dad said.

"To the point, you are a part of the most chaotically strongest families in existence." Turning serious, Nero explained. "That said, being born female, you have a great potential for both magic and mad science." After a pause, he added, "So do your brothers, Tex and Matt."

"You lost me." Wincing, you said. "Only girls can be witches."

"Ah but Tex is your twin." Grinning, dad said. "He has the potential to become female due to the twin phenomenon which occurs in witch and mad science families alike with fraternal twins."

"As for Matt, he is a Neko wolf." Smiling, James added. "Neko born are usually always female; Matt stands a strong chance of becoming just that."

"Regardless of gender, our power is among the strongest in the world." Serious, dad said. "I would rather see Tex and Matt remain male and carry on our powerful legacy. However, I will not love them less if they become my daughters." He smiled at you. "Or if you become my fourth son."

"It is a lot to take in, Mr Moray." Grinning, Nero said. "I suggest you wait until the tour is over before you digest all of this data and compile it at your leisure."

You responded with a nervous laugh then asked, "Exactly what do mad scientists learn here, compared to a witch school?"

Nero laughed. "I see you are curious despite the concept of becoming male for life!" Amused, he said. "That is the type of student I like to see in my classroom! Breaking boundaries, leaping beyond logic, and shedding light upon the unknown!"

"That's not quite what I meant..." Wincing, you protested.

Nero barely heard you, the excitement in his eyes made you worried. "Come! Allow me to show you what benefits you may reap from the use of chaotic energy, what we lovingly call mad science!"
1522311321123122221.title: A powerful legacy.

15223113211231222213.content:
Before you could protest further, a small group of boys entered the classroom. They were all chuckling madly to themselves as they took their seats. Nero motioned you to stand with dad who pulled you closer to him inside a large square that was painted onto the floor.

"This is the visitor's box." Whispering carefully, dad explained. "You would be wise to remain standing inside the square during this class."

"Welcome, miscreants." Smiling, Nero said. "I see my fellow teachers have sent me another baker's dozen of troubled students who need to be shown the straight and narrow of mad science."

"We have done nothing to break the laws of mad science, professor." Serious, one boy protested. "We were merely testing the social boundaries of the school system."

The other students quickly nodded to which Nero laughed madly. "So you were all a part of this mishandled, misconstrued experiment that went astray." Amused, he said. "I'm certain you heard the expression too many cooks spoil the broth... Well, too many scientists overthink their plans."

"Why are we being detained as troubled students, professor?" Annoyed another boy demanded. "No rules or regulations were broken in our plan, despite the fact that our plan failed."

Nero's smile changed to that of a serious scowl. "You have the audacity to ask such an unintelligent question, young man?!" Angered, he inquired. "We mad scientists are all held responsible for every mistake we make, regardless of how insignificant they may seem!"

"Any mistake made can cascade through a chain reaction, resulting in disastrous consequences." Speaking up, dad said. "Mistakes left uncorrected are guaranteed to end in said result."

Nero smiled at dad then motioned to you, dad, and James. "Students, we are in the presence of three members of the Moray family." Smiling again, he said. "They expect nothing less than perfection from trained mad scientists like yourselves." He then scoffed. "Even Mr Moray's transformed daughter here could execute a plan better then the one you idiots pieced together!"

You remained silent, sensing a trap only James spoke up. "Forgive the interruption, my most patient professor; I can not contain my curiosity." Smiling, he said. "What plan did these misguided students form which earned them to be dubbed troubled students?"

Nero smiled madly. "They attempted to duplicate my famous feat at Spellblossom all girls boarding school, using this school as the testing grounds." Smiling, he explained. "Only they failed to anticipate the detection of an unauthorized gender transformation within the school grounds."

"They should have declared their plan a self test of their capabilities." Smiling, dad said. "That way, the gender transformation would have been authorized and they would not be in altercation with authority."

Nero eyed the students with a grin. "Precisely."

"You mentioned that Mr Moray's transformed daughter could execute our plan better than the one we 'idiots' pieced together." Defiant, the first student said. "I believe we would all agree that would be interesting to witness."

You threw the student a death glare, not realizing that you had just revealed to him that you were the transformed daughter. Nero laughed, shaking his head. "I see you wish to challenge a member of the Moray family!" Grinning, he said. "What a dangerous concept. You are indeed a fanatic of risk taking."

"My transformed daughter is an authorized visitor of Eligere Sententia." Smiling madly, dad said. "As such, 'he' is free to explore the school and leave without any consequences." He then eyed you, making you feel nervous. "However, if 'he' is up to the challenge, I will allow 'him' to attempt to leave the school unnoticed as a test of his newfound attributes and existing resourcefulness."

"What do you say, Jessie Moray?" Smiling, Nero inquired. "Are you up for the challenge?"

"What will happen to me if I fail?" Nervous, you asked.

"Then you will be returned to me and we will return home where I shall keep my promise to you." Serious, dad said. "This is a direct challenge from a troubled student. Do you accept his challenge?"

You bit your lip, thinking...
15223113211231222213.title: The next class pours into the room.

152231132112312222133.content:
You bit your lip, thinking then slowly grinned as an idea formed within your mind. "To accept such a challenge without proper planning and preparation would only lead to a guaranteed defeat." Calmly, you said. "However, I offer a counter challenge to this entire class."

James raised a single eyebrow as did a number of the troubled students. Dad and Nero, however smiled as the prospect of what you may have in store. "Pray tell what challenge do you offer the class?" Curious, dad asked. "As your father, I have the right to approve or disapprove of any challenge you offer."

You smiled. "Quite simple, actually." Eyeing the class, you said. "As I am an authorized visitor of this school and may wander as I please within reason, I will not get into trouble walking through the halls."

"What is your point?" Impatient, a student asked.

You grinned, giving dad a wink. "I propose you all try to find a 'frightened' transformed girl trying to leave school grounds." Smiling, you said. "If I can find my way out before the beginning of the next class, I win."

"What are the rewards and consequences?" Looking at me, Nero inquired.

"Bragging rights." Smiling, you replied. "If I can make it out of the school in time, I can brag that I made it out despite these students scientific might." Before anyone could respond, you added, "If I fail, this class can brag that they 'rescued' the daughter of a Moray."

Dad laughed. "You do not know the twists and turns of this school, my dear." Amused, he said. "You are at the disadvantage in this wager."

You laughed yourself. "On the contrary, aunt Viva magically gave me knowledge of every inch of this school including where visitors are not permitted to wander." Grinning, you countered. "Planned and prepared, father."

Dad shook his head, a bemused look on his face. "Very well, Jessie." he said. "I approve of your counter challenge as unorthodox as it might seem."

"Only will the students accept the challenge?" Smiling slyly, Nero asked. "I give full permission to leave the class and wander the halls to find the poor lost visitor."

The students smiled, all nodding in unison. "We accept." Smiling, another student said.

"Then the game is afoot!" Excited, Nero announced. "You may run now, Jessie; good luck!"

You nodded then hurried out of the room, remembering what aunt viva said about mad science. "Magic and mas science are one and the same except for gender and power origination." Whispering to yourself, you muttered. "Therefore, all I need to do is work with what I know."

Moving quickly, you ran up the wall, using your power to manipulate gravity around you and preceded to run down the hall on the high ceiling. "Intelligence aside, very few think to look up." Amused, you thought.

Moments later, the troubled students ran out into the hall and looked about for any sign of you. "We only have thirty minutes to locate Jessie Moray." Firmly, one boy said. "He will likely head for the administration entrance in the north wing. Split up and we will regroup there!"

While the boys each took a different hall to search for you. Only you had stopped only a few feet down the hall and listened. "The administration hall... well now I know which way not to go."

Slowly, the minutes passed. When the bell rang out for the end of the troubled class, the students returned to the room...
152231132112312222133.title: You offer a counter challenge.

1522311321123122221332.content:
Dad smiled, seeing the boys pouting as they entered without you in tow. His cellphone then rang and he picked up on the second ring. "Announce your location, child." Grinning, he said.

"Look out the window." Amused, you replied.

Dad turned to the window and grinned seeing you standing just off school grounds in a small park. You waved at him to which he waved back. You jumped slightly, finding yourself back in the room with him in the next breath. "Congratulations, young man!" Smiling, dad said. "You have conquered your first challenge as a mad scientist, you make the Moray family proud!"

"It is near impossible for a visitor to leave school grounds without being spotted by the prefects." Impressed, James said. "How did you accomplish this feat?"

You smiled. "Visitor protection protocol." Calmly, you replied. "The prefects can not allow a visitor to become harmed by the enrolled students nor allow a frightened transformed girl to spark a permanent change through a forced act of the use of chaotic energy on campus."

Dad laughed as the troubled students began to blush with embarrassment. "You truthfully told a prefect that you were a transformed girl being chased by troubled students." Amused, he said. "The prefect followed school rules and regulations by escorting you off campus until the situation could be looked into and dealt with properly." He shook his head. "However, you did not inform him that it was a challenge."

You chuckled. "On the contrary, I did inform him that it was a test of my abilities." Smiling, you replied. "However, the prefect still had to follow the same protocol until the matter could be confirmed."

"Well played, Moray." Appearing at the door, a boy in a prefect uniform said. "I can see that your father has already teleported you back into the school to celebrate your victory."

"This was not a fair challenge!" Annoyed, a troubled student announced. "Jessie Moray illegally made use of a protocol designed to protect visitors while he was in no real danger!"

James opened his mouth to speak only you spoke for yourself. "The visitor protocol does not state endangered students so its use is clearly not in violation of the challenge agreement." Confident, you countered. "Had you told a prefect there was a transformed girl running amok in the halls, trying to find a way out, they would have been searching for me to determine why I was trying to leave."

James grinned. "My brother has a valid point, miscreants." Amused, he said. "Make use of every advantage otherwise someone else will!"

"As I can see the transformed girl is now in safe hands, I will return to my hall duties." Smiling, the prefect said. "Please consider attending our fine institution of highest education. You would make a fine mad scientist, Mr Moray."

He then left as the troubled students eyed you with a certain displeasure. Their cold glares made you feel uneasy only they remained in their seats to the dark return glare from dad.

"This challenge is over, Jessie Moray is the victor." Smiling, Nero announced. He grinned at the troubled students. "Your science and logic is flawed, gentlemen. I will see you for the next troubled class."

The troubled students left the classroom, grumbling among themselves before dad turned to you. "Shall we continue our tour or have you seen enough excitement for one day... Jessie?"

You sighed then replied...

"When meeting the dean, try to be patient." Turning serious, dad said. "He is a bit eccentric... even by mad science standards."

"He is very powerful, make no mistake." Smiling slightly, dad replied. "He merely does not act his age due to a curse put onto him by his ex-wife ten years ago."

Dad had seen the events unfold in the sitting room and silently shook his head. He casually entered the room where Tex was struggling to pull a book out of your hand. He stopped immediately after he cleared his throat.

"This is quite an unnerving sight before me, children." Sternly, he said. "Barging into a room and snatching a book from your sister's hand is hardly gentleman like behavior, Tex."

"The book is my personal possession, father." Almost whining, Tex protested. "You know its importance."

A bemused smile formed upon dad's face. Neither Tex or you noticed that your brother's hair had grown to his shoulders or that he had lost a few inches in height. "Are you certain you were attempting to acquire the correct book from your sister?"

"Of course, I am certain!" Annoyed, Tex replied. "This book is mine!"

Dad chuckled in a way that made you and Tex nervous. Tex looked down at the book he was still trying to pry from you and screamed, jumping back as if he had just been electrocuted. "That's the magic book! I wanted my book of chaotic science!"

"Perhaps." Grinning, dad said. "However, the magic book sensed your desperation and desire to have it, thus it is granting your wish."

Tex screamed again as the changes to his body accelerated. "Jessica, please throw me the other book!" Desperate, he pleaded. "I need it to stop this!"

You looked around for the other book but found it missing. You turned to dad to find the book in his hand. "Your new sister will not be needing this for a while." Calmly, he said. "She will have to learn the proper way to change herself back to normal."

"Dad, what is going on here?" Worried, you asked. "Are you and Tex some kind of mad scientists?"

Dad nodded, a grin forming onto his face. "All of the boys in this family are mad scientists." Calmly, he explained. "We shall discuss it in length later." He then motioned to the pouting teenage girl where Tex once stood. "For now, I suggest you help 'Erica' find some more appropriate clothing."

"Can you fix this, daddy?" Wincing, you pleaded. "Te- err- Erica does not seem to like this."

"She should have been more careful with her book and more alert when trying to reacquire it." Firmly, dad said. "No; she will have to learn how to change herself back. You may help her learn if you wish." His smile then returned. "I shall be upstairs redecorating my new daughter's bedroom."

Tex, now Erica gasped. "Don't you dare!" Startled, she screamed.

Dad suddenly vanished from sight and Erica ran towards the stairs with you, still very confused, following behind her. Upon reaching the second floor, you found Erica staring into her bedroom with a forlorned look on her face. You peered into her room to find it...

"That is because you have not reached the chapter covering the dangers of having a boy twin." Surprising you, dad remarked. "As your twin, he too has magic within him."

You sighed. "He has to decide which power he wants more."

Dad nodded. "Precisely. Also, there is a phenomenon known as the twin condition. A girl twin to a mad scientist will change into a boy and a mad scientist to form a balance."

You gasped, understanding where dad was going with this. "Only, if that girl twin was a witch..."

"Then one or the other will change based on power or desire." Serious, dad said. "Tex made a critical error when he grabbed the magic book in his haste to retrieve the book of chaotic science. He gave the false impression that he desired to wield magic."

"I guess I should start teaching her then." Wearily, you said.

Dad shook his head. "Let her come to you."

Dad nodded. "Tex had indeed grabbed the proper book but he needed to be taught to be more tactful in his approach so I switched books on him."

"That's not funny, daddy!" Serious, you hissed. "Tex could be stuck as Erica for life!"

Your eyes widened. "You'll be testing me as well?"

"Chapter four of your book, my dear." Serious, dad said. "It's all there. I suggest you read that magic book more carefully in the future."

With that, he walked away. You were not sure what to do at this point. You could not tell Erica that she was being tested as it would make your test that much worse later on. Also, you took dad's statement about the magic book as a warning.
1531213.title: I gave her a copy of the magic book.

15312131.content:
Knowing that your brother, turned sister was not under any immediate threat of being stuck as a girl, you decided to follow dad's advice and study the magic book more carefully. In the first few pages, which you had only scanned through the first time, you discovered that just holding the magic book will not spark an immediate transformation. Only if the book were opened would a transformation occur and the one opening the book would have to have a knowledge of magic. Otherwise, the pages would simply appear blank.

"Dad must have changed Tex." Curious, you muttered. "Which means he should be able to change himself back after a few magic lessons." Then you remembered dad telling you to let him come to you and realized that Tex often preferred to solve his own problems. "Dad is trying to teach Tex to ask for help when needed."

Then you remembered dad mentioning chapter four and quickly moved to that page. The first few sentences in the first paragraph carried new meaning as you recalled dad's advice...

Great power demands great responsibility. We are all accountable for our actions and mistakes, both large and small as they can cascade into disaster.
15312131.title: You study the magic book carefully.

"Hey, sis." Startling you, Matt said. "What'cha got there?"

"Oh, just some old books." Trying to be light, you replied. "Nothing you would be interested in."

"Hey!" Pouting, Matt complained. "I do read! I just read what interests me."

He looked the chaotic science book and turned slightly pale. Something you noticed. "What's wrong?"

"Your book?" Surprised, you asked. "You are the mad scientist?"

Matt blushed brightly. "Are we going to talk about our secret books or our fashion sense?" Annoyed, he asked. "Stay on one subject."

"Don't tell me you have a girlfriend!" Surprised, you blurted out. "I thought you hated girls."

"I don't 'hate' them." Pulling free from you, Matt argued. "They just creep me out. Only this girl..." He stopped talking then turned red. "All of the boys in this family are mad scientists, okay! I wasn't allowed to tell you unless you showed a power of your own!"

"You mean like this?" Summoning a flame, you asked.

Matt nodded. "Yeah. Well, now you know so I'm out of here!"

A dull flash later, Matt was gone, leaving you with more than just one mystery. The issue was you could only pursue one mystery at a time.
1542.title: More than one mystery.

choices: Find out who this girl is.
15421.content:
Sighing, you grabbed your magic book and walked to dad's study where you found him talking to your older brother, James. They stopped talking seeing you approach. "Am I interrupting anything?" Politely, you asked. "It can wait."

Dad saw the magic book in your hand and summoned you in with a wave of his hand. You complied and the door closed itself behind you. "I knew you were a witch the moment you were born, Jessica." Firmly but kindly, dad said. "It is only logical as your mother was a witch herself." He sighed. "However, I sense that there is something else weighing on your mind."

You told dad what had happened in the sitting room after you had returned home from school. Dad and James listened in silence as you told them about finding the chaotic science book, Matt saying that it was his and of his girlish bracelet. "I sensed magic on that bracelet he is wearing, daddy." Worried, you said. "It may end badly for Matt if he has a crush on a young witch. Hearing that he's some form of mad scientist complicates matters."

"Interesting." Raising an eyebrow, dad said. "Let us address one issue at a time here."

"All of the boys in this family are mad scientists, Jess." Chiming in, James said. "Do not fear, it is nothing like they depict in horror novels and movies."

"Like your magic, chaotic energy is a power source that only certain people can harness and control." Serious, dad explained. "Magic is geared for girls while chaotic energy is geared for boys. They both work in similar ways, thus they mirror each other."

"Something tells me that they can't mix." Wincing, you said.

James shook his head. "No, they can't." Honestly, he replied. "If you were to try an event, our version of a spell, it would blow up in your face."

"Much like a spell blowing up in a boy's face." Thoughtful, you said. "Viva told me that in one of her lessons and it's clearly noted in the magic book she gave me."

Dad nodded. "Your aunt just recently informed me that she had given you the magic book." Frowning, he said. "While I was disappointed she did not gain my blessings first, I am relieved I do not need to send you to a special school to learn magic."

"There are schools that teach magic?" Curious, you asked.

"Of course." Smiling, James said. "I was at a school that teaches mad science. Eligere Sententia all boys boarding school."

"There are two schools that teach magic." Looking at me, dad said. "However, that is a topic for another conversation. Let us now discuss the issue with Matt's crush on a young witch."

"I concur, father." Frowning, James said. "Matt's crush could complicate matters in the weeks ahead."

Dad nodded then turned to you. "I suggest you follow Matt and determine if this girl truly returns Matt's affections or if she and he are a pawn in something of a grander scale."

"What do you mean?" Taken back, you asked.

James sighed. "There is much you need to learn about many things in this world, Jessica." Gently, he said. "For now, I will say that most witches and mad scientists alike prefer to keep only one power within their households."

"When a mad scientist suitor comes to the door of a witch family, the mother will test that boy's loyalty and measure his true love." Ruefully, dad added. "I know this first hand."

"What do you want me to do?" Worried, you asked.

Dad smiled and replied...
15421.title: You talk to dad.

choices: At the Mage residence with you.
At the mall with an escort, you talk with Ms Mage.
She drags Matt to her room.
154212.content:
"You want me to spy on Matt?" Surprised, you asked.

"As a witch, you will be not be viewed as much of a threat as your little brother." Serious, dad said. "That, and if the situation merits it, you can defend him with your own magic."

"We are not suggesting you interfere with Matt's personal life." Chiming in, James said. "We merely wish to know if Matt will be able to handle himself or if he is over his head and in need of assistance."

You sighed. "If I know him, he has already left the house to go see this girl."

Dad looked at a device on his desk. "You are correct." Turning to you, he said. "Matt is currently at the west end of the street and turning right. If you teleport out now, you should be able to follow him without being detected by anyone."

You nodded and cast the needed spell. Seconds later, you found yourself on the west end of your street where you spotted Matt turning right onto the next street. Using an unaware spell, you followed him to a house directly behind your own. "I remember seeing this family moving in last month." Curious, you thought. "Matt must have been the first to welcome them to the neighborhood."

It was a quaint two story white house with light grey shutters on the windows, an attached two car garage, and a beautiful garden in the back yard. Matt walked up to the front door and politely knocked. Moments later, a tall, slender woman answered. She looked down at Matt, brushing her long brown hair away from her green eyes. "May I help you, young man?" Curious, she asked.

"Greetings and salutations, Ms Mage." Bowing slightly, Matt said. "My name is Matt Moray, mad scientist in training."

Ms Mage's eyes widened slightly, an unimpressed look forming onto her face. "What is your business here, Mr Matt Moray, mad scientist in training?" Glaring at Matt, she asked.

"I have come to seek permission to take your daughter, Lilith Mage to the malt shop in the mall for an unadventurous outing." Politely, Matt replied. "She and I had become acquainted in school and it is my intention to expand that acquaintance to strengthen our friendship."

There was a pause before Ms Mage giggled. "So you are the mysterious young man Lilly has been swooning over for the passed several days." Bemused, she said. "You do understand that her affections are most likely a fickle fascination with who and what you are."

"Nothing ventured, nothing gained, Ms Mage." Smiling, Matt countered. "I am only requesting to spend time with Lilith outside of school hours."

Ms Mage looked out at the street. "What of your friend?" Curious, she asked.

Standing on the street, you gasped. "She sensed me..."

"Friend?" Turning around, Matt asked. He moaned. "Why are you following me, sis?"

You sighed, making yourself visible. "Dad asked me to follow you in case you might need help." Approaching him, you admitted. "He knows from experience how protective mothers of witch families can be of their daughters."

"You are a witch, then?" Curious, Ms Mage asked.

You nodded. "My mother was a witch." Somewhat sadly, you said. "My aunt is training me."

"Any sisters?" Concerned, Ms Mage pressed.

You shook your head. "I'm the only daughter." Sighing, you said. "My father can be very protective."

"Then you understand my position." Firmly but kindly, Ms Mage said. "Since you are here with your brother, I will allow the two of you to enter. Be aware, though, I have strict house rules with spells and enchantments to enforce them."

"Father has similar safeguards to enforce our house rules." Serious, Matt countered.

Ms Mage nodded and stepped aside. "You may enter."

You followed Matt into the house where you saw Lilith sitting on a couch in the sitting room. She was no taller than your brother with long sand brown hair and emerald blue eyes. She was wearing a pink princess dress, coloring a picture. Also sitting in the room were two girls, you guessed were her older sisters. One looked to be your age with long sand brown hair and fire hazel eyes. She was wearing a strange school uniform you did not recognize. The other was close to James' age. She too had long sand brown hair but had ocean green eyes. She was wearing a blue jeans skirt and blouse set. All of them turned to you and Matt as you entered.

"Matt!" Excited, Lilith called.

She dropped her crayons and ran to Matt, giving him a hug. "I knew you would come over." Smiling, she said. "This is my sister, Maxine; she's twelve. And the other is Serena; she is fifteen."

"Who is your friend, Matt?" Releasing him, Lilith asked. "Is she your sister?"

"I'm Jessica Moray." Politely, you said. "It's a pleasure to meet you all."

"Matt and Jessica are from a family of mad scientists." Bluntly, Ms Mage said. "Jessica is the only witch in that family."

"Have they experimented on you yet?" Wincing, Maxine asked.

"Maxine, that was rude." Sternly, Ms Mage said. "There is good and evil in everyone, mad scientists and witches included."

"Their father was permanently changed by a mad scientist." Patiently, she explained. "We have since been weary of... their kind."

"It's not personal." Quickly, Serena chimed in. "We have merely learned to be careful who we trust."

"With that said, you may spend time with Lily here." Calmly, Ms Mage said. "However, you will not take her to the mall without an escort from this family."

Matt sighed then decided to spend time with Lilith...
154212.title: Meet the Mage family.

choices: Ms Mage has a word with Matt's Father
1542123.content:
Lilith would look to her Mother "Mom can Mat come up to my room with me? Pretty please?" she said looking at her mom holding both of her hands in front of her.

Ms Mage sighed and then smiled and said "Go on then, play nice and no magic or science."

Matt was a bit unsure, Jessica knew of his so called "Girl phobia." but he let Lilith hug him at least. And he didn't freak out then. So she merely laughed and said "Have fun Matt."

Matt was about to speak and chime up with something, but Lilith was already tugging his arm and yanking him down the hallway. One arm held on his and the other opening the door to her room.

It was a typical girl's room, Matt had estimated that if Jessica were to be Lilith's current age then she would most likely have the same room. He gulped loudly, trying not to focus on the girly things in the room. "Keep your view on Lilith, think of something to say...." Matt shouted in his mind.

He coughed, the usual one that you'd do when you were about to start talking. Only Lilith motioned for him to sit on the end of her bed, Matt nodded and did so.

"So....." he started.

"So....Lilith said as she sat in the chair of her vanity, at the same time.

Matt and Lilith then went silent, Matt bit his lower lip and looked at his shoes.
"This social situation is indeed very difficult, but I must try and persevere. Ms Mage did say there is good and evil in all sorts, consensus has shown that to be true most of the time." he thought to himself.

Lilith would then start talking with "So....you know much about witches then Matt?"

He shook his head "Not really, I mean I know my Sis is one. And so was my Mom. But anything beyond that no."

Lilith nodded and leaned forward, putting a hand on her chin in thought. "Right....it's just I wanted to show you something."

Matt's interest was piqued, he had to investigate. "Go on, I'll hear you out. Remember what your Mom said though." he said. The last thing Matt wanted was to cause problems right now, that could increase the chance of his girl side being shown. And that was something he didn't dare entertain.

After hearing that Lilith took a sigh and stood up "Have you by any chance heard of a Neko?"

The word was odd, something Matt had never even heard of. Was it even a word? Matt lifted an eyebrow and said "A what? I don't think I heard that right."

Lilith Mage bit her lower lip, unsure of how to go about this. Before figuring it might be best to explain, or rather show what she was talking about. She muttered something under her breath and.....a pair of small fur tufts appeared on her head. They were the same colour as her hair, just noticeable enough to be seen.

"What's that?! Remember no magic Lilith!" Matt said as his eyes went wide.

Lilith quickly waved her hands in front of Matt, and said "No no it's not magic, it's well....a part of me. I've always had them."

"......What?...." Matt said, tilting his head to one side.

Lilith looked down and fumbled with her hands before saying "What animal do witches usually have Matt? Do you know?"

"A toad? That's one of them anyway, even I know that." Matt said. Upon hearing that Lilith and Matt began bursting into laughter, it was an awkward situation and they both sort of knew that laughing helped defuse it.

Lilith took a happy sigh and then said "What about the other?"

"It's a cat isn't it? But does that mean you are?..." Matt said, putting both hands under his chin in thought. Being from a family of smart people it didn't take long for him to figure out something....

"Yes, sort of. A Neko is a witch who's half human and half cat. They can be identified by the tufts of fur on their head, Mom says I need to keep them hidden unless I trust someone a lot." Lilith said.

Matt lightly coughed and said "I see, well don't worry. You can trust me Lilith, so why are you half cat then? Are your Sisters the same as you?" as much as he didn't want to admit it those tufts of fur looked rather....nice. Like it suited Lilith quite well.

Lilith shook her head "No Mom told me that about 1 in 100 witches are Neko's, from what we know witches hundreds of years ago tried to cast a spell to gain the form of their cats. Something went wrong though, nobody knows what happened. But any witch, once they reach the age of 6 can have small tufts of fur which mark them as a Neko. Mom says that some even get tails, but I've not got one." she said.

Matt was silent, taking this all in. He had never heard of something like this, he assumed that all witches were the same. Just scary girls that could use something the opposite of science, but Lilith was being so upfront and honest with this. He couldn't help but feel impressed, and honoured considering that Lilith had said it was a close kept secret.

"What do you think Matt?" Lilith said with her arms behind her back, a minor blush on her face.

"I've never heard of what you've just said, but I believe you. Thank you for telling me this Lilith." Matt nodded with a smile.

The girl closed her eyes, smiled and let out a happy giggle.
1542123.title: She drags Matt to her room.

Ms Mage giggled. "Lilith is a Neko girl." Relief in her voice, she said. "She and Matt should get along nicely."

Meanwhile, inside Lilith's bedroom, Matt blushed as he revealed two small tufs of fur on his own head. "Father tells me that I am a Neko wolf." To Lilith's surprise and delight, he explained. "I think it would be cooler though if I were a werewolf."

Lilith giggled. "You are cuter as a Neko wolf."

Matt blushed even more, the ears on his head wiggling. Lilith laughed then...
15421232.title: Ms Mage has a word with Matt's Father

154212322.content:
In response to Matt's ears moving Lilith too decided to showcase her ability to do so, Matt apparently didn't realise he had just done this and said "How'd you do that?"

Lilith snickered and pointed at his ears, saying "It's easy, just pay attention to them and focus. I learned that from a girl, she said that she used it to cheer up her boyfriend when he was tired."

Matt nodded and closed his eyes, and sure enough they were moving back and forth. Lilith clapped her hands, moving to stroke one of Matt's fur tufts. Instantly Matt's hands moved up to his head "Hey!"

1542123222.content:
Unknown to all, dad and Ms Mage were planning to test if Matt's and Lilith's love was real. "I believe this is a fine opportunity to set a mad test into motion." Smiling, dad suggested.

"Please allow a witch test." Politely, Ms Mage stated. "I have the perfect test in mind."

"Elaborate." Flatly, dad demanded.

"Protective relatives." Giggling, Ms Mage replied. "I have a nice in the other side of the rift who is also a Neko Girl. She will want the right to approve it not approve of her coudin's young suitor."

Dad chuckled madly. "My other sons would be very picky about who sweeps their youngest mad sibling off his feet." Amused, he countered. "Proceed with your test."

"Aunt Kayo?" Looking worried, she asked. "It takes a lot of magic to make a call across the rift. What's wrong?"

Minutes later....
1542123222.title: A test that spans two worlds.

15421232221.content:
Ripples appeared in the mirror as if the glass had somehow turned into water. Jenny walked through with a few friends following. She was of average height with long brown hair kept in a pony tail and tomboy like features. "It's good to see you again, aunt Kayo." Smiling, she said.

Kayo nodded, keeping a neutral stance, and turned to her friends. "Please introduce me to your friends."

Jenny motioned to her four friends. "Aunt Kayo, please say hello to Ryan Carlson, Chon Kay, Amy Don, and Charlie Ren." motioning to each person, she said.

Ryan was also of average size but clearly well built. He had dark blonde hair to his ears and blue eyes hidden behind a pair of sunglasses. He wore a black leather jacket, T-shirts with Japanese writing on it and old nikes with blue jeans.

Chon was a few inches shorter than Ryan but just as well built. He had black hair, slicked back, and wore a red cloth over his eyes. Kayo raised a curious eyebrow but made no statement.

Amy was slightly shorter than Jenny with long black hair, emerald blue eyes, and doll like features. Kayo's eyes widened slightly seeing her and bowed respectively. This surprised Amy but she bowed in return so not to seem rude.

Charlie was rather short for a boy around twelve years of age. He had dust blond hair and curiously deep blue eyes. Kayo's jaw dropped seeing him but she quickly recovered and smiled politely.

"What a unique group of friends you have here, Jenny." After a pause, Kayo said. "Two warriors, a mage and a sleeper."

"Aunt Kayo..." Blushing slightly, Jenny protested.

"Excuse me..." Curious, Charlie stated. "I can see the two warriors but a mage and a sleeper?"

Kayo chuckled kindly. "A mage is a person, typically female, who is a natural at defending herself and others from magic." Politely, she explained. "A sleeper is a person, typically male, who possesses great power but has not yet discovered it."

"Oh..." Confused, Charlie said. "What power do I have then?"

"That you must discover on your own in your own time." Kindly, Kayo replied. "If it is rushed, you will not be ready to control it." She then turned to Jenny. "Lilith took Matt Moray into her bedroom to talk. His older sister is in the living room with my other two daughters. She is a witch as well."

Jenny nodded then turned to her friends. "Remember, things are a bit backwards here." Serious, she said. "Mad science is the dominate power and magic is the minority."

"It may interest you that my daughters are graduated cadets from Rogue hunter academy." Proudly, Kayo said. "They will be jointing the magical police forces soon."

"Rogue hunters?" Curious, Chon asked.

"There are strict laws that protect the delicate peace between mad scientists and witches." Turning to Chon, Kayo explained. "The rogue hunters are police officers who enforce those laws." She gulped. "The punishments are just as strict."

"Interesting." Adjusting his blindfold, Chon said.

"I hope you can help me sort out this matter with Lilith." Sighing, Kayo said. "She's so fragile, I don't want to see her get hurt with rejection or worse..."

Jenny sighed, looking at Ryan. "Lilith is like me, a Neko." Softly, she said. "As such, she has fragile emotions so we must be certain this boy's affections are genuine."

Ryan nodded. "I suggest you and I have a friendly chat with this boy." Smiling, he suggested. "You can get a lot of information out of a pleasant conversation."

"Amy and I can talk with the boy's older sister." Casually, Chon stated. "Perhaps we can get a few clues from her as to the kid's intentions." He smiled slightly. "That and I am curious about these rogue hunters that were mentioned."

"They exist in our world but they are more used for 'high priority' cases." Wincing, Jenny said.

"What do you want me to do?" Curious, Charlie asked.

"With your friends' permission, you can come with me." Kindly, Kayo said. "I want to have a word with Matt Moray's father and sons."

After a moment, Ryan nodded. "I expect you to keep him safe, Ms Mage."

Who does the story follow from here?

Chon nodded. "Shall we begin?" He motioned with his finger. "Come at me."

Chon grinned as he easily dodged the blast before catching Serena's leg in mid flight and threw her into Maxine. Both fell to the floor with surprised looks on their faces. Chon merely shook his head. "That combination might work on a novice witch but I'm a trained professional." In a neutral tone, he said. "Get up. Try again."

"We're just testing the waters." Rising to her feet, Serena said.

"The waters are still but deep." Serious Chon said. "Don't stare into them too long; they will stare right back at you."

Maxine shivered slightly. "That's creepy." Frowning, she said. "I'm impressed that you can fight the way you do, being blind."

Chon cracked a slight grin. Viva reacted the same way when he stated that quote. "Blindness is a relative term. There are those who have sight but can't see what is right in front of them."

"You are a fighter and a scholar." Smiling, Serena said. "You would make a fine witch." Seeing Chon's face harden, she quickly added, "That is a compliment in our world."

Chon's face instantly softened. "Let us continue."

Serena and Maxine nodded. "Agreed."
15421232221223.title: Starmage Dojo.

154212322212232.content:
Meanwhile Amy was sitting to the left of Chon, lifting an eyebrow as she saw his head slightly drooping. And the man had been oddly silent this entire time, granted the goth girl knew that the blind man was often quiet. But not like this, usually he was alert at all times. Sometimes Amy swore that he had eyes in the back of his head, that or was enhanced senses thanks to his lack of sight.

But Chon once told her that he could still see people, but he never proceeded further with it. Jessica tapped Amy on the shoulder and said "Do you know this guy?"

Amy sighed "Yeah you can say that."

"What do you mean? Didn't the pair of you come with that Jenny girl?" Jessica said.

"Well....." Amy paused, seeing if Chon was going to respond. But he didn't, either he was busy with something or he just didn't care. That big blindfold of his made it hard to tell what he was thinking sometimes. Chon didn't say anything though, so Amy decided to speak.

"Yeah, we all live in the same dorm back at Starmage Academy. Chon is....different now though." Amy said.

"Different? As in what?" Jessica said, the man looked really curious with that ruby red cloth over his eyes. If he even had any there.

"He doesn't talk about his past all that much, but something happened. To him and his Brother, and he used to really hate magic. I mean he really did. Every day he'd spout nonsense about how magic is a blight on the world and nothing good can ever come from it." Amy recalled the times where he'd do that. Usually when he looked at a guy turned into a girl.

"Bet that must have been pretty annoying sometimes." Jessica said.

"Don't know the half of it, man the arguments we used to have. You know how you get told the dangers of improper use of magic? Well I think Chon's the prime example of a victim of it, only he ends up becoming a bigger danger than the rogue witches."

"Why's that?"

Amy took a deep sigh, making brief eye contact with Jessica before saying "I heard rumours that....he killed witches in the past. Before he came to Starmage Academy."

Jessica was silent for a second before saying "What? But magic and mad science can't kill."

"Chon doesn't use either, he claims that he uses the Asian art of chi manipulation. Whatever that is. He's able to have his fists glow with a blue aura, and he can move at lightning speeds." Amy said.

"Really? Can't say I've heard of stuff like that." Jessica said, wondering more and more on just who the hell this guy was.

"Yeah, but he's gotten better I suppose. Better person."

"How so?"

Amy then cracked a smile and said "There was this rogue witch that we dealt with one time, who used her daughters like slaves. Mind control collars and stuff. But then it became ironic, the person who despises magic and witches. Ends up taking two young witch girls into his care."

Jessica gave a small laugh "Yeah that is a twist, do you have any idea why he did that?"

"No clue, maybe it was they're the same age as he was when whatever happened to him happened. He's gotten better, still hates magic like a passion. But he does seem to admit it can be useful, Charlie was kinda the same. Only it was because he didn't know magic could be done in a good way, he was raised by a rogue witch so ya know...." Amy spoke.

"Do you.....care for him?" Jessica said.

Amy turned to face Jessica and blushed "N-No way! I....The only thing we've really done are argue, and live under the same roof. I mean don't get me wrong, he's buff as hell under that shirt. Covered in scars and stuff, and he knows how to fight most certainly. But he just gets into arguments with witches over the slightest faults sometimes." folding her arms after it.

Suddenly Chon's head jerked up, and he smirked. Amy's mouth went agape and she looked away at both Jessica and the newly woken Chon. Just her luck.
154212322212232.title: Amy sees Chon in a trance.

choices: Serena and Maxine hunt a rouge, Chon joins them.
154212322212233.content:
A couple of hours later the dojo had been more or less wrecked, Chon had been getting the hang of the reality trance. Several weapons, hook swords and Jian's had been implanted into the ground. The sounds in the room were that of blades swinging, and spells being cast.

Maxine and Serena were sitting down, panting and drained. They hadn't been this knackered since their final test as rouge hunter cadets, nicks and cuts adorned their arms. Presents from their opponent, the blind marital artist Chon Kay.

Chon meanwhile had discarded his shirt, and was on one knee. His blindfold had also been removed by him, exposing the injuries that lurk below it. He had no eyes, he tore them out years ago. Chon had refused to have the injury healed, although with the technologies that mad scientists had he could easily have new ones. The girls tried to avoid looking at his eyes too close, Serena could have sworn she saw a bug crawling around them.

"You...certainly live up to the name of blind vengeance, whew." Maxine muttered.

Chon altered his stance so he was sitting Indian style on the floor, his Jian's planted blade first into the floor. "You fight well. The rouge witches I've fought usually turned and fled the instant I drew near, if they ever did spot me." he said in response.

The girls nodded, in the fight Chon had somehow teleported. And sent Maxine flying. He explained that it wasn't magic. Chon had simply learned to use his chi energy to move at a short distance at such a fast speed, that to the normal eye it looked as if was teleporting.

There was an awkward moment, and then Serena asked "Why have you hunted rouge witches?"

Chon frowned, his brows narrowing. He then said "My Brother was killed, rouge witches fried him to death on my birthday when I was just a kid. You can guess what I did...." pointing at where his eyes should have been.

"Did you really kill them?" Maxine asked.

The blind man sighed and replied with "Yes I did, most of them anyway. The ones I've not found are still kicking, I don't see them in the nightmares. Me standing on one side of a battlefield, all the people I've slayed stand on the other. They stay in a single file line as I rip them limb from bloody limb."

There was a silence in the room, although Chon placed his blindfold back onto his head. "But I like to think I've changed. I'm not that man anymore, if my older Brother was alive he'd say I have been nothing but a fool. I'm really glad I met my adopted children."

"You have kids?" Serena said with interest.

Chon nodded. "Yeah Viva and Vogue, they were daughters to a rouge witch. They were the same age when I lost my Brother, I...didn't want magic to ruin them like it did me. I swore not to let that happen, it left me a broken person. Kami only knows what might have happened to them." he said.

"What do you think of witches?" Maxine asked.

Chon turned his head to her and said "If you had asked me that a year ago...I would have stated that witches and their magic were a blight on the world. That they couldn't be trusted, that sooner or later they'd abuse their power and fall to evil. Now? To be honest I still have that view, but I grant exceptions to those who earn it. My daughters and the pair of you for example."

Serena nodded and said "When we were training to be rouge hunter cadets we were told stories about you, how magic when used for evil purposes could create one's own demons. All rouge witches are in fact ordered to either kill or flee away from you."

"I'm not surprised. They are free to bring it on. I think we've spent enough time on this, let's return to where we where." Chon said standing up.

The girls nodded and Chon felt his surroundings change, and sure enough he heard the familiar voice of Amy.
"What the hell were you doing? I swear it's hard to tell what you think sometimes besides burning witches." she snarked at him.

Chon huffed and replied "I was training, you should dip into your own mind from time to time Amy. You may learn something." as he nodded his head at Maxine and Serena. He detected their chi energy.

1542123222122331.content:
Later on in a small chapel Serena and Maxine were dressed in black witch robes, with them were another girl who was also a part of this hunt. Night had fallen and the moon's light shone through the glass windows, perfect for a shady gathering.

"So we're hunting a rouge for real this time?" Serena asked.

"Indeed, this will be our final test." Maxine said while fiddling with a strand of her hair, if the girls were honest they were a tad nervous. After all who wouldn't be? Rouge witch hunters were the elite of the elite, to be one took hard training and dedication.

The other girls was Natasha Wealth, a girl who was from a long line of witches who were highly adept at healing magic. It was most likely going to be needed for tonight, not for the people involved. But rather the victims of the rouge witch they were pursuing.

The door to the chapel opened and in walked a woman named Tonya Powers, a woman in her early 20's. She was a noted rouge hunter/teacher at the school the girls are went to, and this was to be their final test before they passed and became full fledged rouge witch hunters.

Tonya then walked towards the girls, before stopping and smirking. She looked up to the rafters above and said "You can come down now, you might as well meet who you are going to work with tonight."

The girls apart form Serena and Maxine looked confused, before suddenly a flash of light appeared. And a Chinese Jian stabbed itself onto the floor near them, Natasha let out a small scared yelp as a figure then landed above it. Perfectly placing himself atop it.

The figure wore a red cloth over his face, it was Chon. Dressed in a black leather trenchcoat, with his battle attire shown under it.

http://www.fightersgeneration.com/np8/ch...

"It's...It's him! The blind vengeance! Slayer of witches!" Natasha shouted before producing a flame in her hands.

"How the hell did you get here?! Are you planning to fight us?" she said trying to advance towards him.

Chon was unfazed and folded his arms while balancing on his sword. "Ancient Chinese secret, that's how I got here." he muttered in a deadpan tone.

Tonya then quickly clamed the girl down by saying "Relax, he is working with us tonight."

Maxine smirked and said "Do you always announce your presence like that? I thought you were not seen till it was too late."

Chon returned the smirk and got off his Jian, grabbing it and placing it back in his sheath. "Your leader was the one who requested I come down."

"Glad you did, I'm sure you know everyone apart from Natasha. If you get injured you'll be pleased to know she's a highly skilled healer witch." Tonya said.

The girl gave a small wave, everyone at the school heard of Chon Kay. Although they blew his story a bit out of proportion, but that was for another time. They had business to attend to, although Chon gave her a nod and said "I have a friend who practises the art of magical healing, I'll admit it can be useful."

Tonya then went over to a table and took out a folder, and said "Our target is Lily Sweetie, you may know here as a borderline rouge witch. She and her little pal Samantha love to cause trouble on boys and girls, both witch and non witch alike. Although she's been going too far this time."

"What is her crimes?" Chon asked, fingers flicking the hilts of his twin Jian's.

"She had been using magical stone epoxy to trap her victims, so that they appear made of stone. Those covered in it can't move or talk while in it. It's purpose is to encase someone in a safe barrier to help heal their wounds, however Lily enjoys using it to torment people. Just because she can, she has quite the collection. And the law is calling her now." Tonya explained.

All the girls could sense Chon's anger, witches like Lily took away his Brother. Killing him without a second thought, like a human would do with an empty cola can. "What's the plan?" Chon asked.

"Simple, Chon you can attack from the roof of the house. Serena and Maxine will approach from the back while me and Natasha will take the front, that's where she's placed her victims. We'll get them out while you and the Mage siblings focus on Lily, once all the victims are out will move to assist." Tonya stated.

With that everyone nodded and they got into a large van, with Chon sitting in the back. He was muttering in Chinese while ignoring everyone else.

"Does anyone know what he's saying?" Natasha asked her friends.

"It seems he's praying." Serene muttered.

"To who?"

"To China's God of war, I hope we don't have blood on our hands." Maxine muttered.

Chon then spoke up with "I've got enhanced senses you know, I can hear you trying to keep it quiet. If your worried that I'll turn Lily into pieces then don't be, I'm not that man anymore. Just offering my words up to Guan Yu before I get started."

Charlie sighed and then slowly nodded "It was hard, my Mother was actually a rouge. And her daughters had magic, in Britain where I'm from we're immune to gender switching magic. And since I couldn't be a witch like them they....treated me like a slave."

In an instant, he transformed into a wolf puppy and began to growl and yip at the two visitors. Jenny rose a hand to her mouth to hide an amused grin as she struggled not to laugh. Matt looked so adorable, it was difficult to take his growling seriously.

"You got to be kidding me." Half grinning, Ryan muttered. "This is the big bad mad scientist?"

Lilith giggled. "Easy, big guy!" pulling the puppy back. "This is my cousin, Jenny and her friend, Ryan."

Matt paused then turned around, sticking his tiny tail in the air before walking back to Lilith. Jenny could not contain her laughter at that point as Ryan merely shook his head. "What a little hero."

Matt transformed back into his human form, pouting. "Give me a break!" Protesting, he whined. "I just started learning a few weeks ago!"

Ryan chuckled. "At least you have the right instincts, kid." Smiling, he said.
154212322213112112.title: A little hero.

1542123222131121121.content:
"You might want to know that magic is strong within you." Serious, Ryan said. "You might want to avoid using your powers around Lilith and your sister."

"Well, yeah." Shrugging, Matt said. "Mommy was a witch." He winced. "Why can't I use my powers around them, they know magic is real."

"What Ryan is trying to say is that too much magic could change you into a girl as well... for life." Gently, Jenny said. "On the bright side, you will have the power of magic."

Matt reacted just as Jenny had expected. "Ew! I like Lilith but to be a girl... No way!"

"Then don't use your powers around her or your sister." Firmly but kindly, Ryan said. "Your chances to remain male will likely improve as you age and become more powerful."

"That goes for you as well, Lilith." Patiently, Jenny said. "You don't want to change your friend into a girl for life, do you?"

Lilith shook her head. "No. I- I really like him."

"Then its settled." Serious, Ryan said. "When you two are together, there will be no magic or mad science in use. It is the only way you two will remain together. Not only as friends but as a potential couple years down the line."

Matt and Lilith nodded, smiling.

15421232221313.content:
James began to laugh maniacally before he waved his hand. Charlie gasped feeling an intense feeling in his mind. It was emotional pain. Charlie immediately fell to his knees, shivering and crying. "Mommy, no!" Miserable, he whimpered. "Please don't! It hurts when you do that!"

Kayo winced then turned to James, fire in her eyes. "What did you do to him!?" Angry, she demanded.

Before James could respond, a large ghostly flame ignited in Charlie's hand. Kayo instantly sensed magic and took a step away, fearful. "You sparked a transformation!"

James smile vanished, replacing it with a dead seriousness. "First, the emotional pain was already there, I merely released it." Ice in his voice, he said. "Second, that pain was serving as a lock, holding his true power, keeping it from being discovered."

"What- What is this!?" Shaken, Charlie asked. "Boys aren't supposed to have magic!"

Nathan sighed, throwing James a 'we'll talk later' look. He then walked over to charlie knelled before him. He gently urged him to make a fist, canceling the flame. "You do have magic, lad." Calmly, he explained. "However, you are not a witch."

"Then what am I?" Crying, Charlie asked. "Am I a freak?"

Nathan chuckled. "No, dear boy!" Amused, he replied. "You are a human familiar!"

"A what?" Raising an eyebrow, Charlie asked.

"A familiar is an animal, likely a cat or crow that possesses unimaginable magical power." His smile gone, Tex chimed in. "While they can not use it, they can grant some or all of it to a witch or her coven to greatly increase their powers."

"A human familiar is very rare." Offering a chair, Nathan said. "For that human familiar to be a boy is extremely rare. You, Charlie, are literally one in a billion."

Charlie rose to his feet and accepted the chair that was offered. "This is a lot to take in." Wincing, he said. "Are you saying my emotional pain was keeping it locked away?"

"Given what you told me on the way here, Charlie, I'd guess that your mother was trying to get at that power you possess." Darkly, Kayo said. "Now that it has been released, I fear you will need protection as many witches will want you for that power you hold."

Charlie began to cry all over again only Nathan waved his hand, causing him to become calm again. "There is a catch to being a human familiar, Charlie." Serious, he said. "Only you can decide who to grant the power to and who you will not."

"It can't be stolen?" Curious, Charlie asked.

"Not unless they want to be blasted with raw magic." Smirking, James replied. "That is what you have within you, by the way." He chuckled. "From what I can tell, your power would give the head witch a run for her money."

"I am sending a note back with you, Charlie." scribbling several lines onto a piece of paper, Nathan said. "The moment anyone unfolds it, they will see what had transpired here."

He then pointed at James. He was hurled by an invisible force like a rag doll and slammed into a door, turning it into splinters as he flew through. Charlie's jaw dropped as Nathan then calmly folded the piece of paper and gave it to him.

"Why did you do that?" Worried for James, Charlie asked.

"We are responsible for our every action, young man." Serious, Nathan replied. "He made you cry so I gave him a reason to cry in return. This eliminates any need for a third party to seek revenge."

James then walked through the door, tears swelling in his eyes. "Cheap shot, father." Annoyed, he said.

Charlie shook his head. "Here I thought Juan Smith was a weird guy..." Bemused, he thought.

Ten minutes later, Charlie returned to the Mage residence to...

info.brief_description: One of your relatives is a mad scientist and will change your life.
info.description:
You play the role of Jessica Moray; a twelve going on thirteen year old girl who finds a Chaotic Science book in the sitting room of her home which belongs to one of the male members of your family.

Jessica has a positive relationship with her father, Nathan (34) though he tends to be overly protective of her. She has a close relationship with her older brother, James (14) despite his mysterious one year absence from home. She has a good relationship with her twin brother, Tex, (12) though he occasionally drives her crazy. She has a fair relationship with her little brother, Mat (7) despite the fact he can be a challenge at times with his 'girl phobia'.

Your closest friends are Jack Stone (12), living to your right, and Tonya Holmes (12), living to your left. They are in your class and you all get along very well. You are beginning to see Jack as more than a friend but are fearful to admit it just yet. Tonya has a crush on your twin brother, Tex but she has not yet told him.

Some rules:
1. Mad Science, in this story, is a form of 'magic' but in technological terms.

2. Only boys with 'the gift' can work 'mad science'.

3. The powers of Mad Science (chaotic energy) can not kill or resurrect.

4. Only human/humanoid transformations (no becoming a rabbit or a frog for example)

5. Inanimate objects can be transformed into robots or magical creatures.

6. Mischief of various forms are allowed. Swapping the closet door for the hall door is a good example. Drive your sibling crazy!

7. True magic and witches are allowed. Same rules above apply except only girls can work true magic.

8. You may add new characters.
